Mainstage Broadcast
tags.description: Don’t miss the Mainstage Broadcast of Keynotes, Sneaks, Creativity Super Sessions, and Luminary Sessions. You’ll get the latest creative industry trends and updates to Adobe Creative Cloud and be inspired by stories from top luminary speakers.

cards.description: Get a front-row seat to the latest Adobe products, features, and innovations. See how we can help you make anything you can imagine.
cards.sessionTitle: Opening Keynote

eventSpeakers.description:
Shantanu Narayen is chairman and chief executive officer of Adobe, one of the largest and most diversified software companies in the world.

Adobe’s mission is to change the world through digital experiences, serving a large customer base from students to business communicators to the world’s largest enterprises. As CEO, Shantanu has transformed the company into an industry innovator by pioneering a cloud-based subscription model for its creative suite, establishing the global standard for digital documents, and creating and leading the explosive digital experience category. Today, he’s driving the company’s strategy to unleash creativity for all, accelerate document productivity, and power digital business.

Under Shantanu’s leadership, Adobe has achieved record revenue and industry recognition for its inclusive, innovative, and exceptional workplace, including being continuously named a Great Place to Work and a Most Admired Company by Fortune.

Shantanu joined Adobe in 1998 as vice president and general manager of its engineering technology group. He became president and COO in 2005, CEO in 2007, and chairman of the board in 2017.

Shantanu is vice chairman of the US-India Strategic Partnership Forum and sits on the board of Pfizer. He previously served as a director of Dell and is a past member of the U.S. President’s Management Advisory Board. Shantanu has been recognized by several publications as one of the world’s leading executives, including Barron’s World’s Best CEOs and Fortune Businessperson of the Year lists, and named a Top CEO by Glassdoor based on employee feedback. He is a recipient of India’s civilian honor Padma Shri and the Economic Times Global Indian of the Year award.

Before joining Adobe, Shantanu held product development roles at Apple and Silicon Graphics before cofounding an early photo-sharing startup, Pictra.

Shantanu holds five patents. He has a bachelor’s degree in electronics engineering from Osmania University, a master’s degree in computer science from Bowling Green State University and a master’s degree in business administration from the University of California at Berkeley’s Haas School of Business. Shantanu once represented India in sailing at an Asian regatta.

David Wadhwani is responsible for the success of Adobe’s global Digital Media business across Adobe Creative Cloud and Adobe Document Cloud, including all product management, product marketing, engineering, strategic partnerships, customer support and to go-to-market across geographies. This includes iconic software brands such as Photoshop, Lightroom, Illustrator, InDesign and Acrobat.

David was most recently a Venture Partner at Greylock Partners. Prior to joining Greylock, he was president and CEO of AppDynamics, leading the company as it transformed to a SaaS-first business and became one of the fastest-growing enterprise software companies at the time.

This is David’s second tour of duty at Adobe. He joined Adobe in 2005 through the company’s acquisition of Macromedia, Inc., where he had been vice president of developer products. As senior vice president and general manager of Adobe’s Digital Media business, David played an instrumental role in advancing the company’s category leadership, expanding into new markets and contributing to its successful transformation to a cloud-based subscription business.

David holds a bachelor’s degree in computer science from Brown University and serves on the Brown computer science department advisory board. He is also on the digital advisory board of The Metropolitan Museum of Art and on the board of trustees for StoryCorps and the Fine Arts Museums of San Francisco.

As Senior Vice President and General Manager, Creative Product Group for Adobe, Ashley Still leads product, engineering, business and go-to-market teams across Creative Cloud, as well as B2B and partnerships across Adobe’s Digital Media Organization.

In her role, Ashley oversees all aspects of the company’s flagship creative applications, including Photoshop, Premier Pro, Illustrator and Lightroom. Her team is also responsible for Adobe’s strategic partnership work with technology companies globally, including Apple, Microsoft and Google; and driving Creative Cloud’s fast-growing mobile app business, and for the marketing campaigns that makes Adobe the market-leader in creative technologies.

Previously Ashley served as Adobe’s Senior Vice President, Digital Media Marketing, Strategy & Global Partnerships, and before to that Vice President and General Manager, Adobe Creative Cloud for Enterprise. During her tenure with Creative Cloud’s enterprise business, Ashley’s team delivered an integrated content creation, collaboration and publishing solution that securely enables brands to create exceptional design and content.

Prior to that, Ashley was Senior Director of Product & Marketing for Adobe Primetime, an Internet television platform used by Comcast, Turner, NBC Sports and other global media companies to deliver TV content and dynamic advertising to any Internet device. Under Ashley’s leadership, Adobe Primetime won an Emmy Award for the Adobe Pass TV-Everywhere service.

Ashley joined Adobe in 2004 following her internship with the company and held several product management positions for Adobe Photoshop.

Still earned her Bachelor of Arts degree from Yale University and her master’s degree from Stanford Graduate School of Business.

Deepa Subramaniam is Vice President, Product Marketing for Creative Product Group at Adobe, where she is responsible for driving Adobe’s digital imaging, photography, video, design and generative AI businesses forward.

Deepa has over 18 year's experience leading product teams to collaboratively build innovative digital products as well as a proven track record in strategy and execution, while acting as a frequent advisor to founders, CEOs and CPOs on product strategy, product execution and organizational optimization.

Prior to Adobe, Deepa served as the ACLU’s first ever Chief Technology and Digital Officer where she led the Digital, Engineering, Product and Design teams, as Vice President of Product and Design at Kickstarter where she helped revamp the platform for the next decade of creative campaigning and as Director of Product at Hillary for America, where her she led product development for online fundraising, voter registration and get out the vote initiatives.

Varun Parmar is the General Manager of Adobe GenStudio, an industry-defining, generative AI-first application that enables marketing teams to quickly plan, create, manage, activate across apps and publishers, and measure on-brand content. Previously, Varun was Chief Operating Officer at Miro, a digital collaboration platform, where he led a global team of over a thousand people across product management, engineering, design, customer engagement, and partnerships. Earlier, he was Chief Product Officer at Box, a leader in enterprise content management, co-founded a document collaboration start-up that was acquired by Box, and held senior product remits at Dell EMC. A returnee to Adobe, Varun also spent six years at the company earlier in his career focused on corporate strategy, as well as product management for Adobe Acrobat and Document Cloud. Varun graduated from MIT with a joint master’s degree in business and engineering.

Anna McNaught is a digital/Photoshop artist, photographer, designer, and full-time traveler. She spends most of the year on the road creating art on the go and running her business, Leave The Map, with her husband James. Anna has worked with Adobe, NASA, Yeti, Crocs, Audi, Marriott, Getty Images, and 5-star hotels around the world.

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Sr. Design Evangelist for Next Gen Creative Pros

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Adding Depth and a Wow Factor to Your Illustrative Work
Sign Your Work with Adobe Content Authenticity

eventSpeakers.description:
Hello everyone, my name is Michael Fugoso. If you are familiar with my work you probably know me via my Instagram alias FUGSTRATOR . I am an illustrator/designer originally from San Diego, now functioning in Austin, TX. I've mainly done illustrative work for some of the largest aerospace companies out there, like NASA, Boeing, Blue Origin, Ariane Group and more, and I've also done plenty of official illustrative work for massive companies like Oracle, IBM, Salesforce, Volvo and many more. And I'm now thrilled to be on the Global Evangelism team at Adobe!

Most of my life I wasn't in the professional artist/designer world. Through age 29 I lived what is perceived by many a “normal life,” going through business school and eventually working as a banker. At age 30 the arts called to me and my life changed from there.

I am 40 years old now. In the ten years of creating and illustrating a ton of spaceships, rockets, jet planes, and robots, I luckily found what I love in this latter part of my life.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Next-Level Techniques and Exciting New Features in Photoshop

eventSpeakers.description: Meet Paul Trani, Principal Director Evangelist at Adobe. Paul has a true passion for empowering designers to unleash their creativity and embrace cutting-edge technology to craft awe-inspiring content. Over the past 25 years, Paul has honed his skills as an award-winning visual designer, a dedicated instructor, and an engaging public speaker. When he’s not traveling Paul enjoys designing and producing instructional content for Adobe and his own social channels where he loves connecting with fellow creators. And when he manages to sneak a sliver of free time you can catch him playing all the racquet sports and traveling for fun.

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Sr. Quality Engineer and Animation Explorer
eventSpeakers.description:
Dacia Saenz cut her teeth in Austin, TX working in television and film productions for CNBC, PBS, and the Sundance Foundation. When not in production, she put her wordsmith skills to work and was published (under pen name) in “The Kicked Out Anthology,” chosen as one of the top books of 2011 by the LGBTQ Roundtable of the American Library Association.

During her stint in Seattle, she earned her Masters of Communication in Digital Media from the University of Washington, debuted two short films at the 2012 and 2013 Seattle International Film Festivals, and was honored to receive the Audience Choice Award at the Next Fifty film festival. Before joining Adobe in 2015, Dacia co-produced social justice centered multi-media campaigns in Thailand and El Salvador for the Seattle Globalist and the UW’s Center for Human Rights.

These days, Dacia is obsessed with User Experience in Creative tools. She plays in After Effects all day long. Dacia is a budding Animator, JavaScript, and Processing nerd. Synthesizers are her number one jam.

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Principal Director, Creative Cloud Evangelist and Community Advocate
eventSpeakers.description: Terry White – Principal Director, Creative Cloud Evangelist and Community Advocate for Adobe, Inc. Terry has been with Adobe for 27 years and has extensive knowledge of Adobe’s Creative Professional product line. In his current position, he leads the charge of getting customers excited and educated about Adobe Creative Cloud products and services. In 2016 Terry White was the 34th inductee into the Photoshop Hall of Fame. He has been active in the industry for over 30 years. Terry is the host of the top ranked award winning Adobe Creative Cloud TV and has one of the most popular channels on YouTube. He is also the author of Secrets of the Adobe Bridge and co-author of The iPhone Book, The iPhone Book 2nd Edition, The iPhone Book 3rd Edition, The iPhone Book 4th Edition, The iPhone Book 5th Edition, The iPhone Book 6th Edition, and InDesign CS/CS2 Killer Tips. Terry is a key presenter at major industry shows around the world.

Danielle Morimoto leads the design team responsible for Adobe Firefly and Generative AI on the Machine Intelligence and New Technologies team at Adobe. She helps define the most compelling experiences and emerging technologies by uncovering untapped potential, ultimately identifying how people could be using Adobe in the future. She’s an avid road cyclist, NBA Golden State Warriors fan and lover of ice cream.

cards.sessionTitle: Inspiration Keynote

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Chief Strategy Officer and EVP, Design & Emerging Products
eventSpeakers.description:
Scott Belsky leads corporate strategy and development, is responsible for design across the Digital Media and Digital Experience businesses, and is driving incubation of some of Adobe’s fastest growing emerging products. As Chief Strategy Officer, Scott plants flags for future opportunities in all of Adobe’s markets and leads investments, engagements, and acquisitions in the startup ecosystem. Scott is Adobe’s design leader, working to continuously uplevel design of all Adobe products. And he leads development of key emerging products: 3D & Immersive products, Adobe Stock & Marketplace, and Behance.

Prior to this role, Scott was Adobe’s Chief Product Officer for five years, leading development of all Creative Cloud products. Under his leadership, the company launched Adobe Express, brought flagship products like Photoshop and Illustrator to web and mobile platforms, incubated our 3D & Immersive products, and created the Content Authenticity Initiative, which fosters attribution for creators and enables transparency in digital content.

Prior to joining Adobe in December 2017, Scott was a venture investor at Benchmark in San Francisco. This is Scott’s second tenure at Adobe. He originally joined the company after it acquired Behance in 2012. At that time, he also led Adobe’s mobile and services strategy for Creative Cloud. Scott co-founded Behance in 2006 and served as its CEO for six years. Over the years, Scott has pursued other projects in the creative and investor communities. Those projects include 99U, Behance’s creative think tank and conference, and his two best-selling books, “The Messy Middle” and “Making Ideas Happen.”

Scott has been an advisor on design and product management for leading companies and institutions, including Pinterest, Uber, sweetgreen, Carta, Cheddar, Flexport, Airtable, OpenSea, Ramp, Ro, and Periscope.

Scott holds a bachelor’s degree from Cornell University and an MBA from Harvard Business School. He serves on the advisory board of Cornell University’s Entrepreneurship Program; and the board of trustees for the Smithsonian Cooper Hewitt National Design Museum.

Stacy Martinet has spent her career at the intersection of marketing, media, and technology.

As Adobe’s Vice President of Marketing Strategy and Communications, she leads a global team responsible for internal and external communications, including corporate communications, public affairs, product and customer communications, events, corporate social responsibility, industry analyst relations, as well as worldwide social media and influencer marketing. She first joined Adobe as Sr. Director of Marketing Strategy and Chief of Staff to the Company’s EVP and Chief Marketing Officer.

Before joining Adobe, Stacy was Chief Marketing Officer of Mashable. She was part of the company’s executive team — taking Mashable from a tech blog to a global consumer internet site. As CMO, she guided the company through explosive growth in users and advertisers, three rounds of funding, and a restructuring while architecting the company's marketing and communications strategy and building an integrated marketing organization across brand and demand generation channels.

Prior to Mashable, she spent nearly a decade in corporate communications and digital marketing at The New York Times during the company’s transition to digital which included a transformation of its journalism approach and the introduction of a digital subscription model. She was part of the team that pioneered the company’s first social media strategy and was recognized with the Chairman’s Award for innovation.

She was named by Folio’s Top Women in Media as a Corporate Visionary, as well as named to PR Week’s 40 Under 40 list. Stacy continues to speak and write about digital trends; her work has appeared in Mashable, The New York Times, Ad Week, and Cosmopolitan Magazine.

Stacy holds a patent for viral media content and is a member of several boards, including the Adobe Foundation board, the Ad Council board, and her past service to the New York Women in Communications board. Stacy is a graduate of Towson University.

Devon Rodriguez is the most followed visual artist in the world widely recognized for his hyper-realistic portraits, particularly those drawn or painted on the New York City subway. Born and raised in the Bronx from Puerto Rican and Honduran background, his remarkable journey has been featured in The New Yorker, The New York Times, and on the Today Show. Through the power of social media, Devon uses his platforms to digitally translate his artistic talent to a global audience, creating viral moments with not only strangers he meets on the street, but also notable celebrities such as Joe Biden, Post Malone, Ed Sheeran, Jared Leto, and Robert De Niro. Most recently he has partnered with Meta, Burberry, Coca Cola, and State Farm and launched a comprehensive 7-course education program, designed to teach the intricacies of portrait drawing to individuals of all ages. In the Fall of 2023, Devon's first solo art exhibition garnered overwhelming support with lines stretching around the block. With an impressive collective following of 59 million across various social media platforms such as Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, and Facebook, Devon Rodriguez continues to captivate his multi-generational audience worldwide.

Emonee LaRussa is a 2x Emmy award winning Motion Graphics and Director. For years she has created music visuals for artists like Megan Thee Stallion, Kanye West, Lil Nas X and many more. More recently has been she working with brands such as the Super Bowl LVII, Adobe, The Grammys, Saturday Night Live, and Intel.

Emonee is also the President of JumpStart Designers, a non-profit focused on getting computers to kids in underserved communities. She also provides students with mentorship so that they not only get the tools but the education and opportunities as well.

Jason is a NYC artist, known for bright colors and even brighter themes, commonly found on large scale murals around the world. His work explores the communication of human emotions using organic shapes, bold colors and a strong design aesthetic. Jason has worked with various brands like Coach, Pepsi, Toyota, and Microsoft. He has received global recognition for his work including a Golden Novum Design Award. In 2018, BUMBLE named Jason one of its 100 Most Inspiring New Yorkers. People love Jason for his unforgettable colors and the optimism woven into his work. His relentless positivity and kindness translate across many mediums and applications, and his technicolor murals capture the hearts of everyone who sees them. Jason brings a fresh taste of love and kindness to all of his projects, and desires to use his work to spread love, good vibes, and also do some good in the world.

tags.title: Mainstage Broadcast
tags.description: Don’t miss the Mainstage Broadcast of Keynotes, Sneaks, Creativity Super Sessions, and Luminary Sessions. You’ll get the latest creative industry trends and updates to Adobe Creative Cloud and be inspired by stories from top luminary speakers.

cards.description: Get a sneak peek into what’s brewing in Adobe Research. MAX Sneaks is where Adobe engineers give a first look at potential future technologies, which may or may not make it into upcoming versions of Adobe products.
cards.sessionTitle: MAX Sneaks

eventSpeakers.description:
Awkwafina’s “government name” is Nora Lum. Nora Lum is an Asian American rapper, writer, and actress. Most recently, Lum earned rave reviews for her performance in Lulu Wang's The Farewell. Before that, she was seen in Warner Brothers features Ocean’s 8, directed by Gary Ross, opposite Sandra Bullock and Cate Blanchett and Crazy Rich Asians , directed by Jon Chu, opposite Constance Wu and Michelle Yeoh.

Lum can be seen in the Universal film Neighbors 2 opposite Seth Rogen, Zac Efron & Rose Byrne. She also starred as ‘Rebecca’ in the independent comedy Dude, written and directed by Olivia Milch. She was also the voice of ‘Quail’ in the Warner Bros. animated feature Storks (2016).

In television, Comedy Central ordered 10 episodes of Awkwafina is Nora from Queens, a series which Lum created and will star in, set to premiere in January 2020. Her other TV credits include: Hulu’s Future Man as well as MTV’s Mary + Jane and Girl Code.

She is self-noted for her extensive satire and comical appeal in her music. Nora sold her first book, a travel guide to New York entitled Awkwafina’s NYC published by Penguin Random House.

She hosts a talk show on YouTube for Astronauts Wanted entitled TAWK. Nora is a cast member on MTV’s show Girl Code and Girl Code Live. On October 2, 2018, Lum hosted Saturday Night Live. She has been featured in The New York Times, Cosmopolitan, New York, The Daily Beast, Gothamist, Jezebel, Gawker, Hairpin, HelloGiggles.com, and Bust.

Gabriel Huang joined Adobe research in Feb 2023, his contributions have been chiefly directed towards pioneering technologies that revolutionize video effects editing, making video effects editing easier and more accessible.

Avneet Kaur is a Computer Scientist at Adobe, where she’s spent the past 5 years working on Adobe Illustrator. She started her journey at Adobe as a New College Graduate (NCG) and has contributed to features like version history and share for review. Recently, she’s been involved in text-to-vector technology, further enhancing the tools available for designers.

Kelsey Slay is a graphic designer, content creator, and an Adobe Design Evangelist residing in Tennessee. With her love and passion for art and design, Kelsey aims to empower the next generation of creatives through social media and aid them in starting their own creative journey.

Li-Yi is a research scientist with broad interests in computer graphics and human-computer interaction. His recent focus is on motion graphics, with contributions to Fresco motion, Express caption video, and generative animation. He also likes to draw and animate both for fun and research.

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Head of Sound Design AI Research
eventSpeakers.description: Justin is a Senior Research Scientist and member of the Audio Research Group at Adobe Research in San Francisco. Previously he was a senior research scientist at the Music and Audio Research Laboratory and Center for Urban Science and Progress of New York University. His work at Adobe focuses on audio understanding and audio for video, developing technologies for automatic audio tagging, recommending music for a video, detecting filler words in speech, and searching for music that's similar to an input song, to name some examples. His research focuses on the application of machine learning and signal processing to audio & video, with applications in machine listening, audiovisual and multi-modal understanding, representation learning & self-supervision, audio for video, music information retrieval, bioacoustics, environmental sound analysis, and open source software & data.

Veronica is an interdisciplinary designer, artist, and speaker, specialized in creating innovative experiences powered by AI/ML and emerging technology. At Adobe, Veronica led key AI/ML initiatives like Adobe Firefly and created experiences that have reached millions of users worldwide.

Yu Shen is an Adobe Research Scientist, with research experiences cover LLM, computer vision, 3D perception, multi-modality learning, robust learning, etc., in real-world applications like LLM-based copilot, AR/VR/Metaverse, autonomous driving, virtual try-on, etc. He received Computer Science Ph.D. degree in University of Maryland, advised by Prof. Ming Lin.

Mengwei is a Research Scientist at Adobe. She obtained her Ph.D. in Computer Science from NYU in 2023. Her research spans computer vision and deep learning, focusing on robust and controllable image-to-image generation, with diverse applications in image restoration, editing, and composition.

Dr. Shruti Agarwal is a research scientist at Adobe’s Content Authenticity Initiative team. Her research focuses on building tools for multimedia forensics, content authenticity, and content provenance. Before joining Adobe, she was a postdoc at CSAIL MIT and a lecturer for the Computer Vision course in the MIDS program at Berkeley School of Information. She finished her PhD in CS at UC Berkeley under the guidance of Prof. Hany Farid in his world-leading lab on media forensics. During her PhD, she developed semantic tools using soft biometrics for person-specific deepfake detection. Currently, her research has focused on robust watermarking and content attribution. Her research is regularly published in top-tiered Computer Vision conferences and workshops. She has also been part of the organizing committee and was a keynote speaker in the past CVPR workshop on Media Forensics.

Zhiqin is a research scientist at Adobe based in Seattle. He received his PhD and Master's degree from Simon Fraser University, supervised by Prof. Hao (Richard) Zhang, and obtained his Bachelor's degree from Shanghai Jiao Tong University. His research interest is in computer graphics with a specialty in geometric modeling, machine learning, 3D reconstruction, and shape synthesis. He has received numerous awards recognizing his research contribution, including the best student paper award at CVPR 2020, Google PhD Fellowship in 2021, best paper award candidate at CVPR 2023, Alain Fournier Dissertation Award in 2024, and Eurographics PhD Thesis Award in 2024.

Deepa Subramaniam is Vice President, Product Marketing for Creative Product Group at Adobe, where she is responsible for driving Adobe’s digital imaging, photography, video, design and generative AI businesses forward.

Deepa has over 18 year's experience leading product teams to collaboratively build innovative digital products as well as a proven track record in strategy and execution, while acting as a frequent advisor to founders, CEOs and CPOs on product strategy, product execution and organizational optimization.

Prior to Adobe, Deepa served as the ACLU’s first ever Chief Technology and Digital Officer where she led the Digital, Engineering, Product and Design teams, as Vice President of Product and Design at Kickstarter where she helped revamp the platform for the next decade of creative campaigning and as Director of Product at Hillary for America, where her she led product development for online fundraising, voter registration and get out the vote initiatives.

Danielle Morimoto leads the design team responsible for Adobe Firefly and Generative AI on the Machine Intelligence and New Technologies team at Adobe. She helps define the most compelling experiences and emerging technologies by uncovering untapped potential, ultimately identifying how people could be using Adobe in the future. She’s an avid road cyclist, NBA Golden State Warriors fan and lover of ice cream.

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Sr. Quality Engineer and Animation Explorer
eventSpeakers.description:
Dacia Saenz cut her teeth in Austin, TX working in television and film productions for CNBC, PBS, and the Sundance Foundation. When not in production, she put her wordsmith skills to work and was published (under pen name) in “The Kicked Out Anthology,” chosen as one of the top books of 2011 by the LGBTQ Roundtable of the American Library Association.

During her stint in Seattle, she earned her Masters of Communication in Digital Media from the University of Washington, debuted two short films at the 2012 and 2013 Seattle International Film Festivals, and was honored to receive the Audience Choice Award at the Next Fifty film festival. Before joining Adobe in 2015, Dacia co-produced social justice centered multi-media campaigns in Thailand and El Salvador for the Seattle Globalist and the UW’s Center for Human Rights.

These days, Dacia is obsessed with User Experience in Creative tools. She plays in After Effects all day long. Dacia is a budding Animator, JavaScript, and Processing nerd. Synthesizers are her number one jam.

tags.title: Europe, Middle East, and Africa Day 1
Graphic Design and Illustration
tags.description: Bring your creative vision to life. Learn how you can leverage new generative AI tools to assist your content development, create in new ways, and gain more control over your workflows and outputs. Get inspired to revisit the way you approach design.

cards.description:
Discover how to make your illustrations stand out and captivate people with Catalina Estrada, renowned illustrator and pattern designer, who will share her insights on how beauty can communicate powerful messages and influence emotions. Throughout her career, Catalina has witnessed how her vibrant designs, featured on various products, have deeply resonated with people, sparking greater interest in the projects they support.

Catalina will cover:

  • Transforming inspiration: How to transform inspiring elements around you into your own workable images with Adobe Capture and Fresco, making your workflow simple and efficient
  • Streamlining patterns: Tips for speeding up pattern creation and the color adjustment process in Illustrator
  • Visualizing potential: How she uses Photoshop to apply illustrations in realistic mockups to fully visualize their potential beauty
cards.sessionTitle: From Inspiration to Illustration: Believing in the Power of Beauty

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: From Inspiration to Illustration: Believing in the Power of Beauty

eventSpeakers.description:
Catalina is known for her colorful and vibrant designs.

Her ability to reimagine the folkloric visuals of Latin America in a kaleidoscope of color and symmetry has helped her build her own universe based on the simplicity of beauty.

Born and raised in Colombia, Catalina draws inspiration from her childhood surrounded by the rich tapestry of flora and fauna. Catalina graduated with honors in graphic design from the Universidad Pontificia Bolivariana, Medellín (Colombia), following painting and drawing courses at the University of Pittsburg (USA) and fine arts and lithography at the Llotja School of Arts, Barcelona (Spain).

Her distinctive style has led to collaborations with major clients such as Disney, Netflix, Xbox, Paul Smith, Coca-Cola, Microsoft, Camper, Nike, Levis, Smart/Mercedes Benz, Paulo Coelho, Unicef, the municipalities of Barcelona and London, and the Government of India, among others.

Catalina is frequently invited to share her insights and expertise in talks and workshops around the world.

cards.title: Typographic Awareness: How Fonts Impact Meaning

tags.title: Europe, Middle East, and Africa Day 1
Graphic Design and Illustration
tags.description: Bring your creative vision to life. Learn how you can leverage new generative AI tools to assist your content development, create in new ways, and gain more control over your workflows and outputs. Get inspired to revisit the way you approach design.

cards.description:
Each of us sees and experiences the world in our own unique way, including how we interact with type. Join Sarah Hyndman, author of Why Fonts Matter and founder of Type Tasting, as she lays out a toolkit for designers that explores cultural, neuro, and perceptual diversity through the lens of typography. An awareness of how diversity shapes meaning can empower you to create great typography that is both functional and emotionally accessible.

You’ll learn how:

  • We read between the lines and why this varies from person to person
  • Inclusive typography makes an appropriate emotional connection
  • You can separate myth from research-based font recommendations for neurodiversity
cards.sessionTitle: Typographic Awareness: How Fonts Impact Meaning

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Typographic Awareness: How Fonts Impact Meaning

eventSpeakers.description: Sarah Hyndman is the founder of Type Tasting and the author of Why Fonts Matter. She entertains audiences with her unique blend of science, activities and sense-hacking. She’s been measuring your emotional and multisensory responses to fonts since 2013. She’s a TEDx speaker and a judge for the D&AD awards. She appears on TV and radio and has been featured by CNN, Dazed and Wired. She co-publishes studies with Professor Charles Spence of the University of Oxford and is chef Heston Blumenthal’s font science expert. A “wacky take on typography” Creative Review, “F*!*ing genius!” Adobe MAX, “Bizarre” CNN.

tags.title: Europe, Middle East, and Africa Day 1
Graphic Design and Illustration
tags.description: Bring your creative vision to life. Learn how you can leverage new generative AI tools to assist your content development, create in new ways, and gain more control over your workflows and outputs. Get inspired to revisit the way you approach design.

cards.description:
Join graphic artist Anthony Burrill as he shares how he combines his handwork craft skills with digital media to generate uniquely powerful visuals. Bridging the gap between content that is handmade and digitally native, Anthony’s workflow includes turning high-res scanned original letterpress type into artful layouts with Photoshop as his main digital tool.

In this session, you’ll explore:

  • Modern and old techniques to create powerful visual statements
  • Combining analog craft and digital techniques
  • How Anthony creates layouts that are then used to make artwork
cards.sessionTitle: Making a Mark: From Analog to Digital and Back Again

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Making a Mark: From Analog to Digital and Back Again

eventSpeakers.description:
Graphic artist Anthony Burrill combines a knack for simplicity that packs a punch with analogue craft skills and powerful, positive messages. Burrill frequently collaborates with other forward-thinking creatives across disciplines spanning music, architecture, curation, education and more; pushing his traditional discipline of choice, letterpress printing, into bold new territories.

Words, gentle humour, no-nonsense communication and people are at the heart of Burrill’s practice and his distinctive brand of upbeat messaging: its core DNA is one created through a longstanding passion for creativity without limitations, the power of simplicity and an innate curiosity about the world and people in it.

His work is held in the permanent collections of the V&A and The Design Museum in London, The Cooper-Hewitt in New York and has been exhibited in galleries around the world including The Barbican Gallery in London, The Walker Art Center in Minneapolis, The Triennale in Milan and The Stedelijk Museum in Breda.

He has spoken at international design conferences in London, Dublin, Bergen, Berlin, Barcelona, Vienna, Turin, Bucharest, Minneapolis, Toronto, Mumbai, Seoul, Bangkok and led creative workshops in São Paulo, Detroit, Nairobi and Venice.

Burrill was born in Littleborough, Lancashire. After studying Graphic Design at Leeds Polytechnic he completed an MA in Graphic Design at the Royal College of Art, London. He now lives and works in Rye, East Sussex, UK.

tags.title: Europe, Middle East, and Africa Day 1

tags.description: Spark your passion for photography with sessions that will help you build your photography skills and more easily achieve photo editing results you’re proud of using AI-powered tools and workflows, whether you’re taking photos with a smartphone or a mirrorless camera.

cards.description:
Join photographer Alixe Lay to discover how she achieves stylistic consistency in Photoshop Lightroom. In this session, Alixe will discuss how stylistic consistency can elevate storytelling and expand your photography practice. You’ll see practical demonstrations of her workflow for working through sets of images with different lighting conditions covering different subjects, and fine-tuning the edits for visual coherence from start to finish. Alixe will also share how she incorporates new AI features into her workflow to reduce distractions and enable the focus of the story to come through.

You’ll learn how to:

  • Use the power of editing to bring together images covering a range of subjects into a coherent story
  • Create a preset from a new edit
  • Eliminate visual distractions with Generative Remove and Denoise
  • Apply a preset to a set of images
  • Refine the edit for consistency through reference view
cards.sessionTitle: Elevating Storytelling: Stylistic Consistency in Photography

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Elevating Storytelling: Stylistic Consistency in Photography

eventSpeakers.description: Alixe Lay is a Malaysian-born, London-based, self-taught photographer. Her work is rooted in the spirit of place. Alixe first discovered photography by capturing moments of her friends and the Malaysian suburbs she grew up in as a teenager, later cementing her love for the art form through documenting her travels as a young adult. She went on to obtain a doctorate in psychology at UCL before launching into a passionate career in photography. Known for her distinctive use of colour, light, and shadow, her style emphasizes beauty and emotional truth through a dramatized, romantic visual language in documentary storytelling. She is a Leica Emerging Ambassador and a 2022 Lightroom Ambassador. Her clients include Architectural Digest, Aesop, Belmond, Rosewood Hotels, and Sotheby’s, among others.

He is also the creator of Lightroom Everywhere, a multi-faceted program designed to help photographers maximize their use of Adobe Lightroom across various devices by demonstrating its versatility and power in desktop, mobile, and web environments.

Brian is deeply committed to educating photographers of all skill levels through his online courses, on-location workshops, and email newsletter, focusing on improving technical skills and enhancing creative expression. Brian has also authored several educational books and hundreds of articles exploring the technical, creative, and philosophical aspects of photography. His writing contributions to well-known photography magazines and blogs cover a wide range of topics, from gear reviews to post-processing techniques, and are highly regarded for their depth and accessibility.

cards.description:

Join Adobe experts Wes McDermott and Robert Hranitzky to learn practical and professional 3D techniques for creating photorealistic and stylized 3D for motion design.

In this session, you’ll:

  • Learn how to quickly generate parametric materials using Substance 3D Sampler
  • Explore Substance 3D Painter for detailed texturing work and import textured models directly into After Effects composites
  • Dive into native 3D capabilities in After Effects, learning how to work with animated 3D models, custom environment lighting, 3D channels effects, and more

He is a sought-after speaker on many industry events around the globe and enjoys sharing his passion for directing, making movies, VFX, and motion graphics. He leads the Worldwide Substance 3D Evangelism team at Adobe and is known as an expert Substance teacher and the voice behind many Substance tutorials and presentations. Wes is also the author of The PBR Guide: A Handbook for Physically-Based Rendering, Real Word MODO, and Creating 3D Game Art for the iPhone with Unity.

cards.title: Creativity Super Session: Motion Design for Graphic Designers

tags.title: Mainstage Broadcast
tags.description: Don’t miss the Mainstage Broadcast of Keynotes, Sneaks, Creativity Super Sessions, and Luminary Sessions. You’ll get the latest creative industry trends and updates to Adobe Creative Cloud and be inspired by stories from top luminary speakers.

cards.description:
Discover how to leverage your graphic design skills and become adept in essential motion design tools like After Effects. Join Victoria Nece, principal product manager at Adobe, along with Michelle Higa Fox, group creative director of experience, and Paola Chen Le, Senior 2D animator, from award-winning animation and design studio BUCK. BUCK is known for creating lushly detailed 3D worlds for Airbnb and original content like Netflix’s award-winning Love, Death & Robots.

You’ll learn:

  • How to amplify your skills in Illustrator and Photoshop through the dynamic, rewarding, and in-demand field of motion design
  • How motion fits in with classic graphic design brand guidelines
  • The big picture story of motion design and where it’s headed: from dynamic typography to experimental animation, organic 3D to charismatic characters — and everything in between
  • How creative thinking and storytelling evolve with the addition of motion
cards.sessionTitle: Creativity Super Session: Motion Design for Graphic Designers

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Creativity Super Session: Motion Design for Graphic Designers

eventSpeakers.description:
Victoria Nece is the Principal Product Manager for Motion Graphics at Adobe, leading the After Effects product team. As a product manager, Victoria shapes the direction and features of Adobe’s flagship motion graphics toolset, a product she’s been using since she was 13.

Before joining Adobe, she worked as a motion designer in New York, creating factual graphics for documentaries and developing extensions for After Effects.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Creativity Super Session: Motion Design for Graphic Designers

eventSpeakers.description:
Michelle Higa Fox is an Emmy-award winning artist and filmmaker who combines code-based visuals with hand-made animation. Her work has earned the Art Directors Club Young Guns award and Best Music Video at SXSW.

In 2012, she founded Slanted Studios to develop commercial projects, music videos and interactive art installations at the intersection of animation and emerging technology. Their clients include Netflix, Facebook, Twitter, Adult Swim, Coach, Nike, Samsung and Viacom.

Michelle’s collaborations with MacArthur Fellow Camille Utterback have produced permanent interactive public art installations on both coasts. She served as founding creative director on the Peabody Award-winning Netflix original series, Patriot Act with Hasan Minhaj and Vox's daily explainer series, Answered.

She's currently exploring all things emerging technology as a Creative Director at BUCK.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Creativity Super Session: Motion Design for Graphic Designers

eventSpeakers.description: Paola Chen Li is a senior 2D animator at BUCK, passionate about animation, everyday life, and the charm of small details. Her work is inspired by daily experiences, highlighting the goofiness in the mundane. Among her favorite projects at BUCK are collaborations with clients such as McDonald’s, Waze, Rémy Martin, and Identity Digital. When she’s not animating, Paola loves snapping photos during her long walks and enjoys anything related to music.

sessionTrack.title: Mainstage Broadcast
sessionTrack.description: Don’t miss the Mainstage Broadcast of Keynotes, Sneaks, Creativity Super Sessions, and Luminary Sessions. You’ll get the latest creative industry trends and updates to Adobe Creative Cloud and be inspired by stories from top luminary speakers.

cards.title: A Manifesto for Collaboration

tags.title: Mainstage Broadcast
tags.description: Don’t miss the Mainstage Broadcast of Keynotes, Sneaks, Creativity Super Sessions, and Luminary Sessions. You’ll get the latest creative industry trends and updates to Adobe Creative Cloud and be inspired by stories from top luminary speakers.

cards.description:
Collaboration is a buzzword used to describe everything from partnerships in sneaker design to relationships between illustrators and art directors. But a genuine collaboration is more radical: it erases creative hierarchies and personal aesthetics to make something new. Join Nicholas Blechman, creative director of The New Yorker, for this session to discover how collaboration at its core is a tool for generating work. It’s open-ended, experimental, and difficult. But it can lead to stunning results.

You’ll learn how to:

  • Deconstruct collaborative relationships and redefine what it means to be a creative partner
  • Know when to collaborate, when to go solo, and how to choose the right partner
  • Establish the dos and don’ts of a successful collaborative relationship
  • Maintain your sense of self while working with others
  • Effectively self-promote and market your work
cards.sessionTitle: A Manifesto for Collaboration

eventSpeakers.description: Nicholas Blechman is the Creative Director of The New Yorker. He is the former art-director of The New York Times Book Review and The Times Op-Ed page. He published, edited and designed the political underground magazine NOZONE, featured in the Smithsonian Institution’s Design Triennial. His illustrations have appeared in GQ, Travel + Leisure, Wired, and The New York Times. In 2012, Blechman won the Rome Prize in Design at The American Academy in Rome, where he created Food Chains, an illustrated blog that looks behind the scenes at food production. He frequently collaborates with Christoph Niemann on a book series called "One Hundred Percent." The latest in this series, "Conversations", was exhibited at The Met, and is in the permanent collection.

sessionTrack.description: Don’t miss the Mainstage Broadcast of Keynotes, Sneaks, Creativity Super Sessions, and Luminary Sessions. You’ll get the latest creative industry trends and updates to Adobe Creative Cloud and be inspired by stories from top luminary speakers.

cards.title: Reimagining Content Creation for Real Business Impact
cards.description:
Enterprises are beginning to redefine content creation and production with generative AI — and are seeing measurable business value. Join Xavi Cortadellas and Leon Imas from Pepsi; Grace Engels from Newell; and Ken Reisman from Adobe to hear how they are accelerating time to market, enhancing productivity, and driving revenue growth with the latest innovations. This session will equip senior leaders across marketing and creative teams with strategies to transform current ways of working across people, processes, and technology.

In this session, you’ll hear real examples of organizations driving impact by:

  • Enhancing ideation, creation, and collaboration with cutting-edge AI capabilities integrated into existing tools and workflows
  • Leveraging creative and generative automation to boost production of brand-specific asset variations, powering personalization, localization, commerce, and immersive customer experiences
  • Empowering marketers and other teams to easily create, remix, test, and optimize content, while staying on brand
cards.sessionTitle: Reimagining Content Creation for Real Business Impact

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Reimagining Content Creation for Real Business Impact

eventSpeakers.description: Ken leads business strategy and product marketing for Adobe's enterprise Digital Media business, including the Firefly generative AI platform, Creative Cloud, and Adobe Express. Previously, he founded Adobe’s Digital Strategy Group and led global pre-sales to scale Adobe's Digital Experience business. Prior to Adobe, he was a management consultant at McKinsey & Company and co-founded two startups related to Artificial Intelligence. Ken completed his PhD at Stanford and undergraduate studies at Tufts.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Reimagining Content Creation for Real Business Impact

eventSpeakers.description:
Currently, Xavi leads the Gatorade Athletic Equipment Business. Xavi is in charge of creating the growth vision for Gatorade to expand reusable vessels, coolers, smart tech, and other non-consumable verticals. Xavi's team designs a new way to fuel athletes: more sustainable, leveraging DTC, Technology, and Digital Platforms and fully integrating vessels with powders, pods, and tablets. Xavi leads a multifunctional team, including brilliant marketers, brand managers, product managers, and industrial and brand designers. Xavi has held multiple roles in his 13 years at Gatorade, starting with Global Brand Design and always combining Design, Innovation, and Marketing.

Xavi was born in Barcelona, where he earned a degree in Architecture. He has a strong sports performance and design background from his 11 years of experience with Nike in Spain, Mexico, and Brazil. He has also been invited as a guest speaker and panelist at multiple sports and innovation conferences and has collaborated on different podcasts and articles. As part of his Innovation curriculum, he holds several invention patents.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Reimagining Content Creation for Real Business Impact

eventSpeakers.description:
Leon Imas is Vice President of Design at PepsiCo. Leon leads new brands and develops design strategies, systems, and experiences across PepsiCo’s beverage portfolio, with a focus on North American Beverage Portfolio. Including Pepsi, Gatorade, Mountain Dew, Starry, Bubly, Lifewtr, Starbucks (RTD), Mug, and many others. His work has included restaging Pepsi, Gatorade, Starry, and sustainability and innovation projects across PepsiCo.

Before joining PepsiCo, Leon served as the Global Head of Identity and the Senior Director of Advanced Brand Expression at adidas. During his twenty-plus year career, Leon has developed industry-leading brands, experiences, and innovations for global, culture-defining companies.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Reimagining Content Creation for Real Business Impact

eventSpeakers.description:
Grace Engels is a Creative Director at the Newell Brands Design Center in Kalamazoo, Michigan, where she leads multidisciplinary teams of designers and copywriters. As a key member of the Design leadership team, Grace is dedicated to developing new approaches to managing and inspiring creative teams, leveraging enabling technologies, and driving content creation at scale.

Newell Brands is a leading consumer goods company with an impressive portfolio of iconic brands such as Rubbermaid, Sharpie, Graco, Coleman, Rubbermaid Commercial Products, Yankee Candle, Paper Mate, FoodSaver, Dymo, EXPO, Elmer’s, Oster, NUK, and Spontex. Newell Brands Design organization provides in-house expertise in all areas of global product development, eCommerce, and brand communications with team members across ten design disciplines.

tags.title: Creativity and Design in Business
tags.description: Inspiring speakers from the world’s biggest brands and agencies share their expertise and insights about creative leadership in the generative AI era. Topics range from brand reinvention and strategy to creative productivity tips and brave new tools.

cards.description:
Today’s creatives are tasked with more choices than ever before. From selecting the perfect type for your project to deciding which tools and techniques to bring into your process, the decisions seem endless. What if you had a design spirit guide to rely on when that dreaded decision fatigue hits? In this session, you’ll discover how:

  • To navigate the typographic universe
  • The right tools and libraries can support your creative decision-making
  • Emerging technology can simplify your creative process
cards.sessionTitle: Aligning Stars & Serifs: A Guide to the Typographic Universe

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Aligning Stars & Serifs: A Guide to the Typographic Universe

eventSpeakers.description: Kerry Squires, an award-winning Senior Brand Designer at Monotype, excels at the crossroads of art direction, typography, and motion, blending research and experimentation to drive innovative outcomes. She has led high-profile campaigns for global brands like Apple Music and Condé Nast, bringing her strategic vision and creative expertise to large-scale projects. Originally from Cornwall, UK, Kerry holds a Bachelor's degree in Graphic Design from Falmouth University and is a Fellow of the Royal Society of Arts (RSA). Passionate about bold editorial design and trailblazing creativity, she is drawn to industry disruptors. Outside of her professional work, Kerry enjoys DJing, film, and spending time with her dog.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Aligning Stars & Serifs: A Guide to the Typographic Universe

eventSpeakers.description: Spike Spondike is an award-winning Senior Typeface Designer at Monotype. Her experience includes almost a decade working with Dalton Maag (London), and the past two years with Colophon Foundry (London). With a knack for not following the rules, Spike created the voluptuous typeface Blenny (Dalton Maag), the exaggerated angular Serif, Kibitz (Colophon), and Nokia Klingon (Dalton Maag). She has worked with global agencies designing typefaces for some of the biggest names we know. Originally from the USA, Spike gained a Bachelor's degree in Interior Design from the University of Cincinnati, studied Graphic Design Foundation at the Academy of Art University (San Francisco), and finally earned a Master's Degree in Creative Practice for Narrative Environments at Central Saint Martins (London). Spike is obsessed with container ships, enjoys DJing, making noise on her synthesisers, field recording, and creating soothing soundscapes.

cards.description:
Unlock the secrets to creating eye-catching video content that captivates your audience on social media. Join Karina Anglada, an award-winning editor, producer, and strategic business executive, to learn quick and effective techniques to produce engaging videos that stand out in a crowded digital landscape. Discover practical tips, creative strategies, and the latest tools to elevate your brand’s video presence and drive meaningful engagement.

In this session, you’ll learn how to:

  • Use Adobe Premiere Pro and After Effects to create unique social content
  • Utilize powerful features that will take your content from basic to phenomenal
  • Be more organized to whip out content quickly
  • Capture viewers eyes quickly and make them subscribe for more content
  • Collaborate and share your work with key stakeholders
  • Output projects best suited for social media

tags.title: Creativity and Design in Business
tags.description: Inspiring speakers from the world’s biggest brands and agencies share their expertise and insights about creative leadership in the generative AI era. Topics range from brand reinvention and strategy to creative productivity tips and brave new tools.

cards.description: Consumers are moving fast, faster than brands and often faster than technology. Companies need the power of creative + technology to design and scale creative output while delivering ultimate customer experiences. Join Ogilvy One's Global Creative Lead Roberto Fara and Ogilvy One's Global CTO Ravi Pal with IBM's Adobe Platform Leader & CTO, Marketing Jessica Criscione and The Coca-Cola's Company's Global Head of AI Design, Dom Heinrich, in this roundtable session for a discussion about today’s dynamic content supply chain landscape, how it’s changing our ways of working — generating new ways to deliver customer value at scale, and how at the very core, creative innovation is the key to an optimal customer experience and business growth.
cards.sessionTitle: Moving at the Speed of Customers: Next-Gen Content Supply

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Moving at the Speed of Customers: Next-Gen Content Supply

eventSpeakers.description:
With over 25 years of experience, I've been at the forefront of user-centric, technology-driven transformations for brands. As an engineer at heart, I seamlessly navigate both enterprise solutions and interactive experiences, consistently building high-performing engineering teams and leading digital transformation initiatives.

I have a proven diverse expertise in building purpose driven innovation labs to drive future of experience, integrating emerging technologies, and applying data science for deeper actionable insights, driving business growth through application of AI, delivering enterprise-level digital transformations.

Driven by a fascination with the evolving human-machine relationship, I'm passionate about leveraging cutting-edge technology to redefine interfaces, making digital experiences more organic and intuitive.

In my current role as Chief Technology Officer, I build high-performance teams and spearhead R&D initiatives, delivering innovative solutions that drive valuable outcomes for brands in the dynamic digital landscape.

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Chief Creative Officer Spain & Global Creative Lead

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Moving at the Speed of Customers: Next-Gen Content Supply

eventSpeakers.description:
Born in Buenos Aires – Argentina, Roberto moved to Barcelona in 2000. In 2012 RG/A invited him to move to New York. Roberto is a Designer with over 20 years of experience in Brand Design, Product Design, Art Direction and Advertising. He is passionate about the integration of graphic, interactive and product design into a single discipline. Connecting the design to strategic and conceptual thinking enables Roberto to design experiences for brands, campaigns, products or services.

He has led and built Design teams, headed up Departments, and collaborated with some of the most relevant brands such as Nike, Google, Samsung, Microsoft, eBay, Audi, Diesel, Coca-Cola, HBO and Converse. His work has been showcased and recognized internationally in different Festivals and Awards, and he is often invited to share his passion for art, technology and design.

At Ogilvy he holds the positions of Chief Creative Officer in Spain leading the creative department in both offices, Madrid and Barcelona and Global Creative Lead for Ogilvy One. He leads the work for brands like DolceGusto, Nescafé, San Pellegrino, Audi, Volkswagen, Zalando, Mondelēz, among others.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Moving at the Speed of Customers: Next-Gen Content Supply

eventSpeakers.description:
With over two decades of pioneering experience, ` is a curious innovator, patented (AI) inventor, and global leader of design deeply embedded in AI. His expertise lies in bridging the gap between creativity and technology, having worked for and with the Top Fortune 100 to accelerate their growth and design impactful solutions. He is known for his appearance in the Wired documentary "Being Human in an AI World" and as a global thought leader and speaker in the AI space.

Currently, Dom leads AI Design globally at The Coca-Cola Company, where he drives the integration of artificial intelligence into design to foster groundbreaking products and experiences across the brand portfolio. Additionally, he also serves as the Co-Founder at Creative AI Academy and as Adjunct Professor for Infinite (AI) Design at Pratt Institute. Dom is deeply committed to educating the next wave of designers and innovators, strongly believing in a harmonious Human-Machine Relationship.

His career is marked by significant achievements, including leading organizational change at MRM McCann, recognized several times by Fast Company as the Best Workplace for Innovators. Dom has been honored with numerous international awards for creativity, design, and innovation, notably Cannes Lions in Innovation, Best World Changing Idea, and D&AD Impact Pencil.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Moving at the Speed of Customers: Next-Gen Content Supply

eventSpeakers.description: Jessica currently serves as IBM’s Adobe Platform leader, managing Adobe implementations across the enterprise and driving the technology strategy and architecture behind IBM’s client experiences and Marketing platforms. With over 20 years of experience in enterprise consulting and startups, her experience spans multiple industries including finance, healthcare, luxury, entertainment, and technology. Prior to focusing on architecture, Jessica worked as a creative technologist, using technology to help creatives develop their vision and empower their process.

sessionTrack.title: Creativity and Design in Business
sessionTrack.description: Inspiring speakers from the world’s biggest brands and agencies share their expertise and insights about creative leadership in the generative AI era. Topics range from brand reinvention and strategy to creative productivity tips and brave new tools.

cards.title: Shooting for Generative AI: From Pre- to Post-Production
cards.description:
Generative AI offers endless possibilities to reimagine your existing work, but shooting for generative AI opens a whole new world of creative storytelling. In this session, DGA Director and commercial photographer AJ Bleyer explores the power of generative AI as a narrative tool and shares techniques on how to begin incorporating it into your creative approach from the very start.

In this session, AJ will teach you:

  • How to make the most of generative AI when drafting your creative
  • Techniques and best practices when shooting for generative AI
  • Pro tips on how to get the best results when working with generative AI in Photoshop and Adobe Premiere Pro
cards.sessionTitle: Shooting for Generative AI: From Pre- to Post-Production

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Shooting for Generative AI: From Pre- to Post-Production

eventSpeakers.description:
Trying to marry his passion for cars and cameras, AJ began shooting automotive videos with his high school friends. His work caught the attention of local car dealerships, and at age 22 he left his job at Apple to pursue filmmaking full-time. He founded his own production company, Advent Films, and quickly became a trusted shooter for many of the world’s most prestigious brands including Ferrari, McLaren F1, Aston Martin, Red Bull, Riot Games, Amazon, and more.

Despite rejection from every film school he applied to, AJ was accepted into the DGA as one of the Guild’s youngest directors at age 27. Known for dynamic angles and an unforgiving attention to detail, AJ specializes in action-packed commercials featuring vehicle stunts, pyrotechnics, skydiving, and low-flying helicopters. Pretty much anything that freaks his parents out.

When he’s not working on movies or driving cars, AJ is either working on movies or driving cars.

cards.title: Content Revolution: Is the Rise of AI a Fall for Creativity?

tags.title: Creativity and Design in Business
tags.description: Inspiring speakers from the world’s biggest brands and agencies share their expertise and insights about creative leadership in the generative AI era. Topics range from brand reinvention and strategy to creative productivity tips and brave new tools.

cards.description:
The answer is simple: of course not. GenAI is creating the next generation of creativity for those who know how to use it. The real question for brands and agencies is, how do you create a nextgen content supply chain to keep up with your nextgen creatives? Deloitte Digital will present three insights that answer that question, and show real product demos and examples to bring those answers to life.

  • First, we’ll share our perspective on what creatives have that everyone else doesn’t that makes them GenAI leaders.
  • Second, we’ll cover how to become a nextgen creative leader and manage the market’s demand for high volume with the creative demand for high quality.
  • Finally, we’ll look at opportunities across the content supply chain for agencies and brands to infuse innovation and keep up with nextgen creatives.
cards.sessionTitle: Content Revolution: Is the Rise of AI a Fall for Creativity?

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Content Revolution: Is the Rise of AI a Fall for Creativity?

eventSpeakers.description: As the Head of Content for Deloitte Digital, Jenny brings a passion for creating compelling content that connects audiences with brands. With over 15 years of experience, Jenny has a proven track record of delivering high-quality, impactful content that resonates with audiences and drives business objectives. She works with brands on everything from marketing strategy to content creation, production at a global scale, and how to transform content lifecycles using Automation/AI/GenAI.

cards.description:
Dive deep into the world of professional design with two Hollywood Insiders. Join Jesus Ramirez and Lisa Carney, seasoned artists and collaborators, as they pull back the curtain on their collaborative process for crafting iconic movie and TV posters. Discover their expert strategies for leveraging Photoshop and the Creative Cloud ecosystem to meet demanding deadlines without compromising on creativity. This session is your gateway to mastering the art of efficient, high-stakes design work.

You’ll learn:

  • How they leverage the Creative Cloud ecosystem to meet their clients’ needs
  • Real-world retouching tricks to quickly achieve pro-level results
  • How to craft immersive backgrounds
  • How they leverage generative AI features to streamline their workflows
  • The importance of file management and layer organization in a collaborative environment

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Advanced Photoshop Techniques from Two Hollywood Insiders

eventSpeakers.description:
Lisa Carney is a high end retoucher who has spent over two decades working with the most dynamic players in the print, motion picture, and television industries. Art Center trained photographer (Grad ’92). Lisa remains prolific a photographer.

Besides being a regular presenter at KelbyOne, AdobeLive and CreativeLive, her teaching roster runs the gamut from beginners to professionals, and includes universities, design studios, movie studios, corporations, and private students.

Lisa has worked with all major movie studios and many television networks including Netflix, Amazon, Hulu, Disney, Paramount, Apple, 20th Century Fox, Fox Searchlight, Sony, Newline, ABC Television, ESPN, TNT, CNN, CBS, CW, Warner Brothers and Sony.

Advertising credits include Burger King, Baskin-Robbins, Lowes, Meaningful Beauty, Lowes, Mattel, Chrysler, Mercedes, Mazda and Best Buy.

With her decades of experience as a photographer and retoucher, Lisa brings a unique perspective to the art of mobile processing.

With over 20 years of professional experience, his clients include Adobe, Microsoft, and Conde Nast. Most recently, he has worked as a Finisher with some of the biggest names in entertainment, creating film and TV posters for CBS, Discovery, HBO, HULU, and Netflix. Jesús has a passion for sharing his expertise and knowledge. He is perhaps best known as the founder of the Photoshop Training Channel, a popular YouTube channel with over 2 million subscribers. As a sought-after speaker, he has participated in over 40 conferences, including some of the largest industry events in Australia, Asia, Latin America, and the US.

cards.title: Beyond the Basics: Level Up Your Video Editing Skills
cards.description:
If you already know how to edit but feel like the program itself is slowing you down, this session is for you. Learn how to edit at the speed of thought, and pick up techniques beyond basic cutting and pasting. If you already have a basic understanding of Adobe Premiere Pro but don’t know where to go from here, join director Valentina Vee to discover how to take your skills to the next level.

You’ll learn how to:

  • Juggle multiple sequences and projects at once
  • Manipulate motion graphics to your own liking
  • Sweeten and clean up audio like a pro
  • Add and remove effects across groups of clips

She is an experienced commercial, doc, and narrative director who has worked with major worldwide brands like Nike, Dell, Fujifilm, Universal, Netflix, Discovery, and Verizon. Her 2024 projects include "Dracula's Ex-Girlfriend" and "The Getaway" on Nebula, as well as a number of high-profile brand campaigns. She creates content that raises awareness for causes, encourages positivity, and promotes diversity in front of (and behind) the camera.

cards.title: Crucial Tools for Building Amazing Documents
cards.description:
Just as you need to build a solid foundation for a house, so also do you need to establish a set of strong text styles for an InDesign project. Think of paragraph and character styles as the foundational elements that add clarity and unity and simplify the process of managing text in your document. Join speaker, trainer, and writer Erica Gamet in this session to learn how to solidify your text style strategy, which will enable you to produce outstanding documents smoothly and efficiently.

Topics include:

  • Creating, naming, and organizing styles for consistent results
  • Using nested styles to format repetitive text
  • Automating a style change with each new paragraph
  • Incorporating text styles into object styles for even faster layout formatting
  • Setting up styles to use automation features like cross-references and text variables

Note: A basic knowledge of paragraph and character styles is recommended.
cards.sessionTitle: Crucial Tools for Building Amazing Documents

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Crucial Tools for Building Amazing Documents

eventSpeakers.description: Erica Gamet has been involved in the graphics industry for 35 years. She is a speaker, writer, trainer, and content creator focusing on Adobe InDesign, Apple Keynote, and varied production topics. She is a regular presenter at CreativePro Week, and has spoken at Canada’s ebookcraft, Adobe MAX, and Making Design in Oslo, Norway. Find Erica online at the CreativePro YouTube channel, CreativeLive.com,and through her own YouTube channel. When she isn’t at her computer she’s probably daydreaming about travel or living in a Nordic noir landscape.

cards.title: Next-Level Techniques and Exciting New Features in Photoshop

Let Adobe Evangelist Paul Trani show you how to use a combination of tried-and-true and brand-new features to go from simple to complex composites, navigate the workspace easily, blend scenes seamlessly, and export and share content painlessly — all while keeping your designs on brand.

You’ll learn how to:

  • Master top tips, tricks, and shortcuts the pros use
  • Effectively blend color, texture, and brightness for seamless compositions
  • Manage fonts, colors, and assets so your content is always on brand
  • Export, share, and collaborate more easily than ever

tags.title: Education
tags.description: Get essential creative and generative AI skills that open doors to a brighter future. Whether you’re overseeing a creative curriculum or want to use creativity to enhance your teaching, you’ll learn from leading educators and experts who cultivate these skills.

cards.description:
Worried about the impact of AI on creative careers? Want to learn how hiring managers evaluate creative problem-solving and visual design skills in today’s new AI landscape? Join Brian Johnsrud, global head of Education Learning and Advocacy at Adobe, as he discusses the findings of a commissioned global research study to look at the role of digital credentials in helping students and career up-skillers effectively demonstrate creative, digital, and AI skills to stand out in a competitive job market.

You’ll learn:

  • How hiring managers think about skill-based recruiting in an AI world
  • What skills are most in-demand, but often most difficult for hiring managers to identify through job application materials
  • What digital credentials are and how they help job seekers showcase skills and competencies
  • What credential and certification programs Adobe offers for continued learning and upskilling

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Upskilling for Today’s Job Market with Digital Credentials
Championing Student Success in the Age of AI

eventSpeakers.description: Brian Johnsrud is the Global Head of Education Thought Leadership and Student Success at Adobe. As a former K-12 teacher, college lecturer, researcher and thought leader in education technology, he’s passionate about helping the next generation unlock their creativity and acquire essential digital literacy and AI skills needed for success in school, careers, and beyond. Brian is a former K12 teacher and college lecturer, with a PhD in education, digital media, and humanities, and master’s degrees in literature, media studies, and cultural anthropology. Brian also founded and directed a digital humanities and education research lab at Stanford University, designing and studying the efficacy of digital tools for learning. He also formerly led the curriculum and content team at Khan Academy, and he serves on boards and committees for a number of nonprofits and NGOs including World Economic Forum and the Rhodes Scholarship.

cards.description:
Explore the 3D workflows for CMF (Color, Materials, Finish) design in the industrial, automotive, and packaging industries. Join Nick Sharma, senior industrial design evangelist at Adobe, to discover how your CMF designs can be faster, more accurate, and more useful with Substance 3D. Nick will cover the basics of using Substance 3D Sampler, Painter, and Stager; highlight unique challenges and solutions in CMF design; and show how to speed up your design workflows. For this session, some 3D experience is helpful but not required.

You’ll learn how to:

  • Scan and capture accurate 3D materials from a supplier book using Sampler
  • Set up colorways and apply photorealistic materials to a product model with Painter
  • Explore multiple colorways and apply unique finishes
  • Export 3D assets and use Stager to create final product renderings

He has covered most bases in the industrial sportswear world and worked with multiple startups to ideate, create and launch new products. cards.description:
Who says an old dog can’t learn new tricks? To stay ahead of the creative curve, even renowned designer Aaron Draplin needs inspiration and an up-to-date toolkit. Come join Aaron as he entertains and delights on a journey of self-discovery and creative breakthroughs. You’ll find out what it means to learn from the American graphic underbelly, explore things he uses in his day-to-day design toolkit, and hear a few tips and tricks he’s learned along the way from others.

On this journey, you’ll discover:

  • How you can learn from old stuff and put it to work for you
  • Design using “subtraction” and other mind-blowing tips
  • Some current tips and tricks he’s found on social to maintain his edge
  • His opinions on things like AI and life
  • Cool stuff he’s made
cards.sessionTitle: Aaron Draplin: Old Dog, New Tricks

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Aaron Draplin: Old Dog, New Tricks

eventSpeakers.description: Located in the mighty Pacific Northwest, the Draplin Design Co. proudly rolls up its sleeves on projects related to the Print, Identity and Illustration categories. We make stuff for Coal Headwear, Union Binding Co., Richmond Fontaine, Esquire, Nike, Wired, Dinosaur Jr, Timberline, Chunklet, Eaux Claires Music Festival, Poler, Incase, Sub Pop Records, Fender, Marc Maron, Cobra Dogs, Jill Soloway, Thing Festival, Jack White, Old 97s, Jason Isbell, Nixon Watches, Bernie Sanders, Patagonia, Target, Chris Stapleton, NASA/JPL, John Hodgman, Timex, Ford Motor Company, Woolrich and even the Obama Administration, if you can believe that. We’ve traveled the world telling our story, with over 475 speaking fiascos under our belt and counting! We co-created Field Notes with our older brother Jim Coudal, and our memo books are sold the world over, with limited-edition special editions shipped quarterly to a booming subscriber list. Our eight Skillshare classes are raging along, teaching kids all over the world. Our first book titled Pretty Much Everything came out on May 17, 2016 on Abrams Books, which incredibly, is in its twelfth printing. Our roster of DDC Merch is up to 300 products and growing! You’ll see those goodies at DDC merch tables from coast to coast or in our online shop. We pride ourselves on a high level of craftsmanship and quality that keeps us up late into the wet Portland night. Our Proud List of Services: Graphic Design, Illustration, Friendship, Clipping Pathery, Garying, Jokes/Laughter, Campfire Strummin’, Gocco Dynamics, Road Trip Navigation, Trust, Guitar Tuning, Gen’l Conversation, Culture Critique, Existential Wondering, Color Correcting, Bounty Hunting, Heavy Lifting, Advice, A Warm Meal, Simple Ideas and Occasional Usage of Big Words.
