tags.description: Inspiring speakers from the world’s biggest brands and agencies share their expertise and insights about creative leadership in the generative AI era. Topics range from brand reinvention and strategy to creative productivity tips and brave new tools.

cards.description:
As existential threats converge, many companies are taking steps to reinvent themselves with creative thinking as a critical skill. Conversely, creatives must enhance their business acumen to remain relevant. Join PwC Partner Andrea Fishman and PwC Creative Leader Larissa Meek in a “battle of the brains” to explore how generative AI, next-gen skills, and evolving models reshape creative and business landscapes.

In this discussion, PwC will debate both sides of:

  • How generative AI like Adobe Firefly is transforming creativity and business
  • Essential next-gen skills for creatives like Substance 3D
  • New business models and their impact on marketers
  • How businesses evaluate creative innovation
  • Seizing emerging opportunities in the creative industry
  • The importance of storytelling in driving effective customer experiences
cards.sessionTitle: The Whole Brain: Uniting Creativity and Business Strategy

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: The Whole Brain: Uniting Creativity and Business Strategy

eventSpeakers.description: Larissa leads a diverse group of creative talent out of PwC’s Experience center located in south Florida. She has been a champion of creating great user experiences for more than 20 years. As a creative leader, her job is to push the experience and be a strong advocate for the end user and her teams. She strives to create experiences that are beautiful, intuitive, intentional, and rooted in research. Larissa has led UX for many large-scale digital transformations across industries with a focus on both employees and customers.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: The Whole Brain: Uniting Creativity and Business Strategy

eventSpeakers.description: A Partner at PwC, Andrea guides organizations through transformative omnichannel experiences, optimizing interactions across diverse channels, experiences and innovative technologies. She excels at bridging the gap between experience, technology and business - translating a better experience into demonstrable financial returns. A recognized leader in design thinking, she serves as the global sponsor for the firm’s Human Centered Design capability badge. Andrea has previously served as the Experience Consulting leader for PwC Japan and as the Co-Leader of the Women in Technology platform. Prior to her time in Tokyo, Andrea was the Diversity and Inclusion Leader for the US Technology, Media and Telecom practice, focusing on the connections between mindful diversity, employee engagement and high-performing businesses. Prior to joining PwC, Andrea was the Chief Client Officer at BGT Partners, one of the largest privately held agencies in the US, where she was responsible for client services, digital strategy and marketing technology. Previously, Ms. Fishman was an executive at marchFIRST/divine, where she led the Healthcare Industry Vertical. Honored as a Top 15 Women in Business, a Stevie Awards Winner as Best Executive in Advertising, Marketing & Public Relations, and Chicago Interactive Marketing Association (CIMA) Digital Person of the Year Finalist, Fishman contributes to CMO.com, Marketwatch, BtoB Magazine, ClickZ and Chicago Business and speaks at global events including Adobe Summit, ACHE Congress and HIMSS.

cards.title: Shooting and Editing Interviews in Premiere Pro
cards.description:
Learn the best tips and techniques for how to edit your corporate interviews using the powerful — and very effective — tools in Adobe Premiere Pro and Frame.io. From Camera-to-Cloud to jaw-dropping, timesaving AI, you’ll experience the best way to capture and edit interviews with ease.

Join director Valentina Vee as she teaches you how to:

  • Generate and edit a transcript that’ll cut your editing time in half with Text-Based Editing
  • Organize your interview footage for the most efficient editing workflow
  • Harness the power of shortcuts to save editing time
  • Upload and revise your edits for quick client and stakeholder review
  • Create burned-in captions and SRTs for a better viewing experience.
cards.sessionTitle: Shooting and Editing Interviews in Premiere Pro

eventSpeakers.description: Valentina Vee directs premium streaming originals at Nebula Motion Pictures. She is an experienced commercial, doc, and narrative director who has worked with major worldwide brands like Nike, Dell, Fujifilm, Universal, Netflix, Discovery, and Verizon. Her 2024 projects include "Dracula's Ex-Girlfriend" and "The Getaway" on Nebula, as well as a number of high-profile brand campaigns. She creates content that raises awareness for causes, encourages positivity, and promotes diversity in front of (and behind) the camera.

cards.title: New Creative Flows: The GenAI Jump-Start
cards.description:
If your team has been experimenting with generative AI, it can be exciting to see the possibilities that this technology offers, but it’s also hard to know how to incorporate it into your strategy. In this hot-seat-style discussion, creative minds from some of the world’s leading brands will share how they have charged into the generative AI landscape — and what they’ve learned along the way.

You’ll discover:

  • Best practices for upskilling and empowering your workforce with generative AI
  • Common challenges in implementing generative AI — and how to overcome them
  • How creatives in your organization can drive adoption and adaptation to take advantage of everything generative AI has to offer
cards.sessionTitle: New Creative Flows: The GenAI Jump-Start

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: New Creative Flows: The GenAI Jump-Start

eventSpeakers.description:
Jay Ganaden is an accomplished Design and Gen AI Technology Leader with experience spanning agencies, in-house roles, startups, and Fortune 100 companies.

Jay excels in addressing the future of design, utilizing a blend of strategic thinking and visual storytelling to navigate complex challenges. His current role at Adobe has him at the forefront of Generative AI, where he has led significant initiatives and driven product development for cutting-edge features in GenAI. Currently, he leads innovation at Adobe as Director, Global Agency Partnerships, Adobe Firefly.

Jay is also active in the Design and Agency community, presenting at top industry events such as the Cannes Lions Festival, and is a founding member of the Design Leaders Community. His previous leadership roles at Razorfish and Momentum Design Lab saw him drive user experience design and product development across a variety of industries and top clients like Hewlett Packard Enterprise, Intel and Nordstrom. Earlier in his career, Jay held key positions at Google (formerly DoubleClick) and KPMG, where he managed professional services and provided management consulting and technology strategy for Fortune 500 companies. Rounding out a diverse career, Jay was also an Advertising Photographer creating images, campaigns and experiences for Macys, GAP, Sephora, and Levis. Jay is based in San Francisco, lives in Berkeley, and enjoys cycling, snowboarding and outdoor adventures.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: New Creative Flows: The GenAI Jump-Start

eventSpeakers.description:
Jocelyn Chang is the creative lead driving her organization's generative AI and innovation efforts. Working at the intersection of design, strategy, and technology, she develops and executes the long-term vision for scaling creative work through emerging technologies. Prior to this role, Jocelyn led the creative strategy, brand expression, and design systems across the entire portfolio of Amazon devices for the offline retail channel.

Before Amazon, Jocelyn was a designer and art director at a boutique San Francisco creative agency, where she created visual identity systems and crafted stories across disciplines including digital, video, and retail/environmental graphics for clients like Nike, Google, and Hydro Flask. She started her career as a strategy consultant and then a brand manager, giving her a unique hybrid background with deep business expertise and a practitioner's understanding of creative workflows.

Jocelyn holds an AB in Economics and MBA from Stanford University, as well as a BFA in Graphic Design from the California College of the Arts. When she's not thinking about generative AI and creativity, you can find Jocelyn exploring the outdoors in and around San Francisco.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: AI-Powered Innovation: Leaping Ahead and Staying There
AI-Powered Innovation: Leaping Ahead and Staying There
New Creative Flows: The GenAI Jump-Start

eventSpeakers.description:
M. Pell leads The Microsoft Garage in New York City, where he regularly disrupts the thinking, strategy, and business models of the world’s leading companies and organizations.

Bold, insightful, and uncompromising, Pell has spent over three decades pushing the tech industry’s boundaries well past innovative design and technologies into the realm of true breakthroughs. Today, many of those world-changing breakthroughs are imbedded in our everyday lives – such as inventing Adobe Acrobat and PDF (1990), pioneering the first version of the web-based Metaverse (1995), designing early Smartphone experiences (2002), and creating the first WYSIWYG Font menu for the original Macintosh (1985),.

Widely recognized as a world-class Designer and inspiring thought leader in the fields of Innovation, Data + AI, and Visualization, Pell has authored three books on the subjects, and teaches a course on the impact of AI and Metaverse technologies on Fashion for Polimoda, one of Italy’s leading Fashion schools in Florence.

Pell’s evolution from intrepid entrepreneur, to VC-backed startup veteran, to corporate man for Adobe and Microsoft has given him a unique perspective on how to combine business, design, and technology to create truly breakthrough experiences in any field.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: New Creative Flows: The GenAI Jump-Start

eventSpeakers.description:
Kelsey De Weerd has over 15 years of experience in branding and creative marketing across both entertainment studios and agencies. She has created award-winning multi-platform campaigns across digital, AV, social, print and out-of-home.

Currently Kelsey leads a team of Art Directors and Designers on the Paramount+ Creative Marketing team. Their focus is on elevated, original creative with a social-first approach to engage audiences and garner fandoms. In 2023, her team was recognized with over 15 prestigious awards, including several Clio and Promax Awards, The Golden Trailer Award for Most Innovative Advertising for the Evil social campaign and Shorty Award Graphic Art Winner for the Criminal Minds character poster series.

Kelsey started her career at The Walt Disney Company, working at ABC then Disney Channel where she designed event graphics and popular show logos such as Jessie and Goldie and Bear. Since then, she has worked at various agencies as Designer, Art Director and then Creative Director. At The M Factor, she led campaigns for Disney Theatrical, including Marvel and Lucas Films. She earned acclaim on projects including Coco, Mary Poppins Returns, and Aladdin, and she was also awarded a Grand Clio for her work on The Lego Batman Movie with Warner Bros.

As a mom to three little ones, Kelsey is used to managing a fast-paced juggling act, and brings these skills to her work. As a leader, she is known for her calm and balanced demeanor, her integrity, and her positive-yet-realistic attitude on how to get things done.

cards.title: Dazzling Patterns on Repeat
cards.description:
Repeating patterns are everywhere, from wallpaper to packaging and fabrics. Join Adobe Illustrator expert Laura Coyle to learn how to transform your artwork and illustrations into stunning patterns. You’ll dive into the versatile pattern-making tools in Illustrator and gain the confidence to turn your artistic ideas into eye-catching, seamless patterns.

In this session, you’ll:

  • Learn how to use Pattern mode to create precise repeats ready for reproduction
  • Discover quick methods for exporting your finished seamless tile for print on demand
  • Explore the Repeat feature to brainstorm and develop your designs
  • Gain tips for getting the most out of generative AI features
cards.sessionTitle: Dazzling Patterns on Repeat

eventSpeakers.description:
In her 25-year career, Laura Coyle has illustrated for major brands, including Target, Hallmark, Hasbro, Amazon, Disney, and Papyrus — all while creating in Adobe Illustrator. As an instructor, she loves making Illustrator accessible and teaching you the “why” behind her techniques.

From her studio in Atlanta, Laura teaches at her online Illustrator community and presents monthly tutorials at Pattern Observer’s Textile Design Lab. On Laura’s YouTube channel, you’ll find tips on working between Adobe Fresco, Express, Illustrator, and Illustrator on the iPad. Laura is an Adobe Community Expert and has been a speaker for Wacom, CreativePro Week, and Adobe MAX.

Acrobat is being reimagined to go beyond PDFs, transforming how you work with all document types. In this session, learn how generative AI can supercharge workflows for creatives, businesses, marketers, and educators. Join us for practical tips on integrating AI into your Acrobat experience to boost productivity and expand how you interact with documents.

In this insightful session, you’ll discover: ​

  • New Acrobat generative AI features, including Acrobat AI Assistant and integrations with Adobe Express, powered by Adobe Firefly
  • Tips, tricks, and best practices to put these tools into action​

Over the last year, Nina has been focused on bringing Adobe Acrobat AI Assistant to market in a variety of ways including ambassador programs and customer activations. When she’s not evangelizing Acrobat, Nina enjoys traveling, cooking, and going to concerts.

eventSpeakers.description: Chris Grubisa is a visionary leader with a driven passion for leveraging the transformative potential of media. Based in the bustling creative hub of Los Angeles, he spearheads global teams, driving two renowned creative ventures at the forefront of the industry. Chris leads Let’s Cook Editing Services, where his expertise in video editing shines. With a profound understanding of the power inherent in video editing, Chris and Team harness proven systems, creativity, and cutting-edge tools to empower brands, podcasters, agencies, media companies, and creators worldwide. In addition, Chris is the co-founder of Chrilleks alongside his wife, Aleks Lason. Together Chris and Aleks have cultivated a dynamic creative agency that has flourished across international borders, operating successfully for over 14 years. Their agency has become a trusted partner for a diverse clientele, including legacy brands such as Kylie Cosmetics, Shopify, Under Armour, and RedBull. Beyond his professional endeavors, Chris is a devoted family man, entrepreneur, and contributor to his community. His deep-seated passion for connecting with others and uplifting those around him is evident in both his personal and professional pursuits. An avid enthusiast of cooking, Chris sees the creative process as akin to preparing a culinary masterpiece – blending ingredients, flavors, and ideas to craft something truly extraordinary. With Chris at the helm, there's not just a commitment to excellence but a genuine desire to collaborate, innovate, and cook up ideas that leave a lasting impact on the world of media and beyond.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: How Generative AI Can Supercharge Your Document Workflows

eventSpeakers.description: Bryan Bonilla, born and raised in Pomona, California, is a dynamic individual with a diverse background. As the co-founder of Pirate Worldwide, an innovative collective formed in 2017, Bryan and his partners set out to make a lasting impact on society through creative expression and storytelling. A former Division 1 college athlete, Bryan honed his discipline and work ethic on the sports field, skills that have translated seamlessly into his professional and artistic endeavors. As a first-generation American with roots in El Salvador, Bryan brings a rich cultural heritage to his work, infusing his projects with a unique perspective and a deep sense of identity. His story is one of perseverance, creativity, and a relentless drive to make a difference. By Any Means.

cards.title: Mastering InDesign: Expert Techniques Every InDesign User Must Know
cards.description:
InDesign is an amazing page layout tool because there’s always more to learn, and the more you know, the more fun it is. Come join InDesign rockstar David Blatner as he reveals some of the world’s best InDesign techniques in this fast-paced, tips-packed session. No matter what level of InDesign user you are, you’re sure to learn something new.

Topics include:

  • Five essential techniques every InDesign user needs to know
  • Must-have, free automation scripts to boost your productivity (you already have some of these)
  • Quick and easy tweaks to enhance your headline and body text typography
  • Uncovering third-party resources to supercharge your design and production work
  • Where to download bonus resources for grep templates, styles, and more

He has recorded over 30 video courses for LinkedIn Learning (Lynda.com), written 15 books on everything from InDesign to Photoshop to the number pi, and is arguably the best-known InDesign expert in the world. As host of CreativePro Events, he brings together thousands of creative professionals each year to talk about InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, Acrobat, PowerPoint, and more.

tags.title: Photography
tags.description: Spark your passion for photography with sessions that will help you build your photography skills and more easily achieve photo editing results you’re proud of using AI-powered tools and workflows, whether you’re taking photos with a smartphone or a mirrorless camera.

cards.description:
Join photographer and educator Eva Kosmas Flores to learn how using AI tools can help to elevate your image editing and create efficiencies in your editing process, allowing you to produce your best work. Eva will teach you how to harness the newest AI features in Photoshop Lightroom to quickly hone and polish specific areas of your image, accurately remove unwanted objects, and make your subject stand out from the background.

In this session, you’ll learn how to:

  • Take advantage of AI masking tools that allow you to select objects and apply adjustments in mere seconds
  • Use advanced masking options, like Intersect Mask, to quickly create highly targeted masks
  • Easily remove unwanted objects using the Generative Remove tool, powered by Adobe Firefly, in Lightroom
  • Apply Lens Blur to help distinguish the subject from the background

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Adding Depth and a Wow Factor to Your Illustrative Work

eventSpeakers.description:
Hello everyone, my name is Michael Fugoso. If you are familiar with my work you probably know me via my Instagram alias FUGSTRATOR . I am an illustrator/designer originally from San Diego, now functioning in Austin, TX. I've mainly done illustrative work for some of the largest aerospace companies out there, like NASA, Boeing, Blue Origin, Ariane Group and more, and I've also done plenty of official illustrative work for massive companies like Oracle, IBM, Salesforce, Volvo and many more. And I'm now thrilled to be on the Global Evangelism team at Adobe!

Most of my life I wasn't in the professional artist/designer world. Through age 29 I lived what is perceived by many a “normal life,” going through business school and eventually working as a banker. At age 30 the arts called to me and my life changed from there.

I am 40 years old now. In the ten years of creating and illustrating a ton of spaceships, rockets, jet planes, and robots, I luckily found what I love in this latter part of my life.

Join artist Arynlei as she unwraps the narrative design layers of her viral At the Table playing cards. Learn how her passion project turned commercial success used real stories and education across cultures to tap into a communal longing for IRL connection, create portals for viewer participation, and win an audience’s emotional investment. To bring everything together, Arynlei will also share her top Illustrator tips and workflows for creating storytelling designs.

In this project’s origin story and deep dive, you’ll find:

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Putting My (Design) Cards on the Table
Putting My (Design) Cards on the Table

eventSpeakers.description: Arynlei is an artist from the Chicago suburbs. In her childhood, the internet was a destination one once announced “brb” to step away from, but with the internet now integrated into our environments, do we ever really leave? It’s the disappearance of this divide that she now explores. Her current project, At the Table, is a deck of playing cards depicting memories that transcend borders yet occupy the same setting: the Table. Sharing the stories and creative process behind each card brought together an online community, while to Arynlei’s delight, the final tangible product fosters new pockets of offline interaction all over the world.

cards.title: 40 Years of Art and Design: Graffiti, Hip-Hop, and Fine Art

tags.title: Mainstage Broadcast
tags.description: Don’t miss the Mainstage Broadcast of Keynotes, Sneaks, Creativity Super Sessions, and Luminary Sessions. You’ll get the latest creative industry trends and updates to Adobe Creative Cloud and be inspired by stories from top luminary speakers.

cards.description:
Join visual artist Cey Adams as he discusses his artistic career spanning over four decades, from teen graffiti artist in New York City to founding creative director at Def Jam Recordings. He co-founded The Drawing Board, the label’s in-house design firm, that “defined the visual culture of Hip-Hop” and created some of the most iconic album covers and logos including Run-DMC, Beastie Boys, LL Cool J, Public Enemy, The Notorious B.I.G., Jay-Z, and Mary J. Blige. Today Adams creates fine art, drawing inspiration from 1960s pop art, vintage sign painting, and comics. His work focuses on themes including pop culture, brand identity, and cultural and community issues.

As Cey shares insights from his creative journey, you’ll learn about:

  • Creating your own blueprint by harnessing your passion, creativity, and drive
  • The importance of relationships and community — from collaboration to inspiration
  • Giving back — using art as activism to inspire and promote change through community engagement
cards.sessionTitle: 40 Years of Art and Design: Graffiti, Hip-Hop, and Fine Art

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: 40 Years of Art and Design: Graffiti, Hip-Hop, and Fine Art

eventSpeakers.description:
Cey Adams is a pioneer in the world of hip-hop graphic design. As the legendary Founding Creative Director of Def Jam Recordings, he created album artwork, logos, as well as advertising campaigns for Jay-Z, Run DMC, Beastie Boys, The Notorious B.I.G., Maroon 5, and many others.

Cey’s vision pushes the boundaries of art and design as it intertwines with Hip-Hop culture and society at large. His artistic practice focuses on themes including pop culture, race and gender relations, and cultural and community issues. He exhibits, lectures, and teaches art workshops at many established institutions including the MoMA, Pratt Institute, and universities nationwide. Cey lives in Brooklyn, New York where he is always creating mind-altering masterpieces

Heather will speak to the biggest opportunities available to creative and marketing organizations in this moment, and how to harness new tools to supercharge creative flows. She’ll then be joined by Clayton Ruebensaal, Chief Creative Officer at Comcast, for a chat about creativity as a core human value, a brand differentiator, and a business driver.

eventSpeakers.description:
Clayton F. Ruebensaal III, serves as Chief Creative Officer at Comcast, leading creative, media, sponsorships and brand strategy. He commands all marketing that drives consumer demand generation. One of Clayton’s key objectives is connecting our creative approach to our business strategy.

Clayton most recently served as EVP and Global CMO for American Express’ B2B business. He previously led Global Brand Management at American Express, and prior to AmEx, Clayton led Global Marketing for The Ritz-Carlton and held leadership positions for world-class advertising agencies BBDO, Deutsch, and BMB for clients including Pepsi, Visa, E*trade, The Economist, and more.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Creativity Super Session: Human-Centered AI Strategies for Creative Leaders
Creativity Super Session: Human-Centered AI Strategies for Creative Leaders

eventSpeakers.description:
Heather Freeland currently serves as VP of Marketing and Chief Brand Officer at Adobe. She leads all of Adobe's brand marketing globally across the business, overseeing brand strategy and insights, integrated marketing efforts, brand advertising and media, and creative.

Prior to Adobe, she was VP of Marketing at Lyft, leading the function across the company's rideshare, bikeshare, and feet lines of business and overseeing Brand, Product, Growth, Partner, and B2B Marketing as well as Creative. During her time at Lyft, she oversaw the reimagining of the Lyft brand, the reinvention of the team and its operations, and the resurrection of the business post-pandemic.

Previously, Freeland served as the Head of B2B Global Marketing Communications at Meta for 7+ years, where she led brand strategy, creative, product marketing and more, helping to transform the marketing industry through her launch of mobile and video advertising on Facebook, lnstagram, and across the platform. She also served as Vice President of Marketing at the Gilt Groupe and Senior Vice President of Marketing and Sales Strategy for MTV Networks Digital. She also worked for 7+ years at Digitas, helping to lead the advent of digital marketing for brands like Nike and American Express.

From these experiences, she gained a deep understanding of building brands, the media landscape, and marketing technology. She also cultivated a strong operational mindset, helping marketing organizations scale globally, and a deep appreciation for Creative, inspiring and clearing the path for her teams to do their best work. She started her career on Capitol Hill and also worked for a DC-based public relations firm, championing education and health-care causes.

Freeland currently serves on Spotify's marketing advisory council ("Soundboard") and Ridge Ventures' CMO Advisory Council. She graduated from the University of Virginia and holds her MBA from Columbia University. Heather lives in Menlo Park with her husband and two children.

sessionTrack.title: Mainstage Broadcast

cards.title: Timesaving Secrets of Motion Design in After Effects
cards.description:
The secret to improving your After Effects workflow lies in a few timesaving key features that will optimize your workflow and help you craft captivating animations with minimal keyframes. Dive into After Effects with acclaimed director and educator Nol Honig as he demystifies one of its most crucial, yet often misunderstood, tools: the pick whip.

Nol will show you:

  • Best practices for setting up your compositions
  • Secrets to creating more dynamic and effective animations
  • The magical powers of the pick whip, including the wonder of parenting, the convenience of linking properties, and why track mattes are just plain cool
  • Which After Effects hot keys are so hot right now

You’ll also hear an occasional groan-worthy joke or see a surprise picture of Nol’s cat. What’s not to love?
cards.sessionTitle: Timesaving Secrets of Motion Design in After Effects

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Timesaving Secrets of Motion Design in After Effects
Get It Together: Building Your Brand’s Motion Design Arsenal

eventSpeakers.description: Nol Honig is an award-winning director and teacher who lives in New York City. In 2012 Nol was a lead animator for Barack Obama's presidential re-election campaign. Since founding The Drawing Room in 2013, he has directed work for Netflix, Coca Cola, The History Channel, and the Philadelphia Museum of Art, among others, and served as a design/animation lead for various clients including The New York Times, Google, NBC, and The Sundance Film Festival. As a freelance motion designer and art director, Nol has worked for some of the best studios in the world including Elastic, Golden Wolf, Pentagram, Buck, Gretel, and Block&Tackle. In 2017 he received a Distinguished Teaching Award for his work as an associate professor of motion graphics at Parsons School of Design, where he taught from 2001 to 2019. Most recently, Nol won a Silver Cube at the ADC awards for directing the opening title sequence for the Netflix documentary series The Andy Warhol Diaries.

cards.title: Work Happy, Not Harder with Generative AI in Photoshop
cards.description:
Back by popular demand, Mark Heaps’ updated session will show you the power of mixing old skool and new skool, combining foundational techniques with the newest Photoshop features to help you work more efficiently. You’ll build out an AI toolbox that improves workflows, allowing you to spend more time on creativity and work happier.

In this session, you’ll:

  • Dive into mastering digital color theory for production, enabling control of the styles you create and differentiation of your work
  • Master how to convert your production styles and techniques into quick presets that help ensure greater consistency across your work and your team’s work
  • Batch process image editing techniques that integrate randomization with AI-powered tools for rapid iteration of concepts
  • Integrate emerging AI industry tools into your production workflow, like generating scripts for Photoshop that improve your high-volume production
cards.sessionTitle: Work Happy, Not Harder with Generative AI in Photoshop

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Work Happy, Not Harder with Generative AI in Photoshop

eventSpeakers.description: Mark Heaps, Professional Creative, seeded his path by skateboarding and playing in bands. Today he is Head of Brand & Creative at Groq Inc. Mark is known for promoting "production advocacy" and "working happy not harder." He has honed his chops working on projects for companies like Apple, Google, Facebook, E&J Gallo, Capital One, and that family friend demanding a free logo. He’s an author and noted speaker at various industry events. He resides in Austin, Texas, with his wife, two rad kids, a Goldendoodle, and another dog that lied about not being part chihuahua.

tags.title: Video, Audio, and Motion
tags.description: Learn how to edit your first video, transform static graphics into motion, create an animated explainer video, and apply visual effects to a marketing video. Leverage generative AI in your video workflow and collaborate with Frame.io.

cards.description:
After Effects is the standard for motion graphics – a must for anyone who wants to create motion designs for the web, video, or other screen delivery. However, many professionals feel intimidated by After Effects. Join Adobe Certified Instructor Luisa Winters in this beginner-level session during which she'll explain the basics of After Effects in a nontechnical, uncomplicated way. Explore the new Properties panel and keyframe techniques, and discover how to easily animate shapes, logos, and text. Learn how to build and animate your work from other programs, including Illustrator and Photoshop. And find out how to export your work for social media and other uses.

In this session, you’ll learn how to:

  • Import files from Photoshop and Illustrator
  • Create and modify a composition and keyframes
  • Create keyframe interpolation
  • Use the Graph Editor
  • Animate text and apply masks

eventSpeakers.description:
Luisa Winters is an esteemed subject matter expert, instructor, and consultant specializing in Adobe products. Her consultancy services extend to various sectors, including broadcast, advertising, and governmental organizations. Luisa is actively delivering expert training and workshops across a multitude of prestigious training centers both within the United States and internationally.

Renowned in the creative community, Luisa frequently contributes as a speaker at various industry conferences, where she shares her insights on multiple subjects, such as video editing, compositing, audio, drone technology, and web development. Her expertise is rooted in more than 30 years of dedicated experience in video production and cinematography, making her a pivotal figure in the field. Luisa continues to inspire and educate, driving innovation and excellence in the digital media landscape.

For professional inquiries or to engage with Luisa Winters’ wealth of knowledge, connect on her social channels or email her at luisa@videotrainers.com.

tags.title: Creativity and Design in Business
tags.description: Inspiring speakers from the world’s biggest brands and agencies share their expertise and insights about creative leadership in the generative AI era. Topics range from brand reinvention and strategy to creative productivity tips and brave new tools.

cards.description:
At one of the world's most well-known toy companies, where unlocking the power of play is essential, the need for unique, compelling content at scale is greater than ever. Whether your teams are crafting content from scratch, generating material with AI, or sourcing stock assets, they need innovative content solutions to meet the demand and stand out from the noise. Join Jamie Dunn, VP Packaging at Mattel and Lindsay Morris, Sr. Strategic Development Manager at Adobe to learn how Mattel is streamlining their workflows and expanding their content ecosystems to deliver the best creative outputs at scale.

In this session, you’ll hear:

  • How to leverage brand equity and unlock your creative team's full potential
  • Tips for embracing and integrating new brand-safe generative AI tools into your creative toolkit
  • Best practices for sparking creativity to get better content faster
cards.sessionTitle: Barbie, Hot Wheels & More: Unboxing Content at Scale with Mattel Packaging

eventSpeakers.description: At Adobe, I bring over 20 years of experience in digital media, fueled by a passion for visual storytelling. I specialize in content solutions and generative AI, focusing on driving enterprise strategy. Our team is dedicated to leveraging industry insights, evangelizing customer stories, and supporting strategic partnerships to foster growth and innovation.

eventSpeakers.description:
Jamie Dunn is Vice President of Global Packaging at Mattel, where he leads creative for packaging and e-commerce initiatives across a diverse portfolio of iconic toy and entertainment brands such as Barbie, Hot Wheels, Fisher-Price, American Girl, and Uno. With a global team including graphic designers, copywriters, structural engineers, illustrators, photographers, project managers, and other creative professionals, he fosters a collaborative environment that drives innovation and excellence.

As a forward-thinking and driven creative executive, Jamie Dunn brings a wealth of experience in product design, development, marketing communication, and branding. His passion lies in building unified and dynamic creative teams that leverage the art of brand storytelling to forge meaningful connections with consumers. He leads teams based in various locations worldwide, including the U.S., Canada, and Hong Kong. His leadership and expertise play a pivotal role in shaping the visual narrative of some of the world's most beloved brands, resonating with consumers on a global scale.

cards.description:

Join Bart Van de Wiele, head of Solutions Consulting at Adobe, in this session to discover how to speed up your workflow by mastering the features you use every day. You’ll learn how to do your best work by automating text formatting, expertly editing artwork, and taking advantage of InDesign features both old and new.

Become a more productive InDesign user by learning:

  • How to use GREP expressions to automate your text formatting and cleanup
  • How to have fun with tables (yes, it’s possible)
  • Tips on combining Illustrator and Photoshop files with InDesign
  • The wonders of combining text and object styles
  • And many more project techniques

cards.title: Expanding Creative Possibilities with Photoshop on Chrome

tags.title: Creativity and Design in Business
tags.description: Inspiring speakers from the world’s biggest brands and agencies share their expertise and insights about creative leadership in the generative AI era. Topics range from brand reinvention and strategy to creative productivity tips and brave new tools.

cards.description: A growing generation of creatives with professional potential doesn’t have the tools, access, or platforms to thrive. That’s why Adobe has partnered with Google Chrome, the world’s most accessible browser, to bring professional-grade creative tools to the web and help everyone reach their full creative potential. In this session, join multidisciplinary artist Temi Coker, who launched two special edition products this year and knows a little bit about what it takes to expand what’s creatively possible. He’ll walk you through the top five things he learned in Photoshop on Chrome while taking his iconic 2D designs to the third dimension.
cards.sessionTitle: Expanding Creative Possibilities with Photoshop on Chrome

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Expanding Creative Possibilities with Photoshop on Chrome

eventSpeakers.description:
Born Temiloluwa Coker in Lagos, Nigeria, Temi's creativity became apparent at an early age. Initially, he went to college to study Biomedical Engineering to make his parents happy. A year into the major, he realized it wasn’t for him and switched to Digital Media. This opened up a lot of doors to explore different mediums within the visual creative field. Temi first started out doing photography, then design a few years later. Despite people telling him that he couldn’t do both, he's glad he listened to his heart and explored the endless possibilities of merging photography and design. Today, Temi is widely known for his creative approach in photography and design. His goal is to help people tell and share their stories through different digital mediums. Being creative is more than just a hobby to him — it's his passion, and every day he gets the opportunity to show everyone the power of creativity and how it can change the world.

Temi is an absolute force of creativity, depicting layers of his Nigerian culture with colors, patterns, dimensions and textures. He doesn't just create art, he creates powerful experiences that move and challenge beauty standards. His work is a movement.

Temi loves to help brands of all sizes tell their stories through innovative marketing strategies and campaigns. He has worked with clients such as Adobe, Facebook, The Oscars, Footlocker, HBO, Google, Twitter, Peloton, and was one of the seven Adobe Creative Residents for the 2018/2019 year.

sessionTrack.title: Creativity and Design in Business
sessionTrack.description: Inspiring speakers from the world’s biggest brands and agencies share their expertise and insights about creative leadership in the generative AI era. Topics range from brand reinvention and strategy to creative productivity tips and brave new tools.

cards.title: What Makes Good Type?
cards.description:
Join Katie Johnson and Ilana Griffo from Goodtype as they explore the attributes that make type look good and, more importantly, feel good. From the technical aspects to the humanity behind the glyphs, they’ll show how typography unlocks new forms of expression and helps you make important messages much more impactful.

In addition to warming your design enthusiast heart, this session will cover:

  • Choosing the right type styles to make your message hit home
  • How to elevate your type from passenger princess to driver
  • Balancing aesthetics with functionality
  • Designers who are using type in exciting ways (and how you can join them)
cards.sessionTitle: What Makes Good Type?

eventSpeakers.description: Katie Johnson is a lettering artist and co-owner at Goodtype, based in Austin, Texas. She's also an author, educator, and queso enthusiast, as well as mom of 2 sweet cats and an aussiedoodle. Katie believes whole-heartedly that everyone deserves to love their job, which is why she spends most of her time helping other artists and designers achieve their career goals.

Ilana Griffo is a designer and illustrator based in NY, and a co-owner at Goodtype. Ilana is also an author, mom, and dessert lover. She's passionate about helping artists pursue their creative passion and taking the fear out of business. She would also like to pet your dog.

cards.title: Asia Pacific Opening Keynote

tags.title: Mainstage Broadcast
tags.description: Don’t miss the Mainstage Broadcast of Keynotes, Sneaks, Creativity Super Sessions, and Luminary Sessions. You’ll get the latest creative industry trends and updates to Adobe Creative Cloud and be inspired by stories from top luminary speakers.

cards.description: Get a front-row seat to the latest Adobe products, features, and innovations. See how we can help you make anything you can imagine.
cards.sessionTitle: Asia Pacific Opening Keynote

eventSpeakers.description:
Shantanu Narayen is chairman and chief executive officer of Adobe, one of the largest and most diversified software companies in the world.

Adobe’s mission is to change the world through digital experiences, serving a large customer base from students to business communicators to the world’s largest enterprises. As CEO, Shantanu has transformed the company into an industry innovator by pioneering a cloud-based subscription model for its creative suite, establishing the global standard for digital documents, and creating and leading the explosive digital experience category. Today, he’s driving the company’s strategy to unleash creativity for all, accelerate document productivity, and power digital business.

Under Shantanu’s leadership, Adobe has achieved record revenue and industry recognition for its inclusive, innovative, and exceptional workplace, including being continuously named a Great Place to Work and a Most Admired Company by Fortune.

Shantanu joined Adobe in 1998 as vice president and general manager of its engineering technology group. He became president and COO in 2005, CEO in 2007, and chairman of the board in 2017.

Shantanu is vice chairman of the US-India Strategic Partnership Forum and sits on the board of Pfizer. He previously served as a director of Dell and is a past member of the U.S. President’s Management Advisory Board. Shantanu has been recognized by several publications as one of the world’s leading executives, including Barron’s World’s Best CEOs and Fortune Businessperson of the Year lists, and named a Top CEO by Glassdoor based on employee feedback. He is a recipient of India’s civilian honor Padma Shri and the Economic Times Global Indian of the Year award.

Before joining Adobe, Shantanu held product development roles at Apple and Silicon Graphics before cofounding an early photo-sharing startup, Pictra.

Shantanu holds five patents. He has a bachelor’s degree in electronics engineering from Osmania University, a master’s degree in computer science from Bowling Green State University and a master’s degree in business administration from the University of California at Berkeley’s Haas School of Business. Shantanu once represented India in sailing at an Asian regatta.

David Wadhwani is responsible for the success of Adobe’s global Digital Media business across Adobe Creative Cloud and Adobe Document Cloud, including all product management, product marketing, engineering, strategic partnerships, customer support and to go-to-market across geographies. This includes iconic software brands such as Photoshop, Lightroom, Illustrator, InDesign and Acrobat.

David was most recently a Venture Partner at Greylock Partners. Prior to joining Greylock, he was president and CEO of AppDynamics, leading the company as it transformed to a SaaS-first business and became one of the fastest-growing enterprise software companies at the time.

This is David’s second tour of duty at Adobe. He joined Adobe in 2005 through the company’s acquisition of Macromedia, Inc., where he had been vice president of developer products. As senior vice president and general manager of Adobe’s Digital Media business, David played an instrumental role in advancing the company’s category leadership, expanding into new markets and contributing to its successful transformation to a cloud-based subscription business.

David holds a bachelor’s degree in computer science from Brown University and serves on the Brown computer science department advisory board. He is also on the digital advisory board of The Metropolitan Museum of Art and on the board of trustees for StoryCorps and the Fine Arts Museums of San Francisco.

As Senior Vice President and General Manager, Creative Product Group for Adobe, Ashley Still leads product, engineering, business and go-to-market teams across Creative Cloud, as well as B2B and partnerships across Adobe’s Digital Media Organization.

In her role, Ashley oversees all aspects of the company’s flagship creative applications, including Photoshop, Premier Pro, Illustrator and Lightroom. Her team is also responsible for Adobe’s strategic partnership work with technology companies globally, including Apple, Microsoft and Google; and driving Creative Cloud’s fast-growing mobile app business, and for the marketing campaigns that makes Adobe the market-leader in creative technologies.

Previously Ashley served as Adobe’s Senior Vice President, Digital Media Marketing, Strategy & Global Partnerships, and before to that Vice President and General Manager, Adobe Creative Cloud for Enterprise. During her tenure with Creative Cloud’s enterprise business, Ashley’s team delivered an integrated content creation, collaboration and publishing solution that securely enables brands to create exceptional design and content.

Prior to that, Ashley was Senior Director of Product & Marketing for Adobe Primetime, an Internet television platform used by Comcast, Turner, NBC Sports and other global media companies to deliver TV content and dynamic advertising to any Internet device. Under Ashley’s leadership, Adobe Primetime won an Emmy Award for the Adobe Pass TV-Everywhere service.

Ashley joined Adobe in 2004 following her internship with the company and held several product management positions for Adobe Photoshop.

Still earned her Bachelor of Arts degree from Yale University and her master’s degree from Stanford Graduate School of Business.

Deepa Subramaniam is Vice President, Product Marketing for Creative Product Group at Adobe, where she is responsible for driving Adobe’s digital imaging, photography, video, design and generative AI businesses forward.

Deepa has over 18 year's experience leading product teams to collaboratively build innovative digital products as well as a proven track record in strategy and execution, while acting as a frequent advisor to founders, CEOs and CPOs on product strategy, product execution and organizational optimization.

Prior to Adobe, Deepa served as the ACLU’s first ever Chief Technology and Digital Officer where she led the Digital, Engineering, Product and Design teams, as Vice President of Product and Design at Kickstarter where she helped revamp the platform for the next decade of creative campaigning and as Director of Product at Hillary for America, where her she led product development for online fundraising, voter registration and get out the vote initiatives.

Anna McNaught is a digital/Photoshop artist, photographer, designer, and full-time traveler. She spends most of the year on the road creating art on the go and running her business, Leave The Map, with her husband James. Anna has worked with Adobe, NASA, Yeti, Crocs, Audi, Marriott, Getty Images, and 5-star hotels around the world.

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Sr. Design Evangelist for Next Gen Creative Pros

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Adding Depth and a Wow Factor to Your Illustrative Work
Sign Your Work with Adobe Content Authenticity

eventSpeakers.description:
Hello everyone, my name is Michael Fugoso. If you are familiar with my work you probably know me via my Instagram alias FUGSTRATOR . I am an illustrator/designer originally from San Diego, now functioning in Austin, TX. I've mainly done illustrative work for some of the largest aerospace companies out there, like NASA, Boeing, Blue Origin, Ariane Group and more, and I've also done plenty of official illustrative work for massive companies like Oracle, IBM, Salesforce, Volvo and many more. And I'm now thrilled to be on the Global Evangelism team at Adobe!

Most of my life I wasn't in the professional artist/designer world. Through age 29 I lived what is perceived by many a “normal life,” going through business school and eventually working as a banker. At age 30 the arts called to me and my life changed from there.

I am 40 years old now. In the ten years of creating and illustrating a ton of spaceships, rockets, jet planes, and robots, I luckily found what I love in this latter part of my life.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Next-Level Techniques and Exciting New Features in Photoshop

eventSpeakers.description: Meet Paul Trani, Principal Director Evangelist at Adobe. Paul has a true passion for empowering designers to unleash their creativity and embrace cutting-edge technology to craft awe-inspiring content. Over the past 25 years, Paul has honed his skills as an award-winning visual designer, a dedicated instructor, and an engaging public speaker. When he’s not traveling Paul enjoys designing and producing instructional content for Adobe and his own social channels where he loves connecting with fellow creators. And when he manages to sneak a sliver of free time you can catch him playing all the racquet sports and traveling for fun.

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Sr. Quality Engineer and Animation Explorer
eventSpeakers.description:
Dacia Saenz cut her teeth in Austin, TX working in television and film productions for CNBC, PBS, and the Sundance Foundation. When not in production, she put her wordsmith skills to work and was published (under pen name) in “The Kicked Out Anthology,” chosen as one of the top books of 2011 by the LGBTQ Roundtable of the American Library Association.

During her stint in Seattle, she earned her Masters of Communication in Digital Media from the University of Washington, debuted two short films at the 2012 and 2013 Seattle International Film Festivals, and was honored to receive the Audience Choice Award at the Next Fifty film festival. Before joining Adobe in 2015, Dacia co-produced social justice centered multi-media campaigns in Thailand and El Salvador for the Seattle Globalist and the UW’s Center for Human Rights.

These days, Dacia is obsessed with User Experience in Creative tools. She plays in After Effects all day long. Dacia is a budding Animator, JavaScript, and Processing nerd. Synthesizers are her number one jam.

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Principal Director, Creative Cloud Evangelist and Community Advocate
eventSpeakers.description: Terry White – Principal Director, Creative Cloud Evangelist and Community Advocate for Adobe, Inc. Terry has been with Adobe for 27 years and has extensive knowledge of Adobe’s Creative Professional product line. In his current position, he leads the charge of getting customers excited and educated about Adobe Creative Cloud products and services. In 2016 Terry White was the 34th inductee into the Photoshop Hall of Fame. He has been active in the industry for over 30 years. Terry is the host of the top ranked award winning Adobe Creative Cloud TV and has one of the most popular channels on YouTube. He is also the author of Secrets of the Adobe Bridge and co-author of The iPhone Book, The iPhone Book 2nd Edition, The iPhone Book 3rd Edition, The iPhone Book 4th Edition, The iPhone Book 5th Edition, The iPhone Book 6th Edition, and InDesign CS/CS2 Killer Tips. Terry is a key presenter at major industry shows around the world.

Danielle Morimoto leads the design team responsible for Adobe Firefly and Generative AI on the Machine Intelligence and New Technologies team at Adobe. She helps define the most compelling experiences and emerging technologies by uncovering untapped potential, ultimately identifying how people could be using Adobe in the future. She’s an avid road cyclist, NBA Golden State Warriors fan and lover of ice cream.

cards.title: Quick Hack: Animate Illustrations for Quick Content Creation

tags.description: Bring your creative vision to life. Learn how you can leverage new generative AI tools to assist your content development, create in new ways, and gain more control over your workflows and outputs. Get inspired to revisit the way you approach design.

cards.description:
Short-form videos are popular media that won’t be going away anytime soon. For illustrators, it’s important to market their work on social media, but they don’t always have the time to create new video content while juggling their creative careers. In this session, discover how you can easily animate your illustrations without complex software using Adobe Express. Join Adrianne Walujo, illustrator and designer, as she shares creative tips for beginners, and learn how to create fun, animated illustrations using Illustrator and Adobe Express. Adrianne will guide you through a quick and simple process to design and animate illustrations that reflect your unique style.

In this session, you’ll learn how to:

  • Create vectors in Illustrator
  • Export content to Adobe Express
  • Use Adobe Express to add animation

eventSpeakers.description:
Adrianne Walujo (Anne) is an Indonesian-born, Melbourne-based illustrator and designer. Known for her minimalist and playful illustrations, she has collaborated with brands and studios such as Adobe, Wacom, Microsoft, CARE Australia, Innisfree, Jumbla, Vidico, Creativa and more. She has explored many income avenues as a creative from client work, brand collaborations, merchandising, artist market, teaching and more- and she loves sharing her experience.

Having been helped and mentored by many others, she is passionate about making the creative industry even more accessible to everyone through teaching and speaking engagement.

cards.description:
Most photographers use Photoshop Lightroom for photo editing, but are you harnessing its full potential? Join expert photographer and content creator Wil Calabio to explore the advanced capabilities of masking tools in Lightroom. Wil (aka @itizwil) will guide you through the essentials of using masks for precise edits — including specific area enhancement, exposure corrections, and detail refinements — equipping you with the skills to elevate your photo editing to the next level.

In this session, you’ll learn how to:

  • Correct exposure in specific image areas

cards.title: Future Photoshop Tricks You Need to Know in Advance

tags.title: Graphic Design and Illustration
tags.description: Bring your creative vision to life. Learn how you can leverage new generative AI tools to assist your content development, create in new ways, and gain more control over your workflows and outputs. Get inspired to revisit the way you approach design.

cards.description:
Step into the future of Photoshop with Photoshop educator and PiXimperfect founder Unmesh Dinda. Discover techniques that will shape the future of Photoshop and create edits that were impossible to think of, just a few years ago. Learn how to transform your workflow with features that cut your editing process from hours to seconds. Join us for an exclusive session where Unmesh reveals essential Photoshop tricks every professional must know to stay ahead of the game.

In this session, you'll discover how to:

  • Master cutting-edge Photoshop techniques before they become mainstream.
  • Optimize your editing workflow with innovative, next-gen tips
  • Harness the power of Generative AI and other groundbreaking tools
  • Stay updated with the newest advancements and tricks in photo editing
cards.sessionTitle: Future Photoshop Tricks You Need to Know in Advance

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Future Photoshop Tricks You Need to Know in Advance

eventSpeakers.description: Unmesh Dinda is a passionate Photoshop instructor and content creator. He embarked on his Photoshop adventure at eight years old when his family got their first computer, thanks to his Dad. This early start turned Photoshop into a creative outlet for him, almost like playing a video game, where he experimented with photos taken with his Dad’s simple point-and-shoot camera. Unmesh now runs a popular YouTube channel, “PiXimperfect,” dedicated to simplifying Photoshop techniques, educating creatives, and exploring the art of post-processing. So far, he’s put together over 950 tutorials, building a community of 5 million YouTube subscribers and over a million Instagram followers. His work has caught the eye of major brands like Adobe, Wacom, and Nvidia and has been featured on platforms like Fstoppers and PetaPixel. As a speaker, Unmesh has shared his knowledge at events like the Adobe MAX Conference and Photoshop World, always with the aim of making Photoshop fun and accessible to everyone.

eventSpeakers.description:
Joy Chiang is an abstract artist based in Melbourne, Australia, dedicated to sharing her unique perspective and art with the world. She discovered her passion for painting during her maternity leave, using it as a creative outlet to navigate the challenges of parenthood. With a background in urban planning and design, Joy's contemporary abstract art harmoniously blends nature's tranquillity with urban energy, reflecting her personal journey through motherhood.

Her art is both spontaneous and intentional, characterised by bold brushstrokes, vibrant patterns, and dynamic movements that add depth and narrative. As an early adopter of AI and an Adobe partner, Joy integrates diverse mediums into her mixed-media pieces. Her physical paintings incorporate Chinese calligraphy brush strokes, textures, and inks, enriching her AI-generated surreal environments. She breathes life into these works through 3D modeling and animated motion graphics, continually pushing the boundaries of contemporary art.

Joy’s innovative blend of traditional and digital media positions her as a dynamic and influential artist, always evolving and expanding the horizons of modern abstract art.

eventSpeakers.description: Ta-ku might be the modern day renaissance man. Haven risen to prominence as one of Australia’s most in-demand music producers, the Perth-based artist (real name Regan Mathews) has found himself curator of a rapidly expanding, multi-disciplinary creative empire. From the early ‘Soundcloud Era’ days uploading daily cuts to a clutch of co-writes & production efforts for the likes of Anderson Paak, Flume, Chet Faker, Childish Gambino, Wafia, Alina Baraz, Masego, Ty Dolla Sign, Justin Timberlake and more as well as countless self-releases. This insatiable drive to create is a personal one. Ta-ku now applies it to a diverse range of passion projects that encompass photography, design, creative direction, business & fashion. From being founder & CD of his own creative agency Pretty-Soon, to his creative label 823 - a community built on a love for and appreciation to those who inspire you.The common thread for his work is one of collaboration and self-expression, the key to managing these disparate passions is respect.

Putting My (Design) Cards on the Table

eventSpeakers.description: Arynlei is an artist from the Chicago suburbs. In her childhood, the internet was a destination one once announced “brb” to step away from, but with the internet now integrated into our environments, do we ever really leave? It’s the disappearance of this divide that she now explores. Her current project, At the Table, is a deck of playing cards depicting memories that transcend borders yet occupy the same setting: the Table. Sharing the stories and creative process behind each card brought together an online community, while to Arynlei’s delight, the final tangible product fosters new pockets of offline interaction all over the world.

cards.title: AI-Powered Innovation: Leaping Ahead and Staying There

tags.title: Europe, Middle East, and Africa Day 2
Creativity and Design in Business
tags.description: Inspiring speakers from the world’s biggest brands and agencies share their expertise and insights about creative leadership in the generative AI era. Topics range from brand reinvention and strategy to creative productivity tips and brave new tools.

cards.description:
Generative AI has prompted a dramatic change in the speed of business. The pace of innovation in content production is at an all-time high, raising the level of competition. And it’s increasingly surprising what “non-experts” can do so quickly. Creatives need a new playbook to accelerate the pace at which they work, and Michael Pell, Envisioneer | The Microsoft Garage, will share his ideas on what it should include. The ability to instantly envision, iterate, and deliver is how we’ll continue to lead our organizations in this time of unprecedented change.

In this session, you’ll learn how to:

  • Demonstrate bold new ideas in a matter of minutes
  • Hack together visual walkthroughs or working prototypes in no time
  • Validate those concepts to provide data to justify the work
  • Attract sponsorship in early stages
  • Showcase your own superpowers throughout
cards.sessionTitle: AI-Powered Innovation: Leaping Ahead and Staying There

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: AI-Powered Innovation: Leaping Ahead and Staying There
AI-Powered Innovation: Leaping Ahead and Staying There
New Creative Flows: The GenAI Jump-Start

eventSpeakers.description:
M. Pell leads The Microsoft Garage in New York City, where he regularly disrupts the thinking, strategy, and business models of the world’s leading companies and organizations.

Bold, insightful, and uncompromising, Pell has spent over three decades pushing the tech industry’s boundaries well past innovative design and technologies into the realm of true breakthroughs. Today, many of those world-changing breakthroughs are imbedded in our everyday lives – such as inventing Adobe Acrobat and PDF (1990), pioneering the first version of the web-based Metaverse (1995), designing early Smartphone experiences (2002), and creating the first WYSIWYG Font menu for the original Macintosh (1985),.

Widely recognized as a world-class Designer and inspiring thought leader in the fields of Innovation, Data + AI, and Visualization, Pell has authored three books on the subjects, and teaches a course on the impact of AI and Metaverse technologies on Fashion for Polimoda, one of Italy’s leading Fashion schools in Florence.

Pell’s evolution from intrepid entrepreneur, to VC-backed startup veteran, to corporate man for Adobe and Microsoft has given him a unique perspective on how to combine business, design, and technology to create truly breakthrough experiences in any field.

cards.description:
Join photographer and educator Eva Kosmas Flores to learn how using AI tools can help to elevate your image editing and create efficiencies in your editing process, allowing you to produce your best work. Eva will teach you how to harness the newest AI features in Photoshop Lightroom to quickly hone and polish specific areas of your image, accurately remove unwanted objects, and make your subject stand out from the background.

In this session, you’ll learn how to:

  • Take advantage of AI masking tools that allow you to select objects and apply adjustments in mere seconds
  • Use advanced masking options, like Intersect Mask, to quickly create highly targeted masks
  • Easily remove unwanted objects using the Generative Remove tool, powered by Adobe Firefly, in Lightroom
  • Apply Lens Blur to help distinguish the subject from the background

She teaches photography + videography through her online courses and in-person workshops all over the globe. An avid gardener + beekeeper, she's written two cookbooks focused on seasonal eating, and is currently re-wilding 29 acres of clear-cut forest. When she's not digging in the garden or hovering over a pot in the kitchen, she can be found in her living room with a small chihuahua on her lap.

eventSpeakers.description:
Amelie Satzger is a German visual artist, photographer, and art director known for her vibrant and surreal imagery. She began her creative journey at the age of 12 when she started experimenting with Photoshop. By 19, she had purchased her first DSLR and gained attention by sharing self-portraits on Instagram, quickly amassing a following. Amelie later studied at the University of Applied Sciences in Munich, where she expanded her skills, particularly in stop-motion video.

In 2019, she was selected for the Adobe Creative Residency, which played a key role in refining her unique, colorful, and playful style. She now works freelance for renowned clients like Adobe and Apple, creating striking visual concepts that blend everyday metaphors with humor and bold colors. Passionate about sharing her knowledge, Satzger actively teaches others in the field to foster a more inclusive creative community. Her work continues to evolve, incorporating outdoor shoots and explorations of 3D design, with the ultimate dream of bringing her surreal visions to life in video format.

cards.description:
Join Scott Martin, head of production at Princess Cruises, as he shares his experience building video production workflows to facilitate creativity and efficiency — including centralizing all their creative media across multiple teams in the newly re-built Frame.io. From on-ship camera crews to mainland editors across the states, discover how the team created a truly collaborative remote creative workflow.

You’ll learn about:

  • How the team at Princess Cruises seamlessly manages all kinds of creative projects
  • The collaborative workflows that keep the Princess Cruises creative team on track and productive
  • What’s coming in Frame.io V4 including optimized performance, flexible workspaces and more
cards.sessionTitle: Navigating Creative Waters: Princess’s Production Journey

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Navigating Creative Waters: Princess’s Production Journey

eventSpeakers.description:
Scott David Martin is a Director and Executive Producer. He is known for delivering profitable video & photography in the face of wild personalities, extreme locations, communication barriers and grumpy grizzly bears. He directs for Princess in the most remote and breathtaking environments across the globe, including Alaska, Antarctica, Australia, and the Arctic.

Scott has collaborated with global brands on six continents, earning 13 Telly Awards and multiple Travel & Weekly Gold Magellan Awards. His photography has been featured in publications including Travel & Leisure, CNN Travel, Condé Nast Traveler, Departures, Travel Weekly, and AFAR.

Scott embodies the philosophy of teamwork and resilience. Scott continually pushes creative boundaries and inspires others to harness their potential in the creative industries. He is dedicated to fostering a supportive and innovative work environment, believing in the power of collaboration and the importance of standing together in the face of adversity.

When not in the field or working on projects, Scott enjoys traveling with family, further feeding his passion for storytelling through the lens of the natural world. He is an eternal optimist, inspired by the metaphor of the purple water buffalo, a symbol of world-class collaboration. Scott continues to inspire those around him with his unique vision, leading by example and empowering others to embrace their roles as vital members of the herd.

cards.title: Championing Student Success in the Age of AI
cards.description:
Educators think about student success holistically — academics, careers, and personal well-being — and they have long known that creative skills are essential to student success. With generative AI rapidly reshaping both the academic and industrial landscape, Adobe commissioned a global research study to understand its impact on teaching and learning. Join this session for a discussion on the research findings, and hear from Mala Sharma, VP of Digital Media Education at Adobe, about Adobe’s approach to designing safe, responsible AI and new programs to prepare students for a rapidly changing world. You’ll also gain insights from industry leaders at NBCUniversal and Sky on initiatives to provide students with real-world creative skills.

Key takeaways include:

  • New research on K–12 and higher education use of creative AI in the classroom
  • Insights on how creative problem-solving skills are in high demand as AI continues to reshape the workplace
  • Information about industry partner programs and micro-credential and certification programs that equip students with essential skills
cards.sessionTitle: Championing Student Success in the Age of AI

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Global Head of Education Learning and Advocacy

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Upskilling for Today’s Job Market with Digital Credentials
Championing Student Success in the Age of AI

eventSpeakers.description: Brian Johnsrud is the Global Head of Education Thought Leadership and Student Success at Adobe. As a former K-12 teacher, college lecturer, researcher and thought leader in education technology, he’s passionate about helping the next generation unlock their creativity and acquire essential digital literacy and AI skills needed for success in school, careers, and beyond. Brian is a former K12 teacher and college lecturer, with a PhD in education, digital media, and humanities, and master’s degrees in literature, media studies, and cultural anthropology. Brian also founded and directed a digital humanities and education research lab at Stanford University, designing and studying the efficacy of digital tools for learning. He also formerly led the curriculum and content team at Khan Academy, and he serves on boards and committees for a number of nonprofits and NGOs including World Economic Forum and the Rhodes Scholarship.

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Group Head, Youth and Social Impact

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Championing Student Success in the Age of AI

eventSpeakers.description:
Nishy is Group Head of Young People at Sky helping thousands of young people from all backgrounds build their digital and storytelling skills and opening the creative industry to them as well as giving a platform for young people to talk about the things they care about.

Passionate about creating opportunities for the next generation through educational and outreach programmes, building an even more employable generation for businesses, has led and delivered various immersive award-winning programmes on behalf of Sky over the past 12yrs and has also previously worked in operational roles in the Finance and Broadcast areas of the business.

Nishy has also helped young athletes and female tech entrepreneurs with the support they needed to succeed by offering media training, personal development & work experience, mentorship and sponsorship.

She is co-lead of Sky Up which is helping to address digital inequality and unlock possibilities by giving individuals access, the resources and skills to create a better future and will be reaching 250k people over the next two years.

Her work has already impacted over 300,000 young people across media, tech and sport and has led to her being awarded the Social and Humanitarian Asian Women of Achievement Award for 2020. She has also been awarded the Change Maker of the Year 2022 by The Drum Awards.

eventSpeakers.description:
Chana Messer is a Los Angeles-based educator, subject matter expert writer, artisit, and designer.

She currently runs and owns her own design studio, MAC in Art.

Her extensive teaching career in fine art and digital imaging has spanned over three decades, at several prestigious institutions including the USC Annenberg School for Communication and Journalism, the USC School of Cinematic Arts, FIDM, and UCLA.

Beyond teaching, she is an Adobe Community Expert, Adobe Education Leader, Adobe Express Ambassador, and Subject Matter Expert for numerous Adobe Certified Professional Exams.

Messer also contributes to textbooks and online courses, frequently speaks at Adobe events, hosts weekly livestreams on Behance, and shares her deep knowledge and passion for digital arts and design.

Chana is an exhibiting artist.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Championing Student Success in the Age of AI

eventSpeakers.description:
Mala Sharma is Vice President & General Manager of Adobe Express and Digital Media Education at Adobe. She practices a mindful approach to business and is passionate about building self-worth through creativity and education. A 17+ year Adobe veteran, and a key member of the leadership team that transitioned Adobe into a SaaS powerhouse, Mala’s team focuses on providing students, educators and the people who make up the Creator Economy with access to Adobe’s powerful creative tools, like Adobe Express.

She is a passionate advocate for the creative community and for making Adobe's tools widely accessible to everyone – particularly students and young creators. Mala holds a Bachelor's degree in Business and an MBA from universities in India.

cards.title: Get It Together: Building Your Brand’s Motion Design Arsenal
cards.description:
Feel like you’re only scratching the surface when it comes to unleashing the full potential of your brand assets? Find out how to elevate your creative game by making your animations not only smoother but also irresistibly captivating while retaining your brand’s overall aesthetic. Award-winning motion designer Nol Honig will share his secrets to making your After Effects projects smarter, easier to animate, and much sexier.

In this session, you’ll learn:

  • How to make animation templates from your brand assets
  • How to harness the power of the Essential Graphics panel to eliminate repetitive tasks
  • Best practices for converting brand assets into dynamic shape layers
  • How to navigate the maze of brand color systems with finesse — and much more
cards.sessionTitle: Get It Together: Building Your Brand’s Motion Design Arsenal

Get It Together: Building Your Brand’s Motion Design Arsenal

eventSpeakers.description: Nol Honig is an award-winning director and teacher who lives in New York City. In 2012 Nol was a lead animator for Barack Obama's presidential re-election campaign. Since founding The Drawing Room in 2013, he has directed work for Netflix, Coca Cola, The History Channel, and the Philadelphia Museum of Art, among others, and served as a design/animation lead for various clients including The New York Times, Google, NBC, and The Sundance Film Festival. As a freelance motion designer and art director, Nol has worked for some of the best studios in the world including Elastic, Golden Wolf, Pentagram, Buck, Gretel, and Block&Tackle. In 2017 he received a Distinguished Teaching Award for his work as an associate professor of motion graphics at Parsons School of Design, where he taught from 2001 to 2019. Most recently, Nol won a Silver Cube at the ADC awards for directing the opening title sequence for the Netflix documentary series The Andy Warhol Diaries.

cards.title: Advanced Tips, Tricks, and Shortcuts in Photoshop
cards.description:
Don’t miss this fast-paced, information-packed session in which Julieanne Kost, digital imaging evangelist at Adobe, will showcase her favorite Photoshop tips, tricks, and techniques. She’ll uncover hidden gems for graphic design workflows, including working with layers and masking, compositing and retouching, type, vectors, and more, to help you become more efficient and reach your creative vision faster than ever before.

Topics include:

  • Tips for customizing the Photoshop workspace
  • Shortcuts for working with layers, masking, and selections
  • Best practices for Smart Objects, Smart Filters, and layer comps

eventSpeakers.description: Named one of Fast Company’s “100 Most Creative People in Business,” Julieanne Kost is the Digital Imaging Evangelist Director at Adobe, responsible for fostering relationships with customers through meaningful and inspirational Photoshop and Lightroom instruction. As a highly sought-after speaker for the industry-standard Digital Imaging franchise, she devises and presents motivating and educational training sessions, sharing original techniques and tutorials worldwide — via live events, Adobe.com, and her blog (jkost.com/blog). She is also the author of “Passenger Seat—Creating a Photographic Project from Conception Through Execution” and “Window Seat — The Art of Digital Photography and Creative Thinking”, an accomplished photographer and fine artist, and creator and host of the popular Photoshop Essential Training, Lightroom & Photoshop Workflows, Photoshop Automation Techniques, and the Art of Photoshop Compositing courses for LinkedIn Learning.

cards.description:
Join acclaimed graphic designer and illustrator Javier Jaén on a conceptual journey from ideas to images as he showcases how creativity informs societal conversations. From book covers to movie posters and ad campaigns, his unique approach embodies a fusion of simplicity with deeply profound messages, addressing social and cultural issues with humor, wit, and imaginative flair. Javier will offer a glimpse into the transformative power of art in editorial illustration and cultural communication.

In this session, you’ll:

  • Explore the intersection of art and social commentary
  • Discover the process behind Javier’s iconic work, from inception to final execution
  • Gain an understanding of how to convey ideas effectively
cards.sessionTitle: Ideas to Images: A Creative Journey

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Ideas to Images: A Creative Journey

eventSpeakers.description:
Javier Jaén (Barcelona, 1983) studied graphic design and fine arts in Barcelona, New York and Budapest. His professional activity has focused on editorial illustration, book covers, audiovisual projects, advertising, cultural communication and creation of his own work. Translate stories and concepts into images using symbolic and playful language.

He has worked for The New York Times, New Yorker, Time, Washington Post, Harvard University, National Geographic, Greenpeace, Penguin Random House, Vueling, UNESCO, Camper, Banco Sabadell, Louis Vuitton, Netflix, Warner, Centro Botín, Centro Dramático Nacional , Zara, Microsoft, or El Deseo among others. He has been a professor at the European Institute of Design, Elisava, BAU, IDEP, and often gives workshops and conferences at various international art and design schools.

He has not yet written a child, planted a book or given birth to a tree.
