cards.title: Movies, Myth, Metaphor: Art of Film and TV Title Sequences

tags.title: Mainstage Broadcast
tags.description: Don’t miss the Mainstage Broadcast of Keynotes, Sneaks, Creativity Super Sessions, and Luminary Sessions. You’ll get the latest creative industry trends and updates to Adobe Creative Cloud and be inspired by stories from top luminary speakers.

cards.description:
An invitation to a bigger story. The appetizer for a delicious narrative. A portal to other worlds. The titles for film and television can be all these things and more. Beyond displaying the credits, these design sequences can evoke emotion, tease out ideas, and introduce iconic imagery. Join Karin Fong, whose work as title designer includes Spider-Man: No Way Home, Netflix’s Cowboy Bebop, and Disney’s Percy Jackson and the Olympians, as she takes you through the creative process and the lessons she’s learned. It’s a behind-the-scenes look you won’t want to skip.

The journey includes:

  • Case studies: research, ideation, and developing metaphors
  • Getting the green light: how concepts are presented and sold
  • On the cutting room floor: ideas that didn’t make it and our solves
  • Principles behind designing titles: how this informs other projects
cards.sessionTitle: Movies, Myth, Metaphor: Art of Film and TV Title Sequences

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Movies, Myth, Metaphor: Art of Film and TV Title Sequences

eventSpeakers.description:
Karin Fong is an Emmy award-winning director and designer. A founding member of Imaginary Forces, she works at the intersection of live-action, design, and animation.

Among her best-known works are the main titles for Percy Jackson and the Olympians, Tom Clancy’s Jack Ryan, Lisey’s Story, and Cowboy Bebop as well as the title sequences of numerous feature films, including Spider-Man: No Way Home and Slumberland. She has helmed spots for major brands, including LEGO, Lexus, Target, Google, PlayStation, and Herman Miller. From large-scale installations to video game content, Karin’s diverse projects showcase her unique voice in visual storytelling.

eventSpeakers.description: Terry White – Principal Director, Creative Cloud Evangelist and Community Advocate for Adobe, Inc. Terry has been with Adobe for 27 years and has extensive knowledge of Adobe’s Creative Professional product line. In his current position, he leads the charge of getting customers excited and educated about Adobe Creative Cloud products and services. In 2016 Terry White was the 34th inductee into the Photoshop Hall of Fame. He has been active in the industry for over 30 years. Terry is the host of the top ranked award winning Adobe Creative Cloud TV and has one of the most popular channels on YouTube. He is also the author of Secrets of the Adobe Bridge and co-author of The iPhone Book, The iPhone Book 2nd Edition, The iPhone Book 3rd Edition, The iPhone Book 4th Edition, The iPhone Book 5th Edition, The iPhone Book 6th Edition, and InDesign CS/CS2 Killer Tips. Terry is a key presenter at major industry shows around the world.

cards.title: Future-proof Production

tags.title: Video, Audio, and Motion
tags.description: Learn how to edit your first video, transform static graphics into motion, create an animated explainer video, and apply visual effects to a marketing video. Leverage generative AI in your video workflow and collaborate with Frame.io.

cards.description:
As the media and entertainment industry transforms to meet the needs of viewers, production is not immune. While great stories continue to delight and engage audiences, as a producer and creator, you’re faced with the challenges of budget compression, talent shortage, and soft commissioning. Whether your productions are distributed across a region or the entire planet, you deal with tight deadlines and even tighter budgets. In this panel discussion, you’ll learn:

  • About the challenges and opportunities creators and producers face when using new technologies
  • How tools can help to keep the creative process flowing while remaining future-proof.
  • What needs to be true to support artists or productions making the transition to future-proof production
  • What resources are available to help
cards.sessionTitle: Future-proof Production

eventSpeakers.description:
Rich Tu is a first generation Filipino-American and award-winning designer and artist residing in Brooklyn, NY. He is a Partner and Executive Creative Director at Sunday Afternoon. Previously, Rich has held creative leadership roles at Jones Knowles Ritchie, MTV Entertainment Group, and Nike Inc.

He has previously won the ADC Young Guns award and recently received the prestigious Paul Manship Medallion for significant contributions to the Art Directors Club and creative industry. Recently his solo exhibit, Human Response, was nominated for a Webby Award. Creatively, his focus is on emerging audiences and energetic brands that benefit from an eclectic and unique point of view.

Simon is a creative entrepreneur, having worked in film, TV & advertising for 20 years, on award winning content for global brands like ITV Studios, Netflix, Publicis, F1 and BYD, . He is a passionate storyteller, and has a track record for delivering cutting edge production solutions and innovations across multiple platforms and genres.

Chris is a media technologist with a passion for innovation and creativity. He has over 20 years experience in post production, having worked in unscripted TV, sports and live events. At AWS, Chris works with customers and partners in Europe to help them modernise their creative workflows in the cloud.

Christal Deloney's career journey began in the vibrant world of Media and Entertainment, where she spent her career working with industry giants like The Walt Disney Studios, NBC Universal, Marvel Studios, and the NFL. Her experiences at these prestigious organizations, as well as at smaller yet innovative companies like Crown Media Entertainment, Ignition Studios, and Ricky Schroder Productions, provided her with a deep understanding of the creative process and the technological advancements shaping the industry.

As a Solutions Architect, she has had the privilege of working with major studios and brands, guiding them through their cloud journeys and helping them design proofs of concepts for their workflows. Her role as a trusted advisor allowed her to introduce them to people, services, and events that familiarized them with AWS products. This experience honed her skills in integrating technology into creative productions.

cards.title: Adding Depth and a Wow Factor to Your Illustrative Work
cards.description:
If you’ve been in search of inspiration to find new ways to make your illustration work pop and really come to life, this session is for you. Join Adobe Senior Design Evangelist Michael Fugoso as he shares how he uses very basic techniques to add surprising detail, depth, and a wow factor to his illustrations in Illustrator.

In this session, Michael will cover how to:

  • Add detailed depth to your work with surprisingly simple techniques
  • Understand and manipulate lighting
  • Use both core and key tools in Illustrator like Shape Builder
  • Illustrate in multiple styles (such as flat, hyperrealistic, line)
  • Bonus: Incorporate Photoshop to achieve specific raster effects
cards.sessionTitle: Adding Depth and a Wow Factor to Your Illustrative Work

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Sr. Design Evangelist for Next Gen Creative Pros

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Adding Depth and a Wow Factor to Your Illustrative Work
Sign Your Work with Adobe Content Authenticity

eventSpeakers.description:
Hello everyone, my name is Michael Fugoso. If you are familiar with my work you probably know me via my Instagram alias FUGSTRATOR . I am an illustrator/designer originally from San Diego, now functioning in Austin, TX. I've mainly done illustrative work for some of the largest aerospace companies out there, like NASA, Boeing, Blue Origin, Ariane Group and more, and I've also done plenty of official illustrative work for massive companies like Oracle, IBM, Salesforce, Volvo and many more. And I'm now thrilled to be on the Global Evangelism team at Adobe!

Most of my life I wasn't in the professional artist/designer world. Through age 29 I lived what is perceived by many a “normal life,” going through business school and eventually working as a banker. At age 30 the arts called to me and my life changed from there.

I am 40 years old now. In the ten years of creating and illustrating a ton of spaceships, rockets, jet planes, and robots, I luckily found what I love in this latter part of my life.

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Chief Strategy Officer and EVP, Design & Emerging Products
eventSpeakers.description:
Scott Belsky leads corporate strategy and development, is responsible for design across the Digital Media and Digital Experience businesses, and is driving incubation of some of Adobe’s fastest growing emerging products. As Chief Strategy Officer, Scott plants flags for future opportunities in all of Adobe’s markets and leads investments, engagements, and acquisitions in the startup ecosystem. Scott is Adobe’s design leader, working to continuously uplevel design of all Adobe products. And he leads development of key emerging products: 3D & Immersive products, Adobe Stock & Marketplace, and Behance.

Prior to this role, Scott was Adobe’s Chief Product Officer for five years, leading development of all Creative Cloud products. Under his leadership, the company launched Adobe Express, brought flagship products like Photoshop and Illustrator to web and mobile platforms, incubated our 3D & Immersive products, and created the Content Authenticity Initiative, which fosters attribution for creators and enables transparency in digital content.

Prior to joining Adobe in December 2017, Scott was a venture investor at Benchmark in San Francisco. This is Scott’s second tenure at Adobe. He originally joined the company after it acquired Behance in 2012. At that time, he also led Adobe’s mobile and services strategy for Creative Cloud. Scott co-founded Behance in 2006 and served as its CEO for six years. Over the years, Scott has pursued other projects in the creative and investor communities. Those projects include 99U, Behance’s creative think tank and conference, and his two best-selling books, “The Messy Middle” and “Making Ideas Happen.”

Scott has been an advisor on design and product management for leading companies and institutions, including Pinterest, Uber, sweetgreen, Carta, Cheddar, Flexport, Airtable, OpenSea, Ramp, Ro, and Periscope.

Scott holds a bachelor’s degree from Cornell University and an MBA from Harvard Business School. He serves on the advisory board of Cornell University’s Entrepreneurship Program; and the board of trustees for the Smithsonian Cooper Hewitt National Design Museum.

Stacy Martinet has spent her career at the intersection of marketing, media, and technology.

As Adobe’s Vice President of Marketing Strategy and Communications, she leads a global team responsible for internal and external communications, including corporate communications, public affairs, product and customer communications, events, corporate social responsibility, industry analyst relations, as well as worldwide social media and influencer marketing. She first joined Adobe as Sr. Director of Marketing Strategy and Chief of Staff to the Company’s EVP and Chief Marketing Officer.

Before joining Adobe, Stacy was Chief Marketing Officer of Mashable. She was part of the company’s executive team — taking Mashable from a tech blog to a global consumer internet site. As CMO, she guided the company through explosive growth in users and advertisers, three rounds of funding, and a restructuring while architecting the company's marketing and communications strategy and building an integrated marketing organization across brand and demand generation channels.

Prior to Mashable, she spent nearly a decade in corporate communications and digital marketing at The New York Times during the company’s transition to digital which included a transformation of its journalism approach and the introduction of a digital subscription model. She was part of the team that pioneered the company’s first social media strategy and was recognized with the Chairman’s Award for innovation.

She was named by Folio’s Top Women in Media as a Corporate Visionary, as well as named to PR Week’s 40 Under 40 list. Stacy continues to speak and write about digital trends; her work has appeared in Mashable, The New York Times, Ad Week, and Cosmopolitan Magazine.

Stacy holds a patent for viral media content and is a member of several boards, including the Adobe Foundation board, the Ad Council board, and her past service to the New York Women in Communications board. Stacy is a graduate of Towson University.

Devon Rodriguez is the most followed visual artist in the world widely recognized for his hyper-realistic portraits, particularly those drawn or painted on the New York City subway. Born and raised in the Bronx from Puerto Rican and Honduran background, his remarkable journey has been featured in The New Yorker, The New York Times, and on the Today Show. Through the power of social media, Devon uses his platforms to digitally translate his artistic talent to a global audience, creating viral moments with not only strangers he meets on the street, but also notable celebrities such as Joe Biden, Post Malone, Ed Sheeran, Jared Leto, and Robert De Niro. Most recently he has partnered with Meta, Burberry, Coca Cola, and State Farm and launched a comprehensive 7-course education program, designed to teach the intricacies of portrait drawing to individuals of all ages. In the Fall of 2023, Devon's first solo art exhibition garnered overwhelming support with lines stretching around the block. With an impressive collective following of 59 million across various social media platforms such as Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, and Facebook, Devon Rodriguez continues to captivate his multi-generational audience worldwide.

Emonee LaRussa is a 2x Emmy award winning Motion Graphics and Director. For years she has created music visuals for artists like Megan Thee Stallion, Kanye West, Lil Nas X and many more. More recently has been she working with brands such as the Super Bowl LVII, Adobe, The Grammys, Saturday Night Live, and Intel.

Emonee is also the President of JumpStart Designers, a non-profit focused on getting computers to kids in underserved communities. She also provides students with mentorship so that they not only get the tools but the education and opportunities as well.

Jason is a NYC artist, known for bright colors and even brighter themes, commonly found on large scale murals around the world. His work explores the communication of human emotions using organic shapes, bold colors and a strong design aesthetic. Jason has worked with various brands like Coach, Pepsi, Toyota, and Microsoft. He has received global recognition for his work including a Golden Novum Design Award. In 2018, BUMBLE named Jason one of its 100 Most Inspiring New Yorkers. People love Jason for his unforgettable colors and the optimism woven into his work. His relentless positivity and kindness translate across many mediums and applications, and his technicolor murals capture the hearts of everyone who sees them. Jason brings a fresh taste of love and kindness to all of his projects, and desires to use his work to spread love, good vibes, and also do some good in the world.

cards.title: How to Best Capture the Magic of a Destination in Photos

tags.title: Europe, Middle East, and Africa Day 2
Photography
tags.description: Spark your passion for photography with sessions that will help you build your photography skills and more easily achieve photo editing results you’re proud of using AI-powered tools and workflows, whether you’re taking photos with a smartphone or a mirrorless camera.

cards.description:
Join photographer, Adobe Insider, and world traveler Ron Timehin as he demonstrates how to capture the essence of a travel destination through photos. Ron will share expert tips and techniques for photographing diverse travel subjects, post-processing images, and curating a photography essay, including practical aspects of curating and editing landscapes, cityscapes, and portraits using Photoshop Lightroom. This approach will help you build a comprehensive body of work that celebrates a destination and creates memories long after the trip ends.

Youll learn how to:

  • Maximize photo opportunities through effective planning and equipment selection
  • Photograph locations and people to tell the story of a destination
  • Curate a series of images to tell a story
  • Edit landscapes, cityscapes, and portraits to make them look their best
  • Develop and maintain a cohesive visual style across subjects
cards.sessionTitle: How to Best Capture the Magic of a Destination in Photos

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: How to Best Capture the Magic of a Destination in Photos

eventSpeakers.description:
Ron Timehin, is a contemporary and commercial photographer and video director based in London.

Over more than a decade, Ron has had the incredible opportunity to work with a diverse range of clients, from household names like Apple, Adidas, Adobe, and American Express to iconic brands such as Disney, Christian Louboutin, and Sony. These collaborations have been both professionally fulfilling and have allowed him to explore the intersection of art and commerce in his work. Ron's work, recognised internationally, has been featured in esteemed publications like British Vogue, GQ, and The Financial Times.

More recently, Ron’s work has focused on social justice issues. He believes that the culmination of art and storytelling can create a force for positive change. His work with Dove, in particular, has contributed significantly to changing legislation in the UK.

His journey has also led him to establish ambassadorship contracts with amazing companies like Adobe and Sony. These partnerships have been instrumental in pushing the boundaries of his craft, and he is grateful for the ongoing creative exchange they provide.

Ron is incredibly proud to have published his first solo photography book entitled "London Fog." This body of work is very dear to his heart, and he is thrilled to have it available not only in renowned bookstores like Waterstones but also online through Amazon. The fact that "London Fog" was recognised as one of The TIMES Photography Books of the Year in 2019 is truly an honour and a testament to his dedication to his work.

Ron also regularly hosts photography workshops! These have been practical and in the field or as online presentations, with his most significant to date exceeding 15,000 participants.

cards.title: Post-production Magic with Latest Premiere Pro AI Features

tags.title: Europe, Middle East, and Africa Day 2
Video, Audio, and Motion
tags.description: Learn how to edit your first video, transform static graphics into motion, create an animated explainer video, and apply visual effects to a marketing video. Leverage generative AI in your video workflow and collaborate with Frame.io.

cards.description:
You’ve shot your footage and are ready to take your video project from assembly to final cut. In this session, join award-winning filmmaker Dennis Schmelz to discover new post-production AI features in Adobe Premiere Pro that help to streamline your workflow and save time, even when you need to get your cuts back, edit audio and voiceovers, update color grading, add subtitles, and more.

Here’s what you’ll explore:

  • Only have the final output? Get your cuts back with Scene Edit Detection.
  • Update your color grading using a masking workflow.
  • Adjust voiceover and improve speech with Enhance Speech.
  • Add subtitles with the new Text-Based Editing feature.
  • Add some cool titles and use Auto Reframe to prep it for your social channels.
cards.sessionTitle: Post-production Magic with Latest Premiere Pro AI Features

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Post-production Magic with Latest Premiere Pro AI Features

eventSpeakers.description:
Dennis Schmelz, a professional filmmaker from Erfurt, Germany, explores new and exciting places, meets interesting people, and engages with unique stories in the course of his work.

He dedicates his effort and dedication to absorbing these valuable impressions and creating authentic, inspiring, and visually stunning films.

For Dennis Schmelz, filmmaking is not just an occupation but primarily a passion, and he enjoys every aspect of the process of a new project.

There is always a story to tell and a fresh perspective to be discovered.

In this engaging and informative session, Adobe Certified Instructor Luisa Winters will guide you through the fundamentals of After Effects, providing you with a solid foundation to create stunning motion graphics and visual effects. Whether you’re a graphic designer, video editor, or aspiring motion graphics artist, this session will empower you to unleash your creativity and take your projects to the next level. cards.title: AI-Powered Innovation: Leaping Ahead and Staying There

tags.title: Europe, Middle East, and Africa Day 2
Creativity and Design in Business
tags.description: Inspiring speakers from the world’s biggest brands and agencies share their expertise and insights about creative leadership in the generative AI era. Topics range from brand reinvention and strategy to creative productivity tips and brave new tools.

cards.description:
Generative AI has prompted a dramatic change in the speed of business. The pace of innovation in content production is at an all-time high, raising the level of competition. And it’s increasingly surprising what “non-experts” can do so quickly. Creatives need a new playbook to accelerate the pace at which they work, and Michael Pell, Envisioneer | The Microsoft Garage, will share his ideas on what it should include. The ability to instantly envision, iterate, and deliver is how we’ll continue to lead our organizations in this time of unprecedented change.

In this session, you’ll learn how to:

  • Demonstrate bold new ideas in a matter of minutes
  • Hack together visual walkthroughs or working prototypes in no time
  • Validate those concepts to provide data to justify the work
  • Attract sponsorship in early stages
  • Showcase your own superpowers throughout
cards.sessionTitle: AI-Powered Innovation: Leaping Ahead and Staying There

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: AI-Powered Innovation: Leaping Ahead and Staying There
AI-Powered Innovation: Leaping Ahead and Staying There
New Creative Flows: The GenAI Jump-Start

eventSpeakers.description:
M. Pell leads The Microsoft Garage in New York City, where he regularly disrupts the thinking, strategy, and business models of the world’s leading companies and organizations.

Bold, insightful, and uncompromising, Pell has spent over three decades pushing the tech industry’s boundaries well past innovative design and technologies into the realm of true breakthroughs. Today, many of those world-changing breakthroughs are imbedded in our everyday lives – such as inventing Adobe Acrobat and PDF (1990), pioneering the first version of the web-based Metaverse (1995), designing early Smartphone experiences (2002), and creating the first WYSIWYG Font menu for the original Macintosh (1985),.

Widely recognized as a world-class Designer and inspiring thought leader in the fields of Innovation, Data + AI, and Visualization, Pell has authored three books on the subjects, and teaches a course on the impact of AI and Metaverse technologies on Fashion for Polimoda, one of Italy’s leading Fashion schools in Florence.

Pell’s evolution from intrepid entrepreneur, to VC-backed startup veteran, to corporate man for Adobe and Microsoft has given him a unique perspective on how to combine business, design, and technology to create truly breakthrough experiences in any field.

tags.title: Creativity and Design in Business
tags.description: Inspiring speakers from the world’s biggest brands and agencies share their expertise and insights about creative leadership in the generative AI era. Topics range from brand reinvention and strategy to creative productivity tips and brave new tools.

cards.description:
Are you feeling a mix of excitement and anxiety about the latest AI advances presented at MAX? The tools are at your fingertips, and innovation seems limitless, but when you get back to work, reality sets in as your organization’s restrictions and interdependencies limit your potential. How can you innovate where you are, and what if other more tech-savvy companies outpace you? In this session, join Deloitte Digital experts to find out how to make the most of this exciting new world (without going down a rabbit hole).

You’ll learn how to:

  • Get your brand ready for generative AI to create personalized customer experiences
  • Scale AI-driven creativity with the Deloitte Digital Butterfly Effect approach
  • Implement three quick tips to keep your brand ahead of the curve

Creatives are producing compelling, high-quality assets, and the key to success is amplifying and reusing these assets in ways that stay true to the brand, while delivering the speed and scalability marketers need for personalized, data-driven campaigns. Discover how Adobe GenStudio empowers creative and marketing teams to work together to scale content, drive personalization, and optimize performance.

Featuring Tim Furlow, senior manager, personalization, from Lenovo, this session will feature real-world use cases and live demos to showcase how Lenovo uses GenStudio to deliver efficiency, real-time insights, and campaign success at scale. The session will bring to life how teams can collaborate seamlessly, enabling marketers to self-serve while helping to ensure brand consistency.

eventSpeakers.description:
Cheriss May is a lauded editorial and portrait photographer, selected by Peerspace as one of “The 12 Best Editorial Photographers in Washington, D.C.”, her passion radiates through her aptitude to connect to the soul of those she photographs. Cheriss is a member of the Board of Directors — Focus on the Story, past president — Women Photojournalists of Washington (WPOW), and co-chair of photography — The National Press Club.

Cheriss was working at the U.S. Capitol on January 6, 2021, documenting the ceremonial Presidential vote count during the insurrection. She finds strength through telling the powerful stories of people who are passionate in what they do, resilient despite challenges. She is an advocate for inclusive storytellers and storytelling.

Cheriss is an adjunct professor at her Alma Mater, Howard University, in Washington, D.C., she is a Leica Ambassador for the M11-P, the world's first camera capable of verifying the authenticity of digital images — Content Authenticity Initiative (CAI), a mentor at Savannah College of Art and Design (SCAD), an Adobe Education Leader, and Adobe CAI Pioneer.

Cheriss is a frequent contributor to The New York Times, and People magazine, she has been published in O Magazine, The White House website, ABC News, The Robb Report, The Today Show, and other publications. Her work is featured in the permanent collections of the African American Museum in Philadelphia, Pa., and the Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture in Harlem, NY.

Selected by ADCOLOR x Meta “Black Creators You Should Know”, Cheriss is commissioned to speak, and lead initiatives for organizations around the world, including Spotify, Adobe, Leica Camera, The Financial Times, The Phillips Collection, the Center for Creative Photography, and the International Center of Photography.

Originally from Kansas City, Mo., Cheriss is based in Washington, D.C., and Los Angeles, Ca.

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Sr. Design Evangelist for Next Gen Creative Pros

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Adding Depth and a Wow Factor to Your Illustrative Work
Sign Your Work with Adobe Content Authenticity

eventSpeakers.description:
Hello everyone, my name is Michael Fugoso. If you are familiar with my work you probably know me via my Instagram alias FUGSTRATOR . I am an illustrator/designer originally from San Diego, now functioning in Austin, TX. I've mainly done illustrative work for some of the largest aerospace companies out there, like NASA, Boeing, Blue Origin, Ariane Group and more, and I've also done plenty of official illustrative work for massive companies like Oracle, IBM, Salesforce, Volvo and many more. And I'm now thrilled to be on the Global Evangelism team at Adobe!

Most of my life I wasn't in the professional artist/designer world. Through age 29 I lived what is perceived by many a “normal life,” going through business school and eventually working as a banker. At age 30 the arts called to me and my life changed from there.

I am 40 years old now. In the ten years of creating and illustrating a ton of spaceships, rockets, jet planes, and robots, I luckily found what I love in this latter part of my life.

cards.title: Pro Illustrator Techniques and New Features for Next-level Designs
cards.description:
Ready to level up your design game? In this session, dive into brand new features, cool shortcuts, and workflows in Illustrator you probably haven’t heard of yet. If you’re all about crafting sleek logos or modern graphics, Evangelist Kladi Vergine at Adobe has some killer tips and tricks up her sleeve to boost your creativity and productivity. Plus, she’ll show how you can play around with generative AI to get your creative juices flowing and make your design process faster than ever.

In this session, you’ll:

  • Master brand new features as well as little-known tips every designer should know
  • Learn how to create complex graphics without adding complex vectors
  • Pick up expert tips when working with type, as well productivity features when changing and exporting graphics
cards.sessionTitle: Pro Illustrator Techniques and New Features for Next-level Designs

eventSpeakers.description:
Kladi is an award-winning designer, visual strategist, instructor, author and Sr. Design Evangelist and Community Advocate at Adobe. Kladi has a long title with an even bigger mission: to empower, inspire, and support the creative community while sharing design and career tips. But most importantly a job that allows Kladi to focus on what she loves: People, Design, and Innovation. Reach out @iamkladi, her DM is always open for a chat.

Kladi runs an Instagram live show “Creative Connection Live” where the creative community comes together every week.

As a self-published author, Kladi's illustrated book, Plant Therapy, won the world-renowned Fedrigoni TOP Designer Award for her unique use of cotton papers and ink. Kladi has also been the winner of Infohackit and Adobe's Creative Jam during San Francisco Design Week.

In addition to her design work, Kladi often leads graphic design masterclasses for Adobe Live, Adobe events in UK and Design tutorials with over 5M views worldwide.

Kladi has also led social media asset creation workshops for House Representatives in Washington, D.C. for over 4 years. Kladi took part in Adobe MAX every year since 2019,in USA and also in UK as a featured speaker in the Design industry.

She was also a speaker at the exciting Illustrator Summit 2021, Creative PRO WEEK conference, Design & Marketing Summit, Design CUTS, and shared workflow tips in Illustrator in Spanish during Talent Land in Guadalajara, Mexico, and again during the Talented at Home. D many more design conferences around the world.

Kladi is a LinkedIn Learning and Creative Live author and producer; she was also named one of the world's top Illustrator instructors by Adobe Education.

Kladi recently authored, designed, and produced the Adobe Illustrator Bootcamp available on Adobe Education Exchange, Adobe Illustrator Conquests (animation & storyline-based onboarding for Ai beginners); Illustrator and Photoshop Cross-App onboarding hybrid tutorials, Creative essentials training course, Adobe Photoshop and Adobe Illustrator Templates with follow-along tutorials, hands-on tutorials available inside Illustrator's Discover Panel and the interconnected hybrid animated Photoshop and Illustrator videos that lead to the hands-on tutorials.

In this jam-packed session, director Valentina Vee will speedrun as many hidden tips and tricks as possible in order to make you a faster and more productive editor. Get your notebook ready as this session will run at a feverish pace.

You’ll learn how to:

  • Master split-second timeline shortcuts for editing efficiency
  • Optimize project setups for turbocharged editing workflows
  • Seamlessly manipulate footage with cat-like reflexes
  • Maximize the impact of effects, graphics, and music with lightning-paced precision

cards.description:
With tighter deadlines, growing demand for content, and even more emerging technologies on the horizon for the creative landscape, how can you make sure to not get overwhelmed and stay true to your craft?

Find out how Logitech’s Product and Design Team are driven to find ways to empower you with personal experiences that bring you closer to your craft, through technological innovations that don’t overcomplicate, and instead, simplify, all so that you can ultimately create as fast as you can think and find your shortcut to mastery.

As a Norwegian and Italian designer, growing up in Switzerland, he studied interaction design and new media at the prestigious ECAL/University of Arts and Design, Lausanne. Giulio has led the experience design for some of Logitech's most popular and appreciated products. Throughout his career, his work has been recognized by respected design juries such as Red Dot, IF, and Good Design, and has been featured in international magazines and exhibitions; Forbes, FastCo, Salone del Mobile, Dubai Design Week, Design Days, and more… But it’s mostly recognized by the millions of people who experience the products he's helped bring to market every day. Giulio takes a very personal and unique approach to design and product development. He's challenging the status quo and will extend his reach beyond design execution. He influences and helps shape how teams are set up, how they collaborate, how they approach and solve problems, so that design intent and mindset proliferates across functions.

eventSpeakers.description: Alba is a Senior Global Product Manager originally from Barcelona, Spain, with over seven years of experience in the tech industry. She has driven cutting-edge hardware and software innovations at major tech corporations such as HP Inc. and Logitech S.A. With a keen eye for emerging trends and a deep understanding of user needs, Alba has successfully launched numerous groundbreaking products, blending creativity with strategic thinking. Her portfolio includes high-profile projects within the printing and consumer electronics industries, delivering solutions that integrate hardware and software innovation for both B2B and B2C audiences. Fluent in four languages, Alba can easily communicate and collaborate across diverse teams and markets. Her expertise lies in identifying market opportunities and transforming them into successful products that meet and exceed industry standards.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Discover your Untapped Potential: Your Shortcut to Mastery

eventSpeakers.description:
Maxime began his journey in the music industry, primarily focusing on French rap. He directed his first video in 2017 and has since created numerous visuals for internationally acclaimed artists such as Ayra Starr, Amaarae, SDM, Dinos, Flohio, and Dajak.

Simultaneously, Maxime honed his photography skills, quickly advancing to art direction roles for various global artists. His creative expression spans a diverse range of media, including music videos, short films, cover art, and photographic novels.

This versatility soon attracted collaborations with prestigious brands like Dior, Accor Hotels, and Hublot, leading to a gradual shift towards commissioned work in fashion and advertising.

In 2022, Maxime spent fifty days alone in Thailand, focusing on self-discovery and exploration. Although not initially intended as a creative project, this journey inspired a series of 17 photographs, which he later exhibited at a Paris gallery in October 2023 under the title "Thāyrūp."

Ath the end of 2023, Maxime spent 2 months in Nepal, co-directing his first documentary on the subject of mental health in paragliding and alpinism.

Currently, Maxime is working on his first book, a catalog for his debut exhibition, while continuing to travel the world in pursuit of bold and innovative projects.

tags.title: Creativity and Design in Business
tags.description: Inspiring speakers from the world’s biggest brands and agencies share their expertise and insights about creative leadership in the generative AI era. Topics range from brand reinvention and strategy to creative productivity tips and brave new tools.

cards.description:
Bringing great campaigns to life requires great creativity. But with great creativity, the level of effort to create thousands of different variations for different channels, sizes, languages, and variations can limit a good campaign from becoming a great one. Join Michael Dobell, EVP of Monks, and Adobe’s director of Firefly marketing Elliot Sedegah to learn about on-brand content generation at scale with Adobe Firefly Services - and what role creativity will play in the future of marketing content.
In this session, you'll learn:

  • How forward-thinking creative teams are already incorporating automated genAI tools to support personalizing creative assets
  • Practical ways to build a future-ready content strategy that includes GenAI for scaled content creation
  • Best practices for upskilling and empowering your team to keep the creative work strategic, exciting, and rooted in artistry – and not stuck resizing assets

eventSpeakers.description:
Michael Dobell is a co-founder and EVP for Innovation at Monks. His focus is on expanding the agency’s digital service offerings and expressing it to customers and the market. Previously Michael co-led digital design agency Jam3’s successful merger with Media.Monks. Michael is the Vice Chair of the Society of Digital Agencies (SoDA), and Strategy Director at the Squamish Windsports Society.

Over the past decade Michael's teams have won many industry awards and accolades, including the very first Cannes Cyber Lion, The One Show, D&AD, and over 100 Favorite Website Awards. His writing work and interviews have appeared in The Globe and Mail, Creativity, Applied Arts, Fast Company, Communication Arts, as well as Forester, who in 2021 selected Jam3 as ‘North American Digital innovation Agency of the Year’. Mike was born in Canada, has lived in Washington, California, Japan and Toronto (in that order) and he now lives on the traditional and unceded territory of the Sḵwx̱wú7mesh Nation along with his family. He grew up on omni magazine, Nat Geo, and Blue Peter; but really he likes to say he’s from the internet.

Elliot partners closely with Product Management and Engineering teams to drive the development and adoption of Generative AI features across Creative Cloud offerings. With a focus on innovation and growth, Elliot is a key player in Adobe’s efforts to transform the creative enterprise landscape through differentiated, AI-powered solutions.

Elliot holds an MBA from the MIT Sloan School of Management, an MS in Engineering Management from The George Washington University, and a BS in Computer Engineering from the University of Maryland. He is also a co-founder of the Akumaning-Brewu Foundation, an educational non-profit dedicated to supporting students in Ghana.

cards.title: Mastering Low-Light Photography from Capture to Edit

tags.title: Photography
tags.description: Spark your passion for photography with sessions that will help you build your photography skills and more easily achieve photo editing results you’re proud of using AI-powered tools and workflows, whether you’re taking photos with a smartphone or a mirrorless camera.

cards.description:
Join internationally renowned photographer Jarrad Seng as he reveals the techniques behind his most striking low-light images. Whether it’s the unpredictability of the live music arena, a dimly lit portrait shoot, or a midnight mission under the stars, shooting in low-light and challenging lighting conditions requires specialized skills and creativity. This session delves into Jarrad’s workflow for tackling these sorts of tough photography assignments, from capture to final export from Photoshop Lightroom on desktop.

You’ll walk away from this session with an understanding of:

  • Creative approaches and technical considerations for successful low-light images
  • Techniques for creating atmosphere through exposure and colour
  • How to draw out details from the shadows and reduce noise in your images
  • Which AI tools will help you turn low-light challenges into high-impact imagery

cards.title: How Iconic Brands Use Color to Connect with Customers

tags.title: Graphic Design and Illustration
tags.description: Bring your creative vision to life. Learn how you can leverage new generative AI tools to assist your content development, create in new ways, and gain more control over your workflows and outputs. Get inspired to revisit the way you approach design.

cards.description:
Choosing the right color involves creativity, precision, and skill. With color boosting brand recognition by 87% and influencing 85% of purchases, how do designers evoke emotion and ensure accuracy? Join fashion designer Bibhu Mohapatra and creative innovator R. John Fidelino to get insights on color strategies and tools from their recent Pantone collaboration. Explore the impact of color on design and branding with top experts.

This session will cover:

  • Brand recognition: Hear how color enhances brand visibility by 87% and influences 85% of purchasing decisions.
  • Expert insights: Learn from fashion designer Bibhu Mohapatra and creative innovator R. John Fidelino.
  • Collaborative tools: Discover techniques from their recent Pantone collaboration.
  • Color accuracy: Gain strategies to ensure consistency from concept to final product.
  • Practical guidance: Get tips for both seasoned design professionals and newcomers.
cards.sessionTitle: How Iconic Brands Use Color to Connect with Customers

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: How Iconic Brands Use Color to Connect with Customers

eventSpeakers.description:
Bibhu Mohapatra’s eponymous label, launched in 2008, reflects his deep reverence for craft, blending ancient traditions with modern design. Known for his strong tailoring and expressive yet wearable pieces, his collections quickly garnered the attention of influential figures, including Michelle Obama, Lupita Nyong’o, and Gwyneth Paltrow, making his dresses and sharply cut jackets sought-after collector’s items.

Rooted in his upbringing in Odisha, India, and inspired by his mother’s teachings in handwork and textiles, Bibhu’s creations carry a dedication to both functionality and symbolism. “My memories of my mother and her teaching me to sew are always very much a part of my design process,” he reflects.

After serving as design director for J. Mendel and working at Halston, Bibhu established his brand in New York City, where his “thinking box” studio became the birthplace of his label’s ethos: creating clothing that instills confidence and self-assurance in women. As he explains, “I want my designs to give women a deep sense of self-assurance, reminding them of who they are.”

Over the years, Bibhu has received numerous accolades, including the Ecco Domani Fashion Foundation Award and the National Arts Club’s Young Innovator Award. He is also a member of the Council of Fashion Designers of America (CFDA). In 2016, he expanded his offerings with the launch of Artemis, a fine jewelry collection in collaboration with De Beers Forevermark.

In 2021, Bibhu opened his first flagship store in Tribeca, New York, further cementing his brand's growth. He remains focused on creating timeless, empowering designs that celebrate the strength and elegance of the women who wear them.

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Head of Brand Innovation & Commercial Impact

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: How Iconic Brands Use Color to Connect with Customers

eventSpeakers.description: "With 30 years in branding and marketing, R. John Fidelino has been a driving force behind influential brands in technology, health, and design, including Viagra, Johnson’s, Medtronic, and Pantone. As Head of Innovation and Impact, he develops and implements cutting-edge strategies to enhance brand visibility and influence. At The Development, R. John applies his extensive B2B marketing experience to ensure that company and product value resonates with both customers and consumers. His background in neuroscience helps him blend objectivity with creativity and understand cognitive processes, resulting in more effective and empathetic strategies. By treating companies and consumers as real people, he gains deep insights into their needs and designs more meaningful solutions. This approach drives his team to create unique ideas that capture attention and inspire people to reconsider their typical choices and behaviors. R. John is passionate about valuing diverse perspectives, which he believes is crucial for building strong internal teams and fostering impactful external collaborations, ultimately leading to transformative branding and marketing practices. He has also served as jury president for Cannes Lions and Dubai Lynx, and as a juror for the LIAs and OneShow. "

Turning Your Art Doodles and Lettering into Fun Patterns

eventSpeakers.description: Shelly Kim is the artist behind Letters By Shells! She’s a self-taught artist specializing in lettering, DIY and fun illustrations. Shelly started creating art in 2015 to release stress from work and to decorate her work cubicle with fun, colorful positive affirmations. A few years after discovering her love for art, Shelly finally turned her art hobby into a full-time career making it a mission for her artwork to express love and positivity!

cards.title: Beating Algorithms: Social Strategies for Driving Growth

tags.title: Social Media and Marketing
tags.description: Leverage the power of social media and marketing to elevate your brand, expand your business, and cultivate a devoted audience. Craft compelling content, maximize the impact of every post, and master differentiation in multi-channel marketing.

cards.description:
Delve into the complexities of social media algorithms and discover the creative strategies that fuel growth with Lia Haberman, distinguished creator economy expert and author of the ICYMI newsletter.

In this session, you’ll uncover:

  • Crafting a social-first approach: Master the art of creating content with a social-first mindset, ensuring that your posts resonate deeply with your audience and boost engagement.
  • Platform and format accelerators: Explore the platforms and post formats that drive exponential growth, and learn how to leverage them effectively for maximum impact.
  • Repurposing content for amplification: Learn the importance of repurposing creative effectively to amplify your brand message across different platforms and channels.
  • How to create content that stands out: Find out how Adobe Express can enhance your content creation process.
cards.sessionTitle: Beating Algorithms: Social Strategies for Driving Growth

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Beating Algorithms: Social Strategies for Driving Growth

eventSpeakers.description:
Lia Haberman is a distinguished Creator Economy and Influencer Marketing expert and author of the ICYMI newsletter that goes out to over 25K subscribers — sharing weekly social media trend and platform updates with marketers and creators.

She’s been tapped for her social media insights by brands such as Google, Robert Half, and AT&T; led social branding workshops for Macy's, the Costume Designers Guild, Hourglass Cosmetics and Riot Games; and has grown corporate accounts in roles at Yahoo, E! Entertainment and Livestrong.com, creating opportunities for millions of dollars in branded partnerships.

Beyond brand work, Lia has worked for and with multiple creators. Most recently, she partnered with YouTubers Colin and Samir this summer to lead live community sessions as part of their 30-day cohort-based course, Creator Startup, which takes creators through the foundations of building their creator business.

Lia has taught social media and influencer marketing at UCLA Extension since 2018; is a speaker at conferences worldwide; has been featured on NPR’s Planet Money and is quoted by media outlets such as in The Washington Post, Business Insider, Ad Age and more.

When she’s not scrolling social media for work, she’s following food accounts on Instagram and TikTok to find new places to eat.

tags.title: Creativity and Design in Business
tags.description: Inspiring speakers from the world’s biggest brands and agencies share their expertise and insights about creative leadership in the generative AI era. Topics range from brand reinvention and strategy to creative productivity tips and brave new tools.

cards.description: With over 700 locations across three brands, Texas Roadhouse is a rapidly growing organization with an equally demanding need for content creation. In this session, discover how their creative team turns data into action — tracking everything from designer workloads to seasonal trends. We’ll dive into the tools and strategies they use to make every creative decision count, from boosting team retention to securing critical resources from a data-driven CMO. You’ll walk away with actionable insights to measure and analyze your own metrics, elevate your creative impact, and prove your team’s ROI.
cards.sessionTitle: Sizzling Stats: How Texas Roadhouse Serves Up Creative ROI

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Sizzling Stats: How Texas Roadhouse Serves Up Creative ROI

eventSpeakers.description: Sarah, a former Lytho customer, has over 10 years of marketing and communications experience. A previous creative manager and graphic designer, she is now unpacking the intricacies of our industry to develop and deploy products that help creative teams deliver the best content outcomes by quieting the chaos that threatens imagination. She holds a bachelor’s degree in speech communications and a master’s degree in sport management, both from Baylor University.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Sizzling Stats: How Texas Roadhouse Serves Up Creative ROI

eventSpeakers.description: Design is my passion! I am the Senior Design Manager at the Texas Roadhouse support center, based in Louisville, KY, where I manage a team of designers, creative process, and provide creative direction. My specialties are typography, brainstorming, problem solving, data reporting and coaching. A few of my pet peeves are kerning, integrity and punctuality. I enjoy helping my local community through design, such as partnering with my church to create communication tools to keep people connected. I feel lucky that my passion can be used in my day-to-day life and not be “just a job.” When I’m not designing, you can find me with family (#BoyMom), at a local brewery or catching a concert with friends.

cards.title: Creativity Super Session: Video and AI

tags.title: Mainstage Broadcast
tags.description: Don’t miss the Mainstage Broadcast of Keynotes, Sneaks, Creativity Super Sessions, and Luminary Sessions. You’ll get the latest creative industry trends and updates to Adobe Creative Cloud and be inspired by stories from top luminary speakers.

cards.description:
Discover how AI is revolutionizing video creation by automating tedious tasks, inspiring creative ideation, and helping creators craft more captivating content. Join top video professionals Meagan Keane and Kylee Peña from Adobe, along with Brian Sanford and Justin Barnes from sought-after creative production studio Versus, who are known for their visually rich and original work that has helped define today’s most influential brands, to see how AI is used by leading creatives to produce award-winning work.

You’ll learn how AI features in Adobe Premiere Pro and After Effects can increase productivity and enhance creativity, including:

  • Innovations in generative AI to tell new stories and reimagine existing ones
  • Text-Based Editing that auto-generates transcripts and makes video editing as easy as cutting and pasting text
  • Enhance Speech to improve dialogue recordings
  • Essential Sound to speed up audio edits
cards.sessionTitle: Creativity Super Session: Video and AI

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Creativity Super Session: Video and AI

eventSpeakers.description: As Director of Post Production at Versus, Brian leads a global creative team of editors working for some of the world's biggest brands and agencies. An award-winning commercial editor himself, Brian also leads the technical workflow team, ensuring each project's specific needs are met and integrating new technologies into Versus' creative pipelines.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Creativity Super Session: Video and AI

eventSpeakers.description: Award-winning Creative Director and Founding Partner at Versus. Over the last 11 years, Justin has been instrumental in shaping the creative vision of Versus, as well as overseeing the innovative work Versus creates for today’s most impactful brands, agencies, and entertainment partners. Under his leadership, Versus has grown to become the influential, award-winning creative studio it is today, with a focus on making truly original work that spans across all mediums and styles.

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Sr. Product Marketing Manager, Pro Editorial

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Creativity Super Session: Video and AI

eventSpeakers.description:
Kylee Peña is Product Marketing Manager for Pro Editorial at Adobe where she is part of the team driving the future of Premiere Pro. As a former editor herself, she’s a seasoned problem-solver who wants to bridge the gap between creative and technology to help all kinds of people tell their stories.

Kylee has over 15 years of experience in post-production including hundreds of television and film credits as both a creative and technical professional on shows like Jane the Virgin, Colony, and Scorpion. Most recently she spent five years at Netflix where she built and led a program management team for creative technologies and production innovation.

Kylee is a Hollywood Region Governor for the Society of Motion Picture and Television Engineers (SMPTE) and an Active Member of the Television Academy's Science and Technology Peer Group. She's been published across industry journals and named a TVN Woman to Watch in Technology, a Top Technologist and Woman in Post and Production, and nominated for RISE Influencer Award.

Kylee holds a bachelor’s degree in media arts from Indiana University and a master’s degree in Integrated Design, Business, and Technology from University of Southern California. She is also a Project Management Professional (PMP) and Certified Scrum Master (CSM). She is an outspoken advocate for underrepresented people in media, entertainment, and technology.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Creativity Super Session: Video and AI

eventSpeakers.description: Meagan Keane is Director of Product Marketing for Adobe Professional Film & Video, but her beginnings were in documentary film. She was a producer across numerous documentary features including High School 911 (2016), Defining Beauty (Audience Award for Best Documentary, Newport Film Festival, 2011), We Live in Public (Sundance Grand Jury Winner, 2009) and Join Us (LA International Film Festival documentary selection, 2007). Meagan joined the Adobe Premiere Pro Management team in 2012 and has led business strategy across the Adobe video portfolio since 2019. She is a thought leader in the film and video industry, recently speaking on behalf of Adobe at the AIS Lumiere Awards, Sundance Film Festival and quoted in Forbes Magazine regarding the future of filmmaking. She loves remaining connected to the film industry, while influencing future innovation in her field. Meagan has an MFA in film production from USC’s School of Cinematic Arts and sits on the Board of Governors for the Advanced Imaging Society.

cards.description: Join us for an informative session on Photoshop 2025 designed for creatives eager to leverage the latest features and generative AI tools. This course delves into cutting-edge techniques for compositing, masking, and enhancing images. Learn from a seasoned professional and discover pro tips and tricks that will elevate your digital artistry. Whether you’re looking to streamline your workflow or push the boundaries of your creativity, this class provides the insights and skills needed to stay ahead in the ever-evolving world of Photoshop.
cards.sessionTitle: Master Photoshop 2025: Exploring Features and Generative AI

Design Like a Pro: Crafting High-Impact Assets in Photoshop
Master Photoshop 2025: Exploring Features and Generative AI

eventSpeakers.description: Jesús Ramirez is an Adobe Community Expert, graphic artist and educator specializing in Adobe Photoshop. With over 20 years of professional experience, his clients include Adobe, Microsoft, and Conde Nast. Most recently, he has worked as a Finisher with some of the biggest names in entertainment, creating film and TV posters for CBS, Discovery, HBO, HULU, and Netflix. Jesús has a passion for sharing his expertise and knowledge. He is perhaps best known as the founder of the Photoshop Training Channel, a popular YouTube channel with over 2 million subscribers. As a sought-after speaker, he has participated in over 40 conferences, including some of the largest industry events in Australia, Asia, Latin America, and the US.

sessionTrack.title: Graphic Design and Illustration
sessionTrack.description: Bring your creative vision to life. Learn how you can leverage new generative AI tools to assist your content development, create in new ways, and gain more control over your workflows and outputs. Get inspired to revisit the way you approach design.

cards.title: Empower On-brand Content Creation
cards.description:
Monty Hood, Brand Automation Lead at Red Hat, has spent his career leading strategic design teams with innovative tech — from traditional design to content automation and now through the generative AI revolution. Join him in this session as he shares insights from years of managing creative and marketing operations — and offers a playbook for driving effective creative work by empowering teams to develop on-brand content.

You’ll learn:

  • How integration between Creative Cloud and Adobe Express can streamline your design workflow, giving creative teams more bandwidth to design new ways of engaging customers
  • Strategies for empowering everyone in the organization to easily create brand-appropriate content and accomplish in minutes what used to take days
  • How generative AI can help anyone create ethically sound, market-ready content
cards.sessionTitle: Empower On-brand Content Creation

eventSpeakers.description: In his 17 years at Red Hat, Monty has gone from leading the Redhat.com web operations team, to building a project management team in Marketing Communications to now overseeing brand automation globally. Monty began his career in the early days of the web, running a web development business and partnering with traditional marketing firms to bring their clients online. Monty retains the perspective of a small business owner and knows that at the end of each day you need to demonstrate the value of your work. Outside of work he is a consummate creator, always working on actualizing a new idea.

cards.title: The Art and Craft of Visualizing Knowledge, Not Data
cards.description:
In today’s data-driven world where information is more prevalent than ever before, communicating complex information effectively and impactfully is crucial. Learn how Valentina D'Efilippo, an award-winning designer, creative director, and author, goes beyond standard charts, turning data into meaningful experiences that enhance knowledge. She’ll illustrate her approach to fostering understanding, connectivity, compassion, and action, utilizing tools like Illustrator.

In this session, you’ll:

  • Discover how to transform raw data into stunning and unique forms, far beyond conventional graphs
  • Be inspired about the far-reaching applications of data design — from business intelligence to theater and illustrated books
  • Reflect on data and designs role in shaping perceptions and the importance of acknowledging biases in your work
cards.sessionTitle: The Art and Craft of Visualizing Knowledge, Not Data

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: The Art and Craft of Visualizing Knowledge, Not Data

eventSpeakers.description:
Valentina D'Efilippo, an award-winning designer, creative director, and author, is renowned for her ability to inspire, move, and connect people through data-driven experiences.

Her work includes the critically acclaimed "The Infographic History of the World," and the innovative "Britannica’s Encyclopedia Infographica," a children's encyclopedia filled with facts and infographics about the universe, wildlife, and human anatomy.

Valentina's creativity and insight have led to collaborations with diverse organizations, from startups to global brands, in various fields and formats, including theatre performances, exhibitions, and digital platforms.

Beyond her projects, Valentina is passionate about education and knowledge sharing, offering coaching to corporate teams, lecturing at institutions like Columbia Business School, and running popular Masterclasses. Her contributions to the field have been internationally exhibited and are part of the permanent collection at the Weltmuseum in Vienna. In recognition of her influence and innovation, she was named one of Campaign’s 30 Future Creative Female Leaders in 2018.

cards.title: Creating Surreal Dreamscapes with Photoshop Composites
cards.description:
Join artist Ted Chin, aka TedsLittleDream, as he shares his ongoing journey and evolution as an artist. Ted, whose exquisite composites exude a dreamy and surreal quality, will discuss how he began his journey, how he found his unique voice, tips and tricks he wishes he had learned sooner, and the importance of daydreaming and pushing your imagination to new limits.

In this session, you’ll learn:

  • The importance of storytelling
  • How to ideate concepts for your projects
  • Key elements of photo blending, including lighting, perspective, and color
  • How and when to use generative AI
  • The importance of having fun in creating art
cards.sessionTitle: Creating Surreal Dreamscapes with Photoshop Composites

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Creating Surreal Dreamscapes with Photoshop Composites

eventSpeakers.description: Ted Chin, a digital surrealist from Taiwan now based in San Francisco, is known for his dreamy Photoshop composites, featuring a blend of surrealism and ethereal nature spirits. With a career spanning over nine years, he has worked with clients like Grammy, Apple, and Adobe, even earning the spot as the cover artist for Adobe Photoshop 2021. Motivated by a desire to reveal the world's wonder, Ted's art inspires with its creativity and imagination.

cards.title: Creating Consistent Brand Guidelines for Creative Teams
cards.description:
In the fast-paced world of creative design, maintaining brand consistency across all channels is crucial. Join Adobe Senior Design Evangelist Kladi Vergine to learn how to build robust brand guidelines using InDesign that keep your entire team on the same page. Discover strategies to ensure that your branding efforts are cohesive, efficient, and easily scalable, no matter the size of your team or the scope of your projects.

Become a master of brand guidelines by learning:

  • What makes brand guidelines successful and how to implement them in your projects
  • How to create consistent visual and verbal identity
  • How to use the Publish Online feature in InDesign to streamline the creation and distribution of your brand guidelines
  • Ways to foster collaboration and buy-in from all team members, ensuring guidelines are adhered to
  • How to keep your brand guidelines up-to-date and relevant as your brand evolves
cards.sessionTitle: Creating Consistent Brand Guidelines for Creative Teams

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Award-Winning Designer, Visual Strategist, Instructor, and Author

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Pro Illustrator Techniques and New Features for Next-level Designs
Creating Consistent Brand Guidelines for Creative Teams

eventSpeakers.description:
Kladi is an award-winning designer, visual strategist, instructor, author and Sr. Design Evangelist and Community Advocate at Adobe. Kladi has a long title with an even bigger mission: to empower, inspire, and support the creative community while sharing design and career tips. But most importantly a job that allows Kladi to focus on what she loves: People, Design, and Innovation. Reach out @iamkladi, her DM is always open for a chat.

Kladi runs an Instagram live show “Creative Connection Live” where the creative community comes together every week.

As a self-published author, Kladi's illustrated book, Plant Therapy, won the world-renowned Fedrigoni TOP Designer Award for her unique use of cotton papers and ink. Kladi has also been the winner of Infohackit and Adobe's Creative Jam during San Francisco Design Week.

In addition to her design work, Kladi often leads graphic design masterclasses for Adobe Live, Adobe events in UK and Design tutorials with over 5M views worldwide.

Kladi has also led social media asset creation workshops for House Representatives in Washington, D.C. for over 4 years. Kladi took part in Adobe MAX every year since 2019,in USA and also in UK as a featured speaker in the Design industry.

She was also a speaker at the exciting Illustrator Summit 2021, Creative PRO WEEK conference, Design & Marketing Summit, Design CUTS, and shared workflow tips in Illustrator in Spanish during Talent Land in Guadalajara, Mexico, and again during the Talented at Home. D many more design conferences around the world.

Kladi is a LinkedIn Learning and Creative Live author and producer; she was also named one of the world's top Illustrator instructors by Adobe Education.

Kladi recently authored, designed, and produced the Adobe Illustrator Bootcamp available on Adobe Education Exchange, Adobe Illustrator Conquests (animation & storyline-based onboarding for Ai beginners); Illustrator and Photoshop Cross-App onboarding hybrid tutorials, Creative essentials training course, Adobe Photoshop and Adobe Illustrator Templates with follow-along tutorials, hands-on tutorials available inside Illustrator's Discover Panel and the interconnected hybrid animated Photoshop and Illustrator videos that lead to the hands-on tutorials.

cards.title: Meaningful Designer-Developer Collaboration in the AI Era

tags.title: Creativity and Design in Business
tags.description: Inspiring speakers from the world’s biggest brands and agencies share their expertise and insights about creative leadership in the generative AI era. Topics range from brand reinvention and strategy to creative productivity tips and brave new tools.

cards.description:
When development and design fuse as one team — as opposed to living in their own worlds — the result is the creation of better products that consumers love. But what does this mean in the AI era? Do we risk defaulting to automation, or can we still find ways to embrace AI while not losing the experiences that consumers love? Join Oliver Dore, partner for technology at Work & Co, part of Accenture Song, as he explores a mindset shift that you can take back to your teams and clients and ultimately help drive your personal development.

In this session, you’ll:

  • Learn the foundational mindset needed for consistent designer and developer collaboration
  • See examples of AI in action, unleashing the creative potential of teams
  • Unpack the potential of hyper-acceleration across a range of industries, including healthcare and retail
cards.sessionTitle: Meaningful Designer-Developer Collaboration in the AI Era

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Meaningful Designer-Developer Collaboration in the AI Era

eventSpeakers.description:
Oliver Dore is a technology leader with two decades of experience designing and developing websites and mobile apps. He specializes in modern web technologies, including full-stack application and UI development — with a track record for merging technology and user experience to create extraordinary products.

Dore is known for leading the front-end architecture and implementation on several high-profile and award-winning projects, including the Apple Retail video wall and CMS, ecommerce and employee tools for Aldo, and the responsive client-side booking and management engine for Virgin America. He’s also led digital transformation across retail, restaurants, CPG and mobility for brands like IKEA, Rapha, Cava Grill, Nestle, Embraer, Aero, and the MTA.

Previously, Oliver led development for Google, HBO, and Bloomberg. He is a technology thought leader on topics ranging from AI to data privacy and has been quoted in the Wall Street Journal, Modern Retail, and Forrester Research — and he's a member of the International Academy of Arts and Sciences.

sessionTrack.title: Creativity and Design in Business
sessionTrack.description: Inspiring speakers from the world’s biggest brands and agencies share their expertise and insights about creative leadership in the generative AI era. Topics range from brand reinvention and strategy to creative productivity tips and brave new tools.

cards.title: Get It Moving: Motion Fundamentals to Build Your Brand Image
cards.description:
Is your brand stuck in the world of static? Familiarity with the basics of motion is becoming a must for designers, especially in the ever-scrolling attention battle that is social media, because motion helps your brand stand out. Join motion designer and Adobe Certified Instructor Kyle Hamrick to learn the fundamental concepts of adding motion to a brand’s design and identity – whether you’re looking to grab attention, communicate a consistent message, or express personality. We’ll also explore actionable techniques in Adobe Express, Adobe Premiere Pro, and After Effects that can help bring your designs to life and attract more attention.

You’ll learn:

  • How (and why) to add motion to your existing design skill set
  • The importance of timing, speed, and rhythm in different contexts
  • How to create a meaningful motion identity
  • Approachable animation techniques across multiple Adobe apps
  • Strategies for creating customizable and modular motion assets
cards.sessionTitle: Get It Moving: Motion Fundamentals to Build Your Brand Image

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Get It Moving: Motion Fundamentals to Build Your Brand Image

eventSpeakers.description: Kyle Hamrick is an Emmy-winning motion designer, creative & technical director, Adobe-Certified software trainer, and all-around After Effects & Premiere nerd who loves sharing knowledge. A workflow & efficiency fan who always enjoys a new challenge, Kyle hops between creating everything from live event visuals, animated gifs, efficiently-built templates and IMAX documentaries. He’s also a mediocre guitarist, a lover of dinosaurs and Lego, and a big believer in using creative skills for good.

cards.title: Elevate Your Illustrations and Workflows with Fresco and Illustrator
cards.description:
Join illustrator Natasha Polozenko as she explores workflows in both Adobe Fresco and Illustrator, exploring how the apps work together and independently to create different illustrative effects. This session will focus on character and fashion illustration as a use case — bringing form and fabrics to life through shading, texture, and pattern.

You’ll gain a better understanding of:

  • Different workflows and how each can be used to achieve specific effects in your work
  • Tools and techniques in Adobe Fresco that will simplify your process and elevate your illustrations
  • Applying different techniques to achieve unique stylistic effects with Illustrator
cards.sessionTitle: Elevate Your Illustrations and Workflows with Fresco and Illustrator

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Elevate Your Illustrations and Workflows with Fresco and Illustrator

eventSpeakers.description: Natasha Polozenko AKA Nataszko is an Illustrator, and Educator originally from Sydney Australia, now based in New York City. She creates educational illustration content across Instagram and TikTok and helps creatives level up and gain confidence in their illustration practices through mentorship and online courses.
