tags.description: Inspiring speakers from the world’s biggest brands and agencies share their expertise and insights about creative leadership in the generative AI era. Topics range from brand reinvention and strategy to creative productivity tips and brave new tools.

cards.description: AI is accelerating the creative landscape. How do you incorporate AI workload to ensure your creative breaks through?See how an entirely new workflow was developed involving new tools for Generative AI (using Stable Diffusion) and brought together with the Adobe Creative Suite to tell a compelling story.
cards.sessionTitle: From Dreams to Reality with Generative AI and Creative Suite

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: From Dreams to Reality with Generative AI and Creative Suite

eventSpeakers.description: Alex Vo is a first-generation Vietnamese American film director raised in the Bay Area. He believes in the power of genuine human connection and aims to capture the essence of his subjects with empathy and respect. For him, every story holds the potential to make an impact and spark change. With a camera in hand, Alex uses his lens to shed light on the untold narratives that often go unnoticed. His formal education in Film Production at Full Sail University honed his technical skills, but it was through real-world experience that Alex truly found his voice. Embracing the future of filmmaking, Alex seamlessly integrates AI into his creative workflow, using cutting-edge tools to enhance his storytelling, refine his vision, and bring innovative narratives to life. Currently, Alex is producing a documentary series soon to debut on Hulu, shining a light on untold narratives in the entrepreneurial space.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: From Dreams to Reality with Generative AI and Creative Suite

eventSpeakers.description:
Canning is currently serving as the Director of Developer Relations for AMD. Helping AMD understand and deliver the best products to support the Creator space. John brings a career that has spanned the technology and methodology for creating and delivering XR, games, virtual production and digital humans, from concept to client in his former role as Executive Producer for New Media & Experiential for Digital Domain.

John has endeavored to help companies and causes not only tell their stories through dynamic media but also leverage disruptive and transformative technology to maximize the creative impact.

John has also served as the Chairman of the board for the New Media Council for the Producers Guild of America representing the interests of producers of broadband video, games, transmedia, iTV and XR content in the entertainment industry.

Previously, John was the VP of Interactive Experiences for NBC Entertainment Digital, where he developed native interactive experiences, be they 2nd screen, social media, or virtual reality for some of the largest shows on TV, such as The Voice, World of Dance, America’s Got Talent, Blindspot, Blacklist, and more.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: From Dreams to Reality with Generative AI and Creative Suite

eventSpeakers.description: Mark J. Sebastian is a visionary in the digital media landscape, dedicated to empowering and amplifying voices through the transformative power of photo and video. With a rich skill set encompassing photo generation, manipulation, and composites, as well as motion graphics, animation, and graphic design, Mark crafts captivating content for web, television, print, and social media. Mark leads the charge in producing innovative digital content, from concept to delivery. He spearheads an international team of designers across three continents, driving creative problem-solving through empathy and relentless execution. Mark's focus is at the intersection of technology and entertainment, collaborating with tech giants such as AMD, Apple, and Nvidia, and creating content for celebrities and high-profile clients including The Black Eyed Peas, Maroon 5, and the Kardashians. His diverse experience bridges the gap between cutting-edge technology and creative expression, making him a unique asset in the digital media industry.

sessionTrack.title: Creativity and Design in Business
sessionTrack.description: Inspiring speakers from the world’s biggest brands and agencies share their expertise and insights about creative leadership in the generative AI era. Topics range from brand reinvention and strategy to creative productivity tips and brave new tools.

cards.title: Photoshop Illustration: Crafting and Designing Characters
cards.description:
Join artist Renee di Cherri as she lets you peek under the hood of her illustration files and shows you her time-tested tricks to developing eye-catching, evocative illustrated characters in Photoshop. Discover key tools and techniques that will help you streamline your illustrations and take them to the next level.

In this session, you’ll learn how to:

  • Build and save a workspace perfect for drawing
  • Build a colorful mood board for reference and inspiration for character costume pieces, fabric textures, dynamic poses, and more
  • Find and refine Photoshop brushes for perfect strokes to add textures, lighting dimensions, and tiny details that make your characters stand out
  • Quickly thumbnail unique character silhouettes to save time, and explore options, details, and poses
  • Sketch on the go with Fresco and refine your artwork in Photoshop with lossless roundtripping between the two apps
cards.sessionTitle: Photoshop Illustration: Crafting and Designing Characters

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Photoshop Illustration: Crafting and Designing Characters

eventSpeakers.description: Renée di Cherri thinks everyone should draw - even you. She’s a digital artist with a passion for tech, previously working for Adobe and Autodesk. Her creative mediums span both 2D & 3D, illustration, fabrication, and video editing. In her art, she loves to mix cute and creepy styles for an unexpected vibe. She has a love of fast cars, garlic cheese, and the beautiful state of California.

cards.title: MAX Sneaks - ASL

tags.title: Mainstage Broadcast
tags.description: Don’t miss the Mainstage Broadcast of Keynotes, Sneaks, Creativity Super Sessions, and Luminary Sessions. You’ll get the latest creative industry trends and updates to Adobe Creative Cloud and be inspired by stories from top luminary speakers.

cards.description: Get a sneak peek into what’s brewing in Adobe Research. MAX Sneaks is where Adobe engineers give a first look at potential future technologies, which may or may not make it into upcoming versions of Adobe products.
cards.sessionTitle: MAX Sneaks - ASL

eventSpeakers.description: Gabriel Huang joined Adobe research in Feb 2023, his contributions have been chiefly directed towards pioneering technologies that revolutionize video effects editing, making video effects editing easier and more accessible.

Avneet Kaur is a Computer Scientist at Adobe, where she’s spent the past 5 years working on Adobe Illustrator. She started her journey at Adobe as a New College Graduate (NCG) and has contributed to features like version history and share for review. Recently, she’s been involved in text-to-vector technology, further enhancing the tools available for designers.

Li-Yi is a research scientist with broad interests in computer graphics and human-computer interaction. His recent focus is on motion graphics, with contributions to Fresco motion, Express caption video, and generative animation. He also likes to draw and animate both for fun and research.

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Head of Sound Design AI Research
eventSpeakers.description: Justin is a Senior Research Scientist and member of the Audio Research Group at Adobe Research in San Francisco. Previously he was a senior research scientist at the Music and Audio Research Laboratory and Center for Urban Science and Progress of New York University. His work at Adobe focuses on audio understanding and audio for video, developing technologies for automatic audio tagging, recommending music for a video, detecting filler words in speech, and searching for music that's similar to an input song, to name some examples. His research focuses on the application of machine learning and signal processing to audio & video, with applications in machine listening, audiovisual and multi-modal understanding, representation learning & self-supervision, audio for video, music information retrieval, bioacoustics, environmental sound analysis, and open source software & data.

Veronica is an interdisciplinary designer, artist, and speaker, specialized in creating innovative experiences powered by AI/ML and emerging technology. At Adobe, Veronica led key AI/ML initiatives like Adobe Firefly and created experiences that have reached millions of users worldwide.

Yu Shen is an Adobe Research Scientist, with research experiences cover LLM, computer vision, 3D perception, multi-modality learning, robust learning, etc., in real-world applications like LLM-based copilot, AR/VR/Metaverse, autonomous driving, virtual try-on, etc. He received Computer Science Ph.D. degree in University of Maryland, advised by Prof. Ming Lin.

Mengwei is a Research Scientist at Adobe. She obtained her Ph.D. in Computer Science from NYU in 2023. Her research spans computer vision and deep learning, focusing on robust and controllable image-to-image generation, with diverse applications in image restoration, editing, and composition.

Dr. Shruti Agarwal is a research scientist at Adobe’s Content Authenticity Initiative team. Her research focuses on building tools for multimedia forensics, content authenticity, and content provenance. Before joining Adobe, she was a postdoc at CSAIL MIT and a lecturer for the Computer Vision course in the MIDS program at Berkeley School of Information. She finished her PhD in CS at UC Berkeley under the guidance of Prof. Hany Farid in his world-leading lab on media forensics. During her PhD, she developed semantic tools using soft biometrics for person-specific deepfake detection. Currently, her research has focused on robust watermarking and content attribution. Her research is regularly published in top-tiered Computer Vision conferences and workshops. She has also been part of the organizing committee and was a keynote speaker in the past CVPR workshop on Media Forensics.

Zhiqin is a research scientist at Adobe based in Seattle. He received his PhD and Master's degree from Simon Fraser University, supervised by Prof. Hao (Richard) Zhang, and obtained his Bachelor's degree from Shanghai Jiao Tong University. His research interest is in computer graphics with a specialty in geometric modeling, machine learning, 3D reconstruction, and shape synthesis. He has received numerous awards recognizing his research contribution, including the best student paper award at CVPR 2020, Google PhD Fellowship in 2021, best paper award candidate at CVPR 2023, Alain Fournier Dissertation Award in 2024, and Eurographics PhD Thesis Award in 2024.

Awkwafina’s “government name” is Nora Lum. Nora Lum is an Asian American rapper, writer, and actress. Most recently, Lum earned rave reviews for her performance in Lulu Wang's The Farewell. Before that, she was seen in Warner Brothers features Ocean’s 8, directed by Gary Ross, opposite Sandra Bullock and Cate Blanchett and Crazy Rich Asians , directed by Jon Chu, opposite Constance Wu and Michelle Yeoh.

Lum can be seen in the Universal film Neighbors 2 opposite Seth Rogen, Zac Efron & Rose Byrne. She also starred as ‘Rebecca’ in the independent comedy Dude, written and directed by Olivia Milch. She was also the voice of ‘Quail’ in the Warner Bros. animated feature Storks (2016).

In television, Comedy Central ordered 10 episodes of Awkwafina is Nora from Queens, a series which Lum created and will star in, set to premiere in January 2020. Her other TV credits include: Hulu’s Future Man as well as MTV’s Mary + Jane and Girl Code.

She is self-noted for her extensive satire and comical appeal in her music. Nora sold her first book, a travel guide to New York entitled Awkwafina’s NYC published by Penguin Random House.

She hosts a talk show on YouTube for Astronauts Wanted entitled TAWK. Nora is a cast member on MTV’s show Girl Code and Girl Code Live. On October 2, 2018, Lum hosted Saturday Night Live. She has been featured in The New York Times, Cosmopolitan, New York, The Daily Beast, Gothamist, Jezebel, Gawker, Hairpin, HelloGiggles.com, and Bust.

Kelsey Slay is a graphic designer, content creator, and an Adobe Design Evangelist residing in Tennessee. With her love and passion for art and design, Kelsey aims to empower the next generation of creatives through social media and aid them in starting their own creative journey.

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Chief Strategy Officer and EVP, Design & Emerging Products
eventSpeakers.description:
Scott Belsky leads corporate strategy and development, is responsible for design across the Digital Media and Digital Experience businesses, and is driving incubation of some of Adobe’s fastest growing emerging products. As Chief Strategy Officer, Scott plants flags for future opportunities in all of Adobe’s markets and leads investments, engagements, and acquisitions in the startup ecosystem. Scott is Adobe’s design leader, working to continuously uplevel design of all Adobe products. And he leads development of key emerging products: 3D & Immersive products, Adobe Stock & Marketplace, and Behance.

Prior to this role, Scott was Adobe’s Chief Product Officer for five years, leading development of all Creative Cloud products. Under his leadership, the company launched Adobe Express, brought flagship products like Photoshop and Illustrator to web and mobile platforms, incubated our 3D & Immersive products, and created the Content Authenticity Initiative, which fosters attribution for creators and enables transparency in digital content.

Prior to joining Adobe in December 2017, Scott was a venture investor at Benchmark in San Francisco. This is Scott’s second tenure at Adobe. He originally joined the company after it acquired Behance in 2012. At that time, he also led Adobe’s mobile and services strategy for Creative Cloud. Scott co-founded Behance in 2006 and served as its CEO for six years. Over the years, Scott has pursued other projects in the creative and investor communities. Those projects include 99U, Behance’s creative think tank and conference, and his two best-selling books, “The Messy Middle” and “Making Ideas Happen.”

Scott has been an advisor on design and product management for leading companies and institutions, including Pinterest, Uber, sweetgreen, Carta, Cheddar, Flexport, Airtable, OpenSea, Ramp, Ro, and Periscope.

Scott holds a bachelor’s degree from Cornell University and an MBA from Harvard Business School. He serves on the advisory board of Cornell University’s Entrepreneurship Program; and the board of trustees for the Smithsonian Cooper Hewitt National Design Museum.

Stacy Martinet has spent her career at the intersection of marketing, media, and technology.

As Adobe’s Vice President of Marketing Strategy and Communications, she leads a global team responsible for internal and external communications, including corporate communications, public affairs, product and customer communications, events, corporate social responsibility, industry analyst relations, as well as worldwide social media and influencer marketing. She first joined Adobe as Sr. Director of Marketing Strategy and Chief of Staff to the Company’s EVP and Chief Marketing Officer.

Before joining Adobe, Stacy was Chief Marketing Officer of Mashable. She was part of the company’s executive team — taking Mashable from a tech blog to a global consumer internet site. As CMO, she guided the company through explosive growth in users and advertisers, three rounds of funding, and a restructuring while architecting the company's marketing and communications strategy and building an integrated marketing organization across brand and demand generation channels.

Prior to Mashable, she spent nearly a decade in corporate communications and digital marketing at The New York Times during the company’s transition to digital which included a transformation of its journalism approach and the introduction of a digital subscription model. She was part of the team that pioneered the company’s first social media strategy and was recognized with the Chairman’s Award for innovation.

She was named by Folio’s Top Women in Media as a Corporate Visionary, as well as named to PR Week’s 40 Under 40 list. Stacy continues to speak and write about digital trends; her work has appeared in Mashable, The New York Times, Ad Week, and Cosmopolitan Magazine.

Stacy holds a patent for viral media content and is a member of several boards, including the Adobe Foundation board, the Ad Council board, and her past service to the New York Women in Communications board. Stacy is a graduate of Towson University.

Devon Rodriguez is the most followed visual artist in the world widely recognized for his hyper-realistic portraits, particularly those drawn or painted on the New York City subway. Born and raised in the Bronx from Puerto Rican and Honduran background, his remarkable journey has been featured in The New Yorker, The New York Times, and on the Today Show. Through the power of social media, Devon uses his platforms to digitally translate his artistic talent to a global audience, creating viral moments with not only strangers he meets on the street, but also notable celebrities such as Joe Biden, Post Malone, Ed Sheeran, Jared Leto, and Robert De Niro. Most recently he has partnered with Meta, Burberry, Coca Cola, and State Farm and launched a comprehensive 7-course education program, designed to teach the intricacies of portrait drawing to individuals of all ages. In the Fall of 2023, Devon's first solo art exhibition garnered overwhelming support with lines stretching around the block. With an impressive collective following of 59 million across various social media platforms such as Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, and Facebook, Devon Rodriguez continues to captivate his multi-generational audience worldwide.

Emonee LaRussa is a 2x Emmy award winning Motion Graphics and Director. For years she has created music visuals for artists like Megan Thee Stallion, Kanye West, Lil Nas X and many more. More recently has been she working with brands such as the Super Bowl LVII, Adobe, The Grammys, Saturday Night Live, and Intel.

Emonee is also the President of JumpStart Designers, a non-profit focused on getting computers to kids in underserved communities. She also provides students with mentorship so that they not only get the tools but the education and opportunities as well.

Jason is a NYC artist, known for bright colors and even brighter themes, commonly found on large scale murals around the world. His work explores the communication of human emotions using organic shapes, bold colors and a strong design aesthetic. Jason has worked with various brands like Coach, Pepsi, Toyota, and Microsoft. He has received global recognition for his work including a Golden Novum Design Award. In 2018, BUMBLE named Jason one of its 100 Most Inspiring New Yorkers. People love Jason for his unforgettable colors and the optimism woven into his work. His relentless positivity and kindness translate across many mediums and applications, and his technicolor murals capture the hearts of everyone who sees them. Jason brings a fresh taste of love and kindness to all of his projects, and desires to use his work to spread love, good vibes, and also do some good in the world.

Heather will speak to the biggest opportunities available to creative and marketing organizations in this moment, and how to harness new tools to supercharge creative flows. She’ll then be joined by Clayton Ruebensaal, Chief Creative Officer at Comcast, for a chat about creativity as a core human value, a brand differentiator, and a business driver.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Creativity Super Session: Human-Centered AI Strategies for Creative Leaders
Creativity Super Session: Human-Centered AI Strategies for Creative Leaders

eventSpeakers.description:
Heather Freeland currently serves as VP of Marketing and Chief Brand Officer at Adobe. She leads all of Adobe's brand marketing globally across the business, overseeing brand strategy and insights, integrated marketing efforts, brand advertising and media, and creative.

Prior to Adobe, she was VP of Marketing at Lyft, leading the function across the company's rideshare, bikeshare, and feet lines of business and overseeing Brand, Product, Growth, Partner, and B2B Marketing as well as Creative. During her time at Lyft, she oversaw the reimagining of the Lyft brand, the reinvention of the team and its operations, and the resurrection of the business post-pandemic.

Previously, Freeland served as the Head of B2B Global Marketing Communications at Meta for 7+ years, where she led brand strategy, creative, product marketing and more, helping to transform the marketing industry through her launch of mobile and video advertising on Facebook, lnstagram, and across the platform. She also served as Vice President of Marketing at the Gilt Groupe and Senior Vice President of Marketing and Sales Strategy for MTV Networks Digital. She also worked for 7+ years at Digitas, helping to lead the advent of digital marketing for brands like Nike and American Express.

From these experiences, she gained a deep understanding of building brands, the media landscape, and marketing technology. She also cultivated a strong operational mindset, helping marketing organizations scale globally, and a deep appreciation for Creative, inspiring and clearing the path for her teams to do their best work. She started her career on Capitol Hill and also worked for a DC-based public relations firm, championing education and health-care causes.

Freeland currently serves on Spotify's marketing advisory council ("Soundboard") and Ridge Ventures' CMO Advisory Council. She graduated from the University of Virginia and holds her MBA from Columbia University. Heather lives in Menlo Park with her husband and two children.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Creativity Super Session: Human-Centered AI Strategies for Creative Leaders
Creativity Super Session: Human-Centered AI Strategies for Creative Leaders

eventSpeakers.description:
Clayton F. Ruebensaal III, serves as Chief Creative Officer at Comcast, leading creative, media, sponsorships and brand strategy. He commands all marketing that drives consumer demand generation. One of Clayton’s key objectives is connecting our creative approach to our business strategy.

Clayton most recently served as EVP and Global CMO for American Express’ B2B business. He previously led Global Brand Management at American Express, and prior to AmEx, Clayton led Global Marketing for The Ritz-Carlton and held leadership positions for world-class advertising agencies BBDO, Deutsch, and BMB for clients including Pepsi, Visa, E*trade, The Economist, and more.

cards.description:
With competition ramping up across all industries, it’s crucial to be remembered and recognized and to evoke emotional resonance as you shape your legacy in business. Join Kristy Campbell, brand identity specialist and founder of Pink Pony Creative, as she reveals why seamlessly integrating your personal brand with business can underpin success. Discover innovative methods to cement your brand’s presence in the hearts and minds of your audience, crafting an unforgettable and instantly recognizable identity in today’s fiercely competitive market.

In this vibrant session, you’ll delve into:

  • Creating your vulnerable character
  • Carving your brand into people’s minds
  • Why people buy from people
  • Taking risks, one step at a time

eventSpeakers.description: Kristy Campbell, founder of Pink Pony Creative, is a New Zealand-based Brand Identity and Graphic Designer renowned for her daring, vibrant, and boundary-pushing approach to branding. With clients all over the world, Kristy believes in the power of cultivating a distinct visual identity to propel businesses to success. She embraces an ‘anything but boring’ aesthetic in design and business, and with a name like “Pink Pony”, you know she works a little differently. Beyond business, Kristy thrives on building vibrant communities within the industry, empowering individuals to showcase their unique personalities and skills, paving the way for their own success.

Anton’s mission is to empower and inspire storytellers across Europe by providing the best tools and resources to help them express their vision and voice. He leverages his expertise in video and photo production, digital marketing, and entrepreneurship to deliver impactful, culturally relevant product messaging, community engagement, and research. Additionally, he co-founded two companies in the media industry, gaining valuable insights and skills in resilience, innovation, and leadership.

eventSpeakers.description: Tina Touli is a London based creative director, multidisciplinary graphic communication designer, maker, speaker and educator (teaches at Central Saint Martins, University of the Arts London). She works in a great variety of design fields, including print and digital design, with different clients, such as Adobe, Dell, HP, Ciroc Vodka, Fiorucci, Tate, Converse, Oppo, Kappa, Glo, Dropbox and Movement Festival. She had the honour to be selected by Print Magazine as one of the 15 best young designers in the world, aged under 30 (2017). Her work has been featured in Communication Arts magazine, Computer Arts magazine, Digital Arts magazine and Creative Review blog among others and design publications such as “Design{h}ers” by Viction:ary. She has been invited to present her work in various events and conferences all over the world, as for example at the Adobe MAX, the FITC Amsterdam and the Bump Festival.

cards.title: 2D to 3D: Moving into the Next Dimension with After Effects
cards.description:
Join Ian Robinson, owner and trainer at Creative 111, as he shares his most valuable tips and techniques for taking 2D motion designs into 3D space. Make your product motion graphics stand out with animated models, lights, cameras, shadows, and more. You’ll learn what to do and what not to do when moving into the third dimension.

This session will cover how to:

  • Transition from 2D to 3D and effectively build your composition
  • Work faster in the third dimension with the Properties panel
  • Get comfortable with 3D cameras, lights, shadows, and materials
  • Use fundamental camera rigging for more direct control of cameras and camera settings
  • Transform your product models from average to spectacular using Substance 3D
cards.sessionTitle: 2D to 3D: Moving into the Next Dimension with After Effects

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Creative Director and Motion Graphics Trainer

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: 2D to 3D: Moving into the Next Dimension with After Effects

eventSpeakers.description: Ian Robinson is a creative director and trainer specializing in motion graphics and visual effects. Working in broadcast for over 20 years with such clients as Discovery Channel, National Geographic International, PBS, and Google. Over the last several years he has enjoyed watching the definition of “broadcast” evolve first hand. As an author and trainer, Ian is the co-founder of the online learning website Creative111, an author for LinkedInLearn- ing, and has written books for Peachpit and Adobe Press. When he’s not designing or teaching, you can often find him exploring the rocky mountains of Colorado.

cards.title: Communication: The Foundation of Branding
cards.description:
Join Ricardo Viramontes, director and founder of the branding people — a design studio with global reach and offices in Mexico, Spain, and Saudi Arabia — on an enlightening journey as he unravels the complexities of the branding ecosystem to its very core: communication. Witness how the branding people pioneered a unique creative process that led them to design over 300 brands across the globe, each tailored to meet diverse communication needs.

In this dynamic session, you’ll:

  • Understand the power of design as a vessel to communicate messages
  • Discover the importance of a cohesive creative process when designing a brand
  • Dive into the studio's pillar principles in branding: aesthetics, functionality, and eloquence
  • Learn the relevance of having a deep understanding of your client’s business, audience, and competitive landscape
  • Get valuable insights across disciplines, such as editorial, color theory, and illustration, to improve your design skills while exploring some of the studio’s most compelling projects
cards.sessionTitle: Communication: The Foundation of Branding

eventSpeakers.description: As a marketer fueled by a profound passion for design, Ricardo founded the branding people in 2012. His studio, with offices in Mexico, Spain and Saudi Arabia, specializes in brand identity and visual communication systems. As the studio’s director, he focuses on shaping the business strategy and integrating innovation processes, while providing tools that foster the team’s personal and professional development. Today, Ricardo leads a versatile team of designers, marketers, content curators, and project managers, who work collaboratively to create branding projects for clients spanning different industries all around the globe.

cards.title: Pro Techniques to Create Compelling Composites
cards.description:
Join Julieanne Kost, digital imaging evangelist at Adobe, to learn how to expedite your creative process using new and established features in Photoshop. Discover how Julieanne seamlessly merges disparate visual elements to create a single, surreal, composited scene. She’ll demonstrate key techniques to incorporate into your workflow that will enhance efficiency from initial concept to final scene.

Topics include:

  • Using the latest Photoshop features powered by Adobe Firefly to spark creativity and streamline your workflows
  • Choosing and unifying elements to create successful compositions
  • Leveraging powerful new and established Photoshop features that will transform your compositing workflow
cards.sessionTitle: Pro Techniques to Create Compelling Composites

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Advanced Tips, Tricks, and Shortcuts in Photoshop
Tips and Tricks to Increase a Photograph’s Impact
Pro Techniques to Create Compelling Composites

eventSpeakers.description: Named one of Fast Company’s “100 Most Creative People in Business,” Julieanne Kost is the Digital Imaging Evangelist Director at Adobe, responsible for fostering relationships with customers through meaningful and inspirational Photoshop and Lightroom instruction. As a highly sought-after speaker for the industry-standard Digital Imaging franchise, she devises and presents motivating and educational training sessions, sharing original techniques and tutorials worldwide — via live events, Adobe.com, and her blog (jkost.com/blog). She is also the author of “Passenger Seat—Creating a Photographic Project from Conception Through Execution” and “Window Seat — The Art of Digital Photography and Creative Thinking”, an accomplished photographer and fine artist, and creator and host of the popular Photoshop Essential Training, Lightroom & Photoshop Workflows, Photoshop Automation Techniques, and the Art of Photoshop Compositing courses for LinkedIn Learning.

cards.title: Spark to Spotlight: Transformation Stories from Passions to Profits

cards.description:
Explore the transformative journeys of creators like Don Marshall and Star Wars Theory as they evolve their passions into successful projects using the Spring by Amaze platform. Through a mix of intimate, documentary-style storytelling and live presentations, you’ll witness how creators overcome challenges and find their creative spark. Each story culminates in the reveal of a new creation, symbolizing their unique path. Join us to see how Adobe Express can empower your own creative journey from spark to spotlight, and see the new partnership between Adobe and Amaze come to life.

In this session, you’ll:

  • Understand how Adobe Express can transform creative ideas into market-ready projects.
  • Learn through real-world examples how to navigate the creative process, from inspiration to execution
  • Get inspired by personal stories of creators who have successfully leveraged Adobe Express to elevate their work
  • Experience the live reveal of new creations, offering practical insights into the tools and techniques used

Aaron is passionate about creator success and is committed to unleashing potential for all creators.

cards.title: Photo Enhancements Made Easy with Lightroom for Mobile & Web
cards.description:
Did you know that you can easily enhance the look of your photos using Photoshop Lightroom from virtually any device, regardless of your location? Join photo educator Brian Matiash as he shares simple techniques to get great-looking photos in no time. We’ll explore the creative opportunities and benefits of Lightroom cloud-based apps by starting an edit in Lightroom for mobile and completing it using Lightroom for web. Note: This session covers Lightroom, not Lightroom Classic.

Brian will show you how to:

  • Easily apply stunning photo edits with just a few taps (or clicks)
  • Apply one-click presets and edit your photos using Lightroom in a web browser
  • Create different versions of your photos tailored to specific social media and web destinations
  • Effortlessly sync your albums and edits between Lightroom for mobile and web
cards.sessionTitle: Photo Enhancements Made Easy with Lightroom for Mobile & Web

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Optimize Lightroom Workflow with SanDisk Storage Solutions
Photo Enhancements Made Easy with Lightroom for Mobile & Web

eventSpeakers.description:
Brian Matiash is a photo educator, trusted brand ambassador for ZEISS Lenses and Sandisk, and published author known for his easygoing style of helping photographers get better-looking photos. He is also the creator of Lightroom Everywhere, a multi-faceted program designed to help photographers maximize their use of Adobe Lightroom across various devices by demonstrating its versatility and power in desktop, mobile, and web environments.

Brian is deeply committed to educating photographers of all skill levels through his online courses, on-location workshops, and email newsletter, focusing on improving technical skills and enhancing creative expression. He further extends his teaching through his popular YouTube channel and blog, which serve as valuable resources for photographers seeking to improve their skills.

Brian has also authored several educational books and hundreds of articles exploring the technical, creative, and philosophical aspects of photography. His writing contributions to well-known photography magazines and blogs cover a wide range of topics, from gear reviews to post-processing techniques, and are highly regarded for their depth and accessibility.

cards.title: See One, Do One, Teach One: Techniques for Mastering Illustrator
cards.description:
Join logo designer James Barnard to see how he uses the SODOTO (See One, Do One, Teach One) methodology to stay masterful in the behemoth that is Illustrator. With the software continuously changing and expanding, James will show how he stays fresh with new features and uses them not only to further his own business, but also to grow a community.

In this session, James will share:

  • The hidden benefits of passing on your learnings
  • Why the SODOTO method helps you retain information and complete projects faster
  • His favorite Illustrator tips and tricks to bust out vectors in no time
cards.sessionTitle: See One, Do One, Teach One: Techniques for Mastering Illustrator

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: See One, Do One, Teach One: Techniques for Mastering Illustrator

eventSpeakers.description:
James Barnard is an award-winning logo designer, seasoned freelancer, design educator, dad and owner of Barnard Co. He specialises in designing logos and visual identities with meaning.

As a former designer for The Daily Telegraph, Bauer Media and Hearst Magazines in the UK, James has nearly 15 years of experience in the industry. These days he runs his freelance logo design business from the Gold Coast, Australia, after emigrating from London in 2021. His aim is to pass on his wide variety of skills in design software to the next generation of designers (and more than 750K followers) through his social platforms.

cards.title: Design Like a Pro: Crafting High-Impact Assets in Photoshop
cards.description:
Join Jesús Ramirez, expert instructor from the popular Photoshop Training Channel (PTC) on YouTube, as he unveils the secrets behind crafting professional assets for film and TV posters. This session will introduce advanced techniques that streamline tasks such as retouching and compositing that you can use to build out your own creative toolkit. Discover the innovative possibilities of Photoshop in this can’t-miss session.

You’ll learn how to:

  • Create the illusion of detail with patterns and blending modes
  • Leverage generative AI to create custom brushes
  • Use Adobe Stock to build out your Photoshop assets
  • Generate assets with Adobe Capture in Photoshop
cards.sessionTitle: Design Like a Pro: Crafting High-Impact Assets in Photoshop

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Graphic Artist, Finisher, Educator, Adobe Community Expert

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Advanced Photoshop Techniques from Two Hollywood Insiders
Design Like a Pro: Crafting High-Impact Assets in Photoshop
Master Photoshop 2025: Exploring Features and Generative AI

eventSpeakers.description: Jesús Ramirez is an Adobe Community Expert, graphic artist and educator specializing in Adobe Photoshop. With over 20 years of professional experience, his clients include Adobe, Microsoft, and Conde Nast. Most recently, he has worked as a Finisher with some of the biggest names in entertainment, creating film and TV posters for CBS, Discovery, HBO, HULU, and Netflix. Jesús has a passion for sharing his expertise and knowledge. He is perhaps best known as the founder of the Photoshop Training Channel, a popular YouTube channel with over 2 million subscribers. As a sought-after speaker, he has participated in over 40 conferences, including some of the largest industry events in Australia, Asia, Latin America, and the US.

cards.title: Return on Creative: Supercharge Creative Impact on TikTok

tags.title: Social Media and Marketing
tags.description: Leverage the power of social media and marketing to elevate your brand, expand your business, and cultivate a devoted audience. Craft compelling content, maximize the impact of every post, and master differentiation in multi-channel marketing.

cards.description:
Hear straight from TikTok experts how innovative tools are making content creation easier, faster, and more accessible than ever. Come learn how to unlock new business possibilities, drive better business results, and create new opportunities to better connect with communities on TikTok. You’ll walk away with TikTok best practices to apply to your business and campaigns — from learning key Adobe features for TikTok creation to understanding that impactful creative content doesn’t just entertain audiences, it drives results for your brand.

You’ll learn:

  • How to create and optimize your TikTok campaigns quickly and easily with Adobe tools
  • How TikTok can help drive your brand’s performance goals
  • How to maximize impact and scale your creative production on TikTok
cards.sessionTitle: Return on Creative: Supercharge Creative Impact on TikTok

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Return on Creative: Supercharge Creative Impact on TikTok
Return on Creative: Supercharge Creative Impact on TikTok

sessionTrack.description: Leverage the power of social media and marketing to elevate your brand, expand your business, and cultivate a devoted audience. Craft compelling content, maximize the impact of every post, and master differentiation in multi-channel marketing.

cards.title: Type and Title Motion Design the Easy Way
cards.description:
Elevate your text game and dive into After Effects type options. Explore motion paths and create captivating text animations. Seamlessly integrate SVG and variable fonts into your designs. Demystify 3D effects in minutes — extrusion, lighting, and camera angles. Join motion design educator Eran Stern on this exhilarating journey into the art of type and title motion design. Whether you’re a seasoned designer or a curious beginner, this session promises inspiration, creativity, and a dash of magic. Let’s make your text dance.

Eran will show you how to:

  • Make your text more legible with lesser known techniques
  • Leverage the built-in animation presets
  • Make the most of path animation
  • Work with SVG and variable fonts
  • Craft 3D typography in minutes
cards.sessionTitle: Type and Title Motion Design the Easy Way

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Motion Design Educator, Adobe Community Expert

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Type and Title Motion Design the Easy Way

eventSpeakers.description: Adobe Certified Instructor, Subject Matter Expert and A.I. Collaborator. Eran is a seasoned educator and motion designer, boasting more than twenty years of expertise in post-production. He has a proven history of aiding designers in enhancing their skills in visual effects and motion graphics. Eran has developed online courses for LinkedIn Learning, showcasing his commitment to education in the digital age. He actively shares his vast knowledge through weekly updates on his YouTube channel, striking a unique balance between geekiness and coolness.

cards.title: PepsiCo Design’s GenAI Blueprint: Empowering Creative Teams
cards.description:
PepsiCo Design’s approach to integrating AI into their workflows for the iconic brand has been intentional, bold, and consistently on-brand. Join senior design manager Daniela Maldonado and associate design manager Veronica Campbell as they share their approach to driving AI adoption for PepsiCo’s design teams — and why they’re pursuing a strategy rooted in human creativity.

In this session, you’ll learn:

  • How the PepsiCo Design team got started with generative AI — and what their process looks like
  • Best practices for scaling AI adoption while keeping generated assets on-brand and aligned with your core design principles
  • Why it matters to empower creative teams with creative tech — not the other way around
cards.sessionTitle: PepsiCo Design’s GenAI Blueprint: Empowering Creative Teams

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: PepsiCo Design’s GenAI Blueprint: Empowering Creative Teams

eventSpeakers.description:
As a creative leader at PepsiCo Design and Innovation Center, Daniela spearheads the visual identity of iconic beverage brands, currently leading Pepsi, North America. With over a decade of experience, she seamlessly blends strategic insight with innovation, driving high-impact campaigns, partnerships, and brand activations for key cultural moments like the Super Bowl and NBA All-Star Weekend.

Her passion for merging creativity with technology is transforming collaboration within the design team, especially through the integration of generative AI. Thriving on crafting strategies that shape pop culture and connect with the masses, her work has earned international recognition.

Outside of work, she’s an avid traveler and live music enthusiast, constantly drawing inspiration from the world around her. Dedicated to staying ahead of industry trends, she’s also pursuing an MBA at the University of Illinois.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: PepsiCo Design’s GenAI Blueprint: Empowering Creative Teams

eventSpeakers.description: Veronica Campbell is an Associate Design Manager at PepsiCo Design and Innovation Center, where she drives design strategy for the Global Foods Group, ensuring brands like Doritos and Cheetos maintain a cohesive look across diverse markets. She began her career at Universal Music Group, creating album artwork and campaigns for artists such as Shawn Mendes, Bon Jovi, and Noah Kahan, before joining The Design Center as a designer and illustrator for Mtn Dew and Pepsi. Driven by a deep curiosity and a passion for continuous learning, she constantly seeks new ways to innovate and elevate brand experiences. Known for her dynamic energy, collaborative spirit, and positive approach, Veronica blends creativity with strategic thinking, inspiring teams and driving impactful design solutions that elevate the quality of design across PepsiCo's global brands.

cards.title: Master Audio Editing in Premiere Pro and Adobe Audition
cards.description:
The importance of high-quality audio cannot be overemphasized. Join Adobe Certified Instructor Abba Shapiro as he showcases tools and techniques for professional audio editing and mixing using Adobe Premiere Pro and Adobe Audition. We’ll explore the different audio track types, when to use the Audio Clip Mixer versus the Audio Track Mixer, multichannel audio routing, and getting the most out of the Essential Sound panel. This session is designed for intermediate to advanced video editors who are already familiar with Premiere Pro.

Abba will cover:

  • The Premiere Pro Audio Workspace and Essential Sound panel
  • Enhancing speech and repairing problematic audio using built-in audio effects in Premiere Pro
  • Mastering the basics of audio mixing, including how to create submixes in the Audio Track Mixer
  • Normalizing audio using the compressor and limiter effects
  • Sending files to Adobe Audition for advanced cleanup
cards.sessionTitle: Master Audio Editing in Premiere Pro and Adobe Audition

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Master Audio Editing in Premiere Pro and Adobe Audition

eventSpeakers.description: Abba Shapiro is an Adobe Master Trainer, certifying university and training center instructors to teach Adobe Premiere Pro. Abba is also an award-winning writer/producer/director. He has worked for a wide range of commercial, corporate and federal clients, including: USA Today, NASCAR, The Associated Press, NASA, Univision, Major League Baseball, Showtime, Viacom, The Discovery Channel, and CNN. Over the past 15 years Abba has created on-line training courses covering everything from Video Editing and Color Correction to how to shoot, light, and edit an interview. His courses air on CreativeLive, LinkedIn Learning, and RippleTraining. He is also the author of several video editing books. Abba also is a regular speaker at several international broadcasting conferences including NAB, IBC, InterBee, Photoshop World, and AdobeMAX. Some of the courses he teaches include, Video Editing, Scriptwriting, and all aspects of Video Production. When Abba is not bouncing around the globe teaching and consulting, he is probably following his passion, chasing light and shooting photos.

cards.title: The Art of 3D and Motion Design with Cantina Creative

tags.title: 3D
tags.description: Add the power of 3D to your design skillset and take your career to new heights. Discover how to create scenes, combine and blend shapes, and add photorealistic models to your work without disruptive changes to your process.

cards.description:
Join us for an exciting journey into the heart of cinematic imagination with Cantina Creative, the heroes behind some of today’s most iconic motion design visuals. Co-founder Stephen Lawes and motion design artist Julianne Dome will reveal their secrets to crafting 3D motion design for blockbuster hits like the Marvel franchise and The Hunger Games series. Cantina Creative can show you how to transform any brand assets into detailed 3D works of art.

You’ll learn how to:

  • Seamlessly blend artistry and technology to build tactile-looking motion designs using After Effects and Substance 3D
  • Craft every detail of 3D assets to achieve stunning looks — and embrace imperfections — along the way
  • Assemble 3D scenes using techniques based on real-world production that transforms a project from ordinary to extraordinary
cards.sessionTitle: The Art of 3D and Motion Design with Cantina Creative

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: The Art of 3D and Motion Design with Cantina Creative

eventSpeakers.description: Stephen Lawes is an animation and visual effects veteran who has worked on a wide array of high profile commercial and feature film projects. As co-founder and Creative Director of Cantina Creative, he has helped oversee the growth of the company for the last 14 years. Before opening Cantina Creative, Lawes spent two years as Creative Director at Pixel Liberation Front, where he supervised a team of artists on academy award-winning films. The work on these films encompassed HUD design and animation as well as set extension and matte painting. Prior to PLF, Lawes worked in a variety of senior creative roles on such notable films as Sky Captain and the World of Tomorrow, The Departed, Speed Racer, and Shutter Island. Lawes started as a commercial director at Duck Soup production in Santa Monica, where he utilized his animation skills for commercial clients like Hasbro, Disney and Coca-Cola. After which he joined the Picture Mill and segued into designing main titles for both feature films and television shows, including The Sixth Sense, Chicken Run, Judging Amy and Bones.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: The Art of 3D and Motion Design with Cantina Creative

eventSpeakers.description: Julianne Dome is a CG supervisor and artist at Cantina Creative, specializing in CG workflows and photoreal design. Her portfolio spans more than a decade of work in the film industry, lending her talents in countless high-profile projects including: The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power, Avengers: Infinity War and Hotel Artemis. Her passion for 3D design and concept imagery sparked and flourished while attending the University of Southern California, where she graduated with a degree in Architecture and a minor in Cinematic Arts. As a SoCal native deeply passionate about design and captivated by "The Industry," she truly feels there is no better place for her to call home than Los Angeles. On the weekends, you'll find her in the great outdoors: hiking, camping, and playing with her dogs.

sessionTrack.title: 3D
sessionTrack.description: Add the power of 3D to your design skillset and take your career to new heights. Discover how to create scenes, combine and blend shapes, and add photorealistic models to your work without disruptive changes to your process.

cards.title: Ripples to Waves: Visual Storytelling for Social Impact
cards.description:
Go behind the scenes with Nacho Corbella, creative director of Ripple Effect Images, as he shares how this filmmaking and photography nonprofit is leveraging Creative Cloud for impact storytelling to build greater interconnectedness in addressing human challenges and preserving our shared planet for future generations.

This session will cover:

  • Insight into the entire social impact filmmaking lifecycle, from idea conception and preproduction to film distribution, using examples from Ripple’s film Mapping Survival
  • Collaborating across global teams to maximize creativity while also ensuring consistency and efficiency
  • Engaging local communities in crowd-created content and equipping them to tell compelling impact stories continuously
  • Creating accessible content libraries to engage audiences on key issues and inspire action at a scale that can trigger viral movements supporting your cause
  • Easy ways to create impact storytelling content with Adobe Express to enhance your content creation process
cards.sessionTitle: Ripples to Waves: Visual Storytelling for Social Impact

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Ripples to Waves: Visual Storytelling for Social Impact

eventSpeakers.description:
Nacho Corbella is an award-winning visual journalist heading Storytelling at Ripple Effect Images as its Creative Director and Executive Producer. Previously, he was a Senior Producer of the features video team at Univision News Digital, covering the U.S. and Latin America through video, photography, animation, and design.

Whether in the field chasing and recording wild bulls, behind the desk editing powerful stories of women making a change in their communities, crafting animations and motion graphics to support mental health in Africa, or giving workshops throughout the Americas, Nacho is always helping tell powerful visual stories.

Nacho’s work has been published by media organizations such as National Geographic, NPR, The New York Times, The Washington Post, Time magazine, El Pais, Univision and UNHCR and the projects he's worked on have received awards from the Emmys, World Press Photo, Ortega y Gasset, Rey de España, Hillman Prize, POYi, SXSW, Webbys, Overseas Press Club, Alfred du Pont, Robert F. Kennedy, NPPA, Best of Photojournalism, Scripps Howard Foundation, SND, ONA, SPJ, multiple film festivals, and the World Health Organization.

cards.title: Balancing Fantasy and Authenticity in the Era of AI-Generated Imagery
cards.description:
What does authenticity mean in a time when generative AI is transforming our visual landscape? In this session, join Brenda Milis, Principal of Consumer and Creative Insights for Adobe Stock, as she explores how creatives and brands can balance the consumer appetite for fantastical, escapist visuals with the desire to see diverse, accurate imagery that reflects authentic people and experiences.

This discussion will touch on:

  • How cultural developments are shifting what’s considered authentic representation, and how creatives can produce relatable, accessible, and relevant work
  • What brand transparency means, and why it’s critical for gaining audience trust and loyalty
  • What people in different age groups expect from brand visuals, and what inspires them to engage
cards.sessionTitle: Balancing Fantasy and Authenticity in the Era of AI-Generated Imagery

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Principal of Consumer and Creative Insights for Adobe Stock

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Balancing Fantasy and Authenticity in the Era of AI-Generated Imagery

eventSpeakers.description:
Brenda Milis is an award-winning photography and creative director whose life-long interest in culture and media fuels her passion for identifying visual trends and their cultural significance in an always-changing creative landscape.

At Adobe, Brenda leads trends research, mapping out the cultural shifts driving the kinds of content growing in commercial relevance and consumer appeal. Brenda’s work supports both Adobe Stock’s content acquisition strategy and enterprise clients’ evolving visual and brand messaging to ensure ongoing audience engagement in an increasingly competitive creative environment.

Before coming to Adobe, Brenda applied her talent for elevating and evolving brand voice and style for many media outlets, including WSJ magazine, Refinery 29, Bloomberg, Vox, Time magazine, Marie Claire, Outside magazine, Men's Health and Fitness magazines as well as serving as founding photo director of Style.com/Vogue Runway.

cards.title: Get the Look: Color Correction and Grading in Premiere Pro
cards.description:
Join video, film, and television workflow expert Karl Soule for an in-depth look at color in Adobe Premiere Pro. You’ll learn important strategies to improve both the aesthetic and the technical quality of your sequence. This session is meant for those who have experience using Premiere Pro but may not be familiar with the essentials of the Lumetri Color panel and color management.

In this session, you’ll learn how to:

  • Read scopes to better visualize color and brightness issues, and correct for them
  • Create your own preset looks in Premiere Pro, or save out LUTs for use elsewhere
  • Understand LOG footage, when to use transforms in Premiere Pro, and when to turn them off
  • Use color managed workflows for improved accuracy
  • Understand and work effectively with HDR footage, even in an SDR sequence
cards.sessionTitle: Get the Look: Color Correction and Grading in Premiere Pro

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Video, Film, and Television Workflow Specialist

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Get the Look: Color Correction and Grading in Premiere Pro

eventSpeakers.description: Karl Soule’ works for Adobe in Los Angeles, focused on Film and Television workflows, and has supported editorial teams on films and television shows since moving to LA in 2016. As an Adobe employee for over 20 years, Karl has presented and evangelized for the video and audio tools worldwide. Karl is a co-author of the Adobe Best Practices for Long Form and Episodic, found here: https://helpx.adobe.com/premiere-pro/using/long-form-episodic-best-practices.html

cards.title: Photoshop + Lightroom: The Powerhouse Pair
cards.description:
Join headshot photographer and retoucher Kristina Sherk as she demonstrates why the saying “Teamwork makes the dreamwork” perfectly describes the symbiotic relationship between Photoshop and Photoshop Lightroom Classic. In this session, Kristina will share tips and tricks, including how to add a brand-specific look and feel, to increase productivity while using these programs in tandem.

During this session, you’ll learn super skills like:

  • Increasing productivity while using Photoshop and Lightroom Classic together
  • Harnessing the power of AI masking for batch retouching
  • Utilizing creative tools to add uniformity to various photos
  • Using Photoshop and Adobe Firefly to improve inconsistent imagery to add a brand-specific look and feel
cards.sessionTitle: Photoshop + Lightroom: The Powerhouse Pair

eventSpeakers.description: For the past 18 years, Kristina Sherk has been a retoucher and Photoshop educator based out of Washington, D.C. She loves “translating Photoshop” for photographers and subsequently, has spoken at CreativeLive, Photoshop World, KelbyOne, Adobe, Canon, LinkedIn Learning, ImagingUSA and WPPI. Helping over one million people learn Photoshop and Lightroom led her to successfully launch her own online learning platform, where she hosts over 40 hours of Photoshop and Lightroom education.

cards.title: Non-Destructive Type, Textures, and Drawing Techniques in Illustrator
cards.description:
Technical Level: Intermediate

At DKNG Studios, the work of design and illustration duo Dan Kuhlken and Nathan Goldman hinges on the ability to work quickly and efficiently in Illustrator. This applies to both the initial creation of a project and all the iterations and changes along the way — from their own internal revisions to change requests from their clients.

In this session, Dan and Nathan will explore how they:

  • Keep Illustrator content live and editable through every stage of a project
  • Natively build textures in Illustrator
  • Revise custom, unexpanded type on the fly
  • Intuitively build shape-based illustrations
cards.sessionTitle: Non-Destructive Type, Textures, and Drawing Techniques in Illustrator

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Non-Destructive Type, Textures, and Drawing Techniques in Illustrator

eventSpeakers.description: Dan Kuhlken’s journey as a fine artist began in childhood with a passion for painting and drawing and continued through his college years at CSULB where he began to hone his particular fusion of design and illustration. He met future business partner Nathan Goldman in high school where the two bonded over their shared interest in design and music, which in turn led to their first professional collaboration, creating gig posters for the world-famous Troubadour in Los Angeles. This initial collaboration led to the launch of DKNG as a professional design and illustration partnership. Today Dan serves as the lead illustrator for DKNG. Dan prides himself on being an illustration chameleon, working in many styles but with an emphasis in vector illustration, and specializing in producing screen printed work. As a member of a design duo where each partner wears many hats, Dan also leads the marketing and retail arms of DKNG. Part of those marketing efforts include a passion for sharing the DKNG process through videos, classes, and workshops. Over the past 15+ years, DKNG has garnered recognition for their work in poster design, branding, packaging, and advertising for clients including the United Nations, Nike, Audi, Clif Bar, USA Today, USPS, The Today Show, StubHub, and Disney, and for some of their favorite musical artists including Leon Bridges, The Black Keys, The National, Tom Petty, Eric Clapton, Jack White, and Van Morrison. When not working with clients, Dan is actively building DKNG’s own line of products including playing cards, art prints, and enamel pins. Dan lives in Los Angeles, California and is currently enjoying his newfound duties as a first time dad.

speakerSessions.sessionTitle: Non-Destructive Type, Textures, and Drawing Techniques in Illustrator

eventSpeakers.description: Nathan Goldman was initially drawn to the world of graphic design as a child, learning from his aunt who worked as a brand and textile designer. He eventually went on to graduate from the University of Southern California’s School of Film & Television with an emphasis in art Nathan Goldman was initially drawn to the world of graphic design as a child, learning from his aunt who worked as a brand designer. He eventually went on to graduate from the University of Southern California’s School of Film & Television with an emphasis in art direction and went on to work in the art department at Warner Bros. Television. Prior to joining DKNG as a full-time Creative Director, Nathan served as Director of Design at the USC Design Studio. He originally met future business partner Dan Kuhlken in high school where the two bonded over their shared interest in design and music, which in turn led to their first professional collaboration, creating gig posters for the world-famous Troubadour in Los Angeles. This initial collaboration led to the launch of DKNG as a professional design and illustration partnership. Today Nathan heads up the graphic design wing of DKNG. Nathan also has a passion for typography that comes in handy for the team’s lettering and branding projects. As a member of a design duo where each partner wears many hats, Nathan leads the client-facing and business strategy arms of DKNG. Over the past 12+ years, DKNG has garnered recognition for their work in poster design, branding, packaging, and advertising for clients including the United Nations, Nike, Audi, Clif Bar, USA Today, USPS, The Today Show, StubHub, and Disney, and for some of their favorite musical artists including Leon Bridges, The Black Keys, The National, Eric Clapton, Jack White, and Van Morrison. Outside of client-based projects, the partners at DKNG continue to expand their own line of products including playing cards, art prints, and enamel pins. Nathan lives in San Diego.

cards.title: Project Perfect Blend
cards.description: This technology features generative color, lighting, and shadow harmonization for image compositions. Photos of humans or objects can be added to another photo and harmonized so that the color and lighting matches the target photo.
cards.sessionTitle: Project Perfect Blend

eventSpeakers.description: Mengwei is a Research Scientist at Adobe. She obtained her Ph.D. in Computer Science from NYU in 2023. Her research spans computer vision and deep learning, focusing on robust and controllable image-to-image generation, with diverse applications in image restoration, editing, and composition.

cards.title: Project Scenic
cards.description: Makes it possible for the creation and control of every aspect of 3D scenes using simple phrases, then using generative AI to make the perfect image.
cards.sessionTitle: Project Scenic

eventSpeakers.description: Yu Shen is an Adobe Research Scientist, with research experiences cover LLM, computer vision, 3D perception, multi-modality learning, robust learning, etc., in real-world applications like LLM-based copilot, AR/VR/Metaverse, autonomous driving, virtual try-on, etc. He received Computer Science Ph.D. degree in University of Maryland, advised by Prof. Ming Lin.

cards.title: Project Know How
cards.description: Introduces the ability to attach content credentials to images even when the image is printed and displayed on a physical object (e.g. photo-frame, a shopping bag or a mug.)
cards.sessionTitle: Project Know How

eventSpeakers.description: Dr. Shruti Agarwal is a research scientist at Adobe’s Content Authenticity Initiative team. Her research focuses on building tools for multimedia forensics, content authenticity, and content provenance. Before joining Adobe, she was a postdoc at CSAIL MIT and a lecturer for the Computer Vision course in the MIDS program at Berkeley School of Information. She finished her PhD in CS at UC Berkeley under the guidance of Prof. Hany Farid in his world-leading lab on media forensics. During her PhD, she developed semantic tools using soft biometrics for person-specific deepfake detection. Currently, her research has focused on robust watermarking and content attribution. Her research is regularly published in top-tiered Computer Vision conferences and workshops. She has also been part of the organizing committee and was a keynote speaker in the past CVPR workshop on Media Forensics.

cards.title: Project Hi-Fi
cards.description: Makes possible real-time high-fidelity visualization from low-fidelity input using generative AI. Any part of the screen and even live video can be captured and used as a guide for fast image generation.
cards.sessionTitle: Project Hi-Fi

eventSpeakers.description: Veronica is an interdisciplinary designer, artist, and speaker, specialized in creating innovative experiences powered by AI/ML and emerging technology. At Adobe, Veronica led key AI/ML initiatives like Adobe Firefly and created experiences that have reached millions of users worldwide.

cards.title: Project In Motion
cards.description: This introduces the ability to create easy animation with precise control, and then turn those animations into a video through use of generative AI prompts describing the desired content.
cards.sessionTitle: Project In Motion

eventSpeakers.description: Li-Yi is a research scientist with broad interests in computer graphics and human-computer interaction. His recent focus is on motion graphics, with contributions to Fresco motion, Express caption video, and generative animation. He also likes to draw and animate both for fun and research.

cards.title: Project Turntable
cards.description: With this technology a 2D vector drawing can be arbitrarily rotated in 3D, resulting in a 2D vector art representing the object from the new view.
cards.sessionTitle: Project Turntable

eventSpeakers.description: Zhiqin is a research scientist at Adobe based in Seattle. He received his PhD and Master's degree from Simon Fraser University, supervised by Prof. Hao (Richard) Zhang, and obtained his Bachelor's degree from Shanghai Jiao Tong University. His research interest is in computer graphics with a specialty in geometric modeling, machine learning, 3D reconstruction, and shape synthesis. He has received numerous awards recognizing his research contribution, including the best student paper award at CVPR 2020, Google PhD Fellowship in 2021, best paper award candidate at CVPR 2023, Alain Fournier Dissertation Award in 2024, and Eurographics PhD Thesis Award in 2024.

cards.title: Project Clean Machine
cards.description: This video-editing technology enables removal of flashes from photo flashes or fireworks, as well as objects temporarily obstructing the camera, resulting in perfectly unobstructed video.
cards.sessionTitle: Project Clean Machine

eventSpeakers.description: Gabriel Huang joined Adobe research in Feb 2023, his contributions have been chiefly directed towards pioneering technologies that revolutionize video effects editing, making video effects editing easier and more accessible.

cards.title: Project Super Sonic
cards.description: Using a prompt, a user can generate sound effects for a video by selecting an object and describing what sound is needed. They can also use their voice as input to guide the timing of the sound.
cards.sessionTitle: Project Super Sonic

eventSpeakers.globalJobtitle: Head of Sound Design AI Research
eventSpeakers.description: Justin is a Senior Research Scientist and member of the Audio Research Group at Adobe Research in San Francisco. Previously he was a senior research scientist at the Music and Audio Research Laboratory and Center for Urban Science and Progress of New York University. His work at Adobe focuses on audio understanding and audio for video, developing technologies for automatic audio tagging, recommending music for a video, detecting filler words in speech, and searching for music that's similar to an input song, to name some examples. His research focuses on the application of machine learning and signal processing to audio & video, with applications in machine listening, audiovisual and multi-modal understanding, representation learning & self-supervision, audio for video, music information retrieval, bioacoustics, environmental sound analysis, and open source software & data.

cards.title: Project Remix a Lot
cards.description: This technology features creation of a design layout from a sketch which is then remixed across a wide variety of sizes and shapes.
cards.sessionTitle: Project Remix a Lot

eventSpeakers.description: Avneet Kaur is a Computer Scientist at Adobe, where she’s spent the past 5 years working on Adobe Illustrator. She started her journey at Adobe as a New College Graduate (NCG) and has contributed to features like version history and share for review. Recently, she’s been involved in text-to-vector technology, further enhancing the tools available for designers.
